Tempest replaced the below rolevar for run-tempest role
- tempest_test_blacklist is replaced by tempest_test_exclude_list
- tempest_black_regex is replaced by tempest_exclude_regex

commit_message:
Switch to new rolevar for run-temepst role

Tempest replaced the below rolevar for run-tempest role
- tempest_test_blacklist is replaced by tempest_test_exclude_list
- tempest_black_regex is replaced by tempest_exclude_regex

old name are still supported for compatibility but we recommend
to switch to new one.

Change-Id: I73c5f0df0854a502e06e7c45f8b4d215a0832bdf

python-openstackclient isn't a "clientlib", this project is in "other" projects

commit_message:
Update TOX_CONSTRAINTS_FILE for stable/wallaby

Update the URL to the upper-constraints file to point to the redirect
rule on releases.openstack.org so that anyone working on this branch
will switch to the correct upper-constraints list automatically when
the requirements repository branches.

Until the requirements repository has as stable/wallaby branch, tests will
continue to use the upper-constraints list on master.

Change-Id: Id48a85e8098b3422478969a57d75edbbc5190167

messages: [{'account_id': 11975, 'date': '2021-03-20 07:27:18.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 11975, 'date': '2021-03-20 09:08:45.000000000', 'content': 'Set Work In Progress'}, {'account_id': 11975, 'date': '2021-03-20 17:21:48.000000000', 'content': "Abandoned\n\nNot needed. It can be fixed in neutron-tempest-plugin's job configuration"}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2021-03-20 07:27:18.000000000', 'message': "Ensure that /etc/openvswitch/system-id.conf file exists

In the neutron's ovn-agent module devstack tries to save generated, or
set by the user system-id to the /etc/openvswitch/system-id.conf file.
It was added in [1]. But it seems that during stack.sh on the fresh
node this file may not exists so we should ensure it exists always.

[1] https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/devstack/+/779991

Related-Bug: #1918656

Change-Id: If4cb83c4945cb91df1ba7fb89e29a1d0b915a28a
"}]
commit_message:
Ensure that /etc/openvswitch/system-id.conf file exists

In the neutron's ovn-agent module devstack tries to save generated, or
set by the user system-id to the /etc/openvswitch/system-id.conf file.
It was added in [1]. But it seems that during stack.sh on the fresh
node this file may not exists so we should ensure it exists always.

[1] https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/devstack/+/779991

Related-Bug: #1918656

Change-Id: If4cb83c4945cb91df1ba7fb89e29a1d0b915a28a

[{'created': '2020-10-09 13:10:04.000000000', 'message': 'Use absolute path during qemu img rebase

During an assisted volume snapshot delete request from Cinder nova
removes the snapshot from the backing file chain. During that nova
checks the existence of such file. However in some cases (see the bug
report) the path is relative and therefore os.path.exists fails.

This patch makes sure that nova uses the volume absolute path to make

commit_message:
Use absolute path during qemu img rebase

During an assisted volume snapshot delete request from Cinder nova
removes the snapshot from the backing file chain. During that nova
checks the existence of such file. However in some cases (see the bug
report) the path is relative and therefore os.path.exists fails.

This patch makes sure that nova uses the volume absolute path to make
the backing file path absolute as well.

Closes-Bug #1885528

Change-Id: I58dca95251b607eaff602783fee2fc38e2421944
(cherry picked from commit b9333125790682f9d60bc74fdbb12a098565e7c2)

revisions:
[{'created': '2021-01-21 15:43:51.000000000', 'message': "zuul: Add nova-ceph-multistore to gate

As discussed in I50d3b874b7e0676436c434be6c059f221041560f the tests
introduced by I846b96ef925c34162cf462da91d854ceacabe022 broke
nova-ceph-multistore thanks to the use of
[workarounds]/never_download_image_if_on_rbd in the job and some image
creation in the test that isn't strictly required.

To ensure breakages like this don't happen again in the future this
change adds the nova-ceph-multistore job to the gate of this plugin.

Related-Bug: #1912607
Change-Id: Ifbdaef0b82cc4b1e77e0ecc440e194e5544fe320
"}, {'created': '2021-01-28 17:51:03.000000000', 'message': "zuul: Add nova-ceph-multistore as a non-voting job

introduced by I846b96ef925c34162cf462da91d854ceacabe022 broke
nova-ceph-multistore thanks to the use of

creation in the test that isn't strictly required.

To ensure breakages like this are visable in the future this change adds
the nova-ceph-multistore job as a non-voting job within this repo.

Related-Bug: #1912607
Change-Id: Ifbdaef0b82cc4b1e77e0ecc440e194e5544fe320
"}]
commit_message:
zuul: Add nova-ceph-multistore as a non-voting job

As discussed in I50d3b874b7e0676436c434be6c059f221041560f the tests
introduced by I846b96ef925c34162cf462da91d854ceacabe022 broke
nova-ceph-multistore thanks to the use of
[workarounds]/never_download_image_if_on_rbd in the job and some image
creation in the test that isn't strictly required.

To ensure breakages like this are visable in the future this change adds
the nova-ceph-multistore job as a non-voting job within this repo.

Related-Bug: #1912607
Change-Id: Ifbdaef0b82cc4b1e77e0ecc440e194e5544fe320

Thank you Steve. May be better to add release notes for the same.'}, {'account_id': 10239, 'date': '2021-03-10 10:56:35.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3: Code-Review-2

I'm sorry to apply -2, but I think this is taking a completely wrong direction. For manual boot management we already have the 'noop' management interface, which does exactly this: rely on manual setting, do not touch anything on the BMC. I'm afraid this patch will hide legitimate failures, especially since we cannot distinguish between different kinds of them. By using a noop management interface an operator clearly indicates their intention to skip boot management and confirms that they have done it manually."}, {'account_id': 11076, 'date': '2021-03-10 11:38:06.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3:

> Patch Set 3: Code-Review-2
> 
> I'm sorry to apply -2, but I think this is taking a completely wrong direction. For manual boot management we already have the 'noop' management interface, which does exactly this: rely on manual setting, do not touch anything on the BMC. I'm afraid this patch will hide legitimate failures, especially since we cannot distinguish between different kinds of them. By using a noop management interface an operator clearly indicates their intention to skip boot management and confirms that they have done it manually.

@Dmitry: I thought this may be useful for the servers that do not support boot mode change. Say an UEFI only redfish system."}, {'account_id': 10239, 'date': '2021-03-10 12:08:48.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3:

But that's what the noop management interface is for, no?"}, {'account_id': 4571, 'date': '2021-03-10 19:18:24.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

Setting the boot *mode* is not supported by HPE Gen9 redfish, but setting the boot *device* is supported, and this worked fine with queens Ironic. The management interface handles both of these functions. We would need to split the management interface into 2 new interfaces to handle this with a noop just for boot mode.'}, {'account_id': 10239, 'date': '2021-03-11 10:24:58.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3:

Per Shivanand:

> HPE Gen9 does not fully support Redfish. Better to use 'ilo' driver with Gen9 hardware

I think we should not add risky hacks to the driver simply because people are using an unsupported hardware type that somehow happened to work. It's unfortunate, but this patch has a potential of hiding actual errors. If you want to go forward with, we need to detect the exact error or exactly HPE Gen 9 (I guess the former is easier)."}, {'account_id': 4571, 'date': '2021-03-14 20:41:55.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

> Patch Set 3:
> 
> Per Shivanand:
> 
> > HPE Gen9 does not fully support Redfish. Better to use 'ilo' driver with Gen9 hardware
> 
> I think we should not add risky hacks to the driver simply because people are using an unsupported hardware type that somehow happened to work. It's unfortunate, but this patch has a potential of hiding actual errors. If you want to go forward with, we need to detect the exact error or exactly HPE Gen 9 (I guess the former is easier).

Assuming unsupported on every status code 400 is much too broad, I agree. The body of the response in this instance is:

    {
        "error": {
            "code": "iLO.0.10.ExtendedInfo",
            "message": "See @Message.ExtendedInfo for more information.",
            "@Message.ExtendedInfo": [
                {
                    "MessageId": "iLO.2.14.UnsupportedOperation"
                }
            ]
        }
    }

Its clear this can be parsed specifically for being an unsupported operation, but I'll wait for some guidance on how to parse this. Should it be exact matching strings from 'code' and 'MessageId'? Just the suffixes ExtendedInfo and UnsupportedOperation?'}, {'account_id': 4571, 'date': '2021-03-14 22:30:56.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3:

> Its clear this can be parsed specifically for being an unsupported operation, but I'll wait for some guidance on how to parse this. Should it be exact matching strings from 'code' and 'MessageId'? Just the suffixes ExtendedInfo and UnsupportedOperation?

OK, I'm looking at the sushy message registry implementation now, and the documented message[1]

So I'm now assuming I can call message_registry.parse_message and there will be a iLO.2.14 registry which includes this message key?

[1] https://hewlettpackard.github.io/ilo-rest-api-docs/ilo5/#ilo-2-13-unsupportedoperation"}, {'account_id': 10239, 'date': '2021-03-15 12:00:46.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3:

Note that I'm still uneasy about trying to support a driver on an explicitly unsupported hardware. But if you'd like to continue in that direction, let's see how it shapes in the end."}, {'account_id': 11655, 'date': '2021-03-15 20:09:45.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3:

revisions:
[{'created': '2021-03-09 03:00:07.000000000', 'message': "WIP Allow driver failure in setting boot mode

Currently if the baremetal boot mode is unknown and the driver doesn't
support setting the boot mode then the error is logged and deployment
continues.

However if the BMC doesn't support setting the boot mode then the
error will propagate and the deploy will fail. This is the case for
HPE Gen9 baremetal, which raises a 400 iLO.2.14.UnsupportedOperation
in response to setting the boot mode.

This is raised from node_set_boot_mode as a RedfishError. This change
adds the DriverOperationError exception to the block which determines
whether to ignore mode set failure.

WIP until there is better test coverage on sync_boot_mode, and to get
feedback on how else this might be handled.

Change-Id: I360ff8180be252de21f5fcd2208947087e332a39
"}, {'created': '2021-03-10 00:54:06.000000000', 'message': "Allow unsupported redfish set_boot_mode

Currently if the baremetal boot mode is unknown and the driver doesn't
support setting the boot mode then the error is logged and deployment
continues.

However if the BMC doesn't support setting the boot mode then the
error will propagate and the deploy will fail. This is the case for
HPE Gen9 baremetal, which raises a 400 iLO.2.14.UnsupportedOperation
in response to setting the boot mode.

This is raised from set_boot_mode as a RedfishError. This change
raises UnsupportedDriverExtension exception instead so that the
deployment can continue.

Change-Id: I360ff8180be252de21f5fcd2208947087e332a39
"}, {'created': '2021-03-10 04:40:13.000000000', 'message': "Allow unsupported redfish set_boot_mode

Currently if the baremetal boot mode is unknown and the driver doesn't
support setting the boot mode then the error is logged and deployment
continues.

However if the BMC doesn't support setting the boot mode then the
error will propagate and the deploy will fail. This is the case for
HPE Gen9 baremetal, which raises a 400 iLO.2.14.UnsupportedOperation
in response to setting the boot mode.

This is raised from set_boot_mode as a RedfishError. This change
raises UnsupportedDriverExtension exception instead so that the
deployment can continue.

Change-Id: I360ff8180be252de21f5fcd2208947087e332a39
"}, {'created': '2021-03-15 20:54:30.000000000', 'message': "Allow unsupported redfish set_boot_mode

Currently if the baremetal boot mode is unknown and the driver doesn't
support setting the boot mode then the error is logged and deployment
continues.

However if the BMC doesn't support getting or setting the boot mode
then setting the boot mode raises an error which results in the deploy
failing. This is the case for HPE Gen9 baremetal, which doesn't have a
'BootSourceOverrideMode' attribute in its system Boot field, and
raises a 400 iLO.2.14.UnsupportedOperation in response to setting the
boot mode.

This is raised from set_boot_mode as a RedfishError. This change
raises UnsupportedDriverExtension exception when the 'mode' attribute
is missing from the 'boot' field, allowing the deployment to continue.

Change-Id: I360ff8180be252de21f5fcd2208947087e332a39

then setting the boot mode raises an error which results in the deploy

'BootSourceOverrideMode' attribute in its system Boot field, and
raises a 400 iLO.2.14.UnsupportedOperation in response to setting the

commit_message:
Allow unsupported redfish set_boot_mode

Currently if the baremetal boot mode is unknown and the driver doesn't
support setting the boot mode then the error is logged and deployment
continues.

However if the BMC doesn't support getting or setting the boot mode
then setting the boot mode raises an error which results in the deploy
failing. This is the case for HPE Gen9 baremetal, which doesn't have a
'BootSourceOverrideMode' attribute in its system Boot field, and
raises a 400 iLO.2.14.UnsupportedOperation in response to setting the
boot mode.

This is raised from set_boot_mode as a RedfishError. This change
raises UnsupportedDriverExtension exception when the 'mode' attribute
is missing from the 'boot' field, allowing the deployment to continue.

Change-Id: I360ff8180be252de21f5fcd2208947087e332a39

commit_message:
tests: Add functional test for vDPA device

Add a simple test to validate behavior with vDPA devices. Most of this
is simply fleshing out the fixtures we use to fake out vDPA devices and
generally tweaking things to make them better.

Change-Id: I1423d8a9652751b667463f90c69eae1a054dd776
Signed-off-by: Stephen Finucane <stephenfin@redhat.com>
Co-authored-by: Sean Mooney <work@seanmooney.info>

Update the URL to the upper-constraints file to point to the redirect
rule on releases.openstack.org so that anyone working on this branch
will switch to the correct upper-constraints list automatically when
the requirements repository branches.

Until the requirements repository has as stable/wallaby branch, tests will

commit_message:
Update TOX_CONSTRAINTS_FILE for stable/wallaby

Update the URL to the upper-constraints file to point to the redirect
rule on releases.openstack.org so that anyone working on this branch
will switch to the correct upper-constraints list automatically when
the requirements repository branches.

Until the requirements repository has as stable/wallaby branch, tests will
continue to use the upper-constraints list on master.

Change-Id: Ieebc2043156cdd340811302630f5f248663d1acc

With RHEL-8.4 we get podman 3.0.x which will complain with
ERRO[0000] Error loading CNI config list file /etc/cni/net.d/87-podman-bridge.conflist: error parsing configuration list: no name

When /etc/cni/net.d/87-podman-bridge.conflist only contains "{}"
Let's set the same default we have in later versions.

Change-Id: I0b121ad25301550d64890ab0f1681d080d991127
'}, {'created': '2021-03-19 08:27:50.000000000', 'message': 'WIP [Train-Only] Set a sane default for podman networks on rhel-8.4

ERRO[0000] Error loading CNI config list file /etc/cni/net.d/87-podman-bridge.conflist: error parsing configuration list: no name

When /etc/cni/net.d/87-podman-bridge.conflist only contains "{}"
Let's set the same default we have in later versions.

Change-Id: I0b121ad25301550d64890ab0f1681d080d991127
'}]
commit_message:
WIP [Train-Only] Set a sane default for podman networks on rhel-8.4

With RHEL-8.4 we get podman 3.0.x which will complain with
ERRO[0000] Error loading CNI config list file /etc/cni/net.d/87-podman-bridge.conflist: error parsing configuration list: no name

When /etc/cni/net.d/87-podman-bridge.conflist only contains "{}"
Let's set the same default we have in later versions.

Change-Id: I0b121ad25301550d64890ab0f1681d080d991127

commit_message:
api: Block unsupported actions with vDPA

There are a number of operations that are known not to work with vDPA
interfaces and another few that may work but haven't been tested. Start
blocking these. In all cases where an operation is blocked a HTTP 409
(Conflict) is returned. This will allow lifecycle operations to be
enabled as they are tested or bugs are addressed.

Change-Id: I7f3cbc57a374b2f271018a2f6ef33ef579798db8
Blueprint: libvirt-vdpa-support

revisions:
[{'created': '2021-02-03 11:16:29.000000000', 'message': "DRAC: Fix a failure to create virtual disk

PERC H740P controllers supports RAID mode and Enhanced HBA mode.
When the controller is in Enhanced HBA, it creates single disk
RAID0 virtual disks of NON-RAID physical disks.
Hence the user's request for VD creation with supported RAID
fails due to no available physical disk.
This patch checks the Perc H740P controllers whether it supports
enhanced HBA mode and if controllers are found in enhanced HBA
mode it converts back to RAID mode.

Conflicts:
ironic/tests/unit/drivers/modules/drac/test_raid.py

Change-Id: I9d295135e6059a47cb541ae1218b11c3d56f85e1
Story: 2007711
Task: 39844
(cherry picked from commit 325f28043468472c2f97f659c66817192aba39f7)
"}]
commit_message:
DRAC: Fix a failure to create virtual disk

PERC H740P controllers supports RAID mode and Enhanced HBA mode.
When the controller is in Enhanced HBA, it creates single disk
RAID0 virtual disks of NON-RAID physical disks.
Hence the user's request for VD creation with supported RAID
fails due to no available physical disk.
This patch checks the Perc H740P controllers whether it supports
enhanced HBA mode and if controllers are found in enhanced HBA
mode it converts back to RAID mode.

Conflicts:
ironic/tests/unit/drivers/modules/drac/test_raid.py

Change-Id: I9d295135e6059a47cb541ae1218b11c3d56f85e1
Story: 2007711
Task: 39844
(cherry picked from commit 325f28043468472c2f97f659c66817192aba39f7)

> > Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1
> > 
> > Can we have a double-check for the version? Reno suggest major version bump [1] based on 'release notes'.
> > 
> > [1] https://zuul.opendev.org/t/openstack/build/f97e80f74b0b4b3eb7468580f6211dc9/log/tox/list-changes-results.log#120-122
> 
> Uhm, actually it is still ok.
> 
> From SemVer:
> MINOR version when you add functionality in a backwards compatible manner,
> 
> Here the new feature was added not affecting anything else, what we do not consider worth of major release due to absence of breaking changes and any other new features.
> 
> Maybe I should have used "other" in the reno for the corresponding change to avoid that.

@Artem: actually the following reno entry suggested the major bump:

found breaking change in 'upgrade' section of releasenotes/notes/add-missing-server-list-opts-c41e97e86ff1e1ca.yaml

which says "The ``openstack server list --status`` parameter will now validate the requested status.".

This really feels OK to me as only a minor bump, but please give a final confirmation that you wrote about the same change, and I'll approve the patch. Thanks!'}, {'account_id': 27900, 'date': '2021-03-19 19:39:21.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Yes, it's ok"}, {'account_id': 17685, 'date': '2021-03-20 09:00:15.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1

Thanks Artem & sorry for holding back the release.'}]

commit_message:
Proposing python-openstackclient for wallaby

Proposing release for cycle-with-intermediary deliverables that have not released yet.

If you wants to wait for a specific patch to make it to the release, someone from your team can -1 the patch to have it held, or update that patch with a different commit SHA.

Patches with no response will be merged by Friday March 26.

messages: [{'account_id': 15334, 'date': '2021-03-18 10:42:08.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 22873, 'date': '2021-03-19 20:36:09.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2\n\nLGTM, thanks'}, {'account_id': 8556, 'date': '2021-03-20 00:33:19.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2021-03-18 10:42:08.000000000', 'message': "setup.cfg: Replace dashes with underscores

Setuptools v54.1.0 introduces a warning that the use of dash-separated
options in 'setup.cfg' will not be supported in a future version [1].
Get ahead of the issue by replacing the dashes with underscores. Without
this, we see 'UserWarning' messages like the following on new enough
versions of setuptools:

  UserWarning: Usage of dash-separated 'description-file' will not be
  supported in future versions. Please use the underscore name
  'description_file' instead

[1] https://github.com/pypa/setuptools/commit/a2e9ae4cb

Change-Id: I532be460dc673548be9ed3b540e9feb8ca832fbe
Signed-off-by: Stephen Finucane <sfinucan@redhat.com>
"}]
commit_message:
setup.cfg: Replace dashes with underscores

Setuptools v54.1.0 introduces a warning that the use of dash-separated
options in 'setup.cfg' will not be supported in a future version [1].
Get ahead of the issue by replacing the dashes with underscores. Without
this, we see 'UserWarning' messages like the following on new enough
versions of setuptools:

  UserWarning: Usage of dash-separated 'description-file' will not be
  supported in future versions. Please use the underscore name
  'description_file' instead

[1] https://github.com/pypa/setuptools/commit/a2e9ae4cb

Change-Id: I532be460dc673548be9ed3b540e9feb8ca832fbe
Signed-off-by: Stephen Finucane <sfinucan@redhat.com>

Add Python3 xena unit tests

This is an automatically generated patch to ensure unit testing
is in place for all the of the tested runtimes for xena.

See also the PTI in governance [1].

[1]: https://governance.openstack.org/tc/reference/project-testing-interface.html

commit_message:
Hides prefix_length column in subnet show output

When the openstacksdk is patched to properly support defining prefix
lengths when creating subnets, the resulting subnet show output
reveals a prefix_length column with a value of 'none'. This patch
hides the prefix_length column.

Change-Id: I59dfb0b1585ed624f9d82b3557df2ff5ff9d1b3e
Partial-Bug: 1754062
Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/550558/

commit_message:
network: Make 'network qos rule create --type' option required

When we create a network qos rule we need specify the type so that we
can call the corresponding API. It's not possible to use the command
without the type so mark it as required. This was already being done
but inline.

Change-Id: I559f884bac198d2c69e800620aef66b200473418
Signed-off-by: Stephen Finucane <sfinucan@redhat.com>

[{'created': '2021-03-18 17:13:00.000000000', 'message': 'Comment out parameter_defaults in barbican simple crypto template

Including this template in a deploy but not including anything in
`parameter_defaults` is going to fail when heat attempts to parse that
environment file because `parameter_defaults` is empty:

  ValueError: environment has empty section "parameter_defaults"

This commit attempts to fix that by commenting out the section since
there doesn't seem to be a reasonable default to use.

Change-Id: I06a5e13d768c65a8d5cf0b635620c33523b374f4
'}]
commit_message:
Comment out parameter_defaults in barbican simple crypto template

Including this template in a deploy but not including anything in
`parameter_defaults` is going to fail when heat attempts to parse that
environment file because `parameter_defaults` is empty:

  ValueError: environment has empty section "parameter_defaults"

This commit attempts to fix that by commenting out the section since
there doesn't seem to be a reasonable default to use.

Change-Id: I06a5e13d768c65a8d5cf0b635620c33523b374f4

commit_message:
Drop old cruft-removal code in ovn_dbs_bundle

With Train we switch ovn-dbs to a separate VIP. We had some code
that took care of removing the constraints ovn-dbs added to the
internal_api VIP. Since we're headed to Wallaby we can drop this
piece of code as ovn-dbs has had its own VIP for a few releases now.

Depends-On: I5d5df3948964c28f53eda0ba5a966c824012bd4c
Change-Id: Ibea59d9679b1c1e3d99f3077d370ca92ae1a8d0a

[{'created': '2021-03-11 12:15:15.000000000', 'message': "Use (or set properly) system-id generated by openvswitch

In case when OVN_UUID isn't set by used, and it isn't stored
in ovn-uuid file, Devstack will first check if it is already
generated and stored in /etc/openvswitch/system-id.conf file.
If it's not, it will generate it.
Finally this OVN_UUID value will now be storer in the
/etc/openvswitch/system-id.conf file so it can be set to same value
after openvswitch will be e.g. restarted.

Closes-Bug: #1918656

commit_message:
Use (or set properly) system-id generated by openvswitch

In case when OVN_UUID isn't set by user, and it isn't stored
in /etc/openvswith/system-id.conf file, Devstack will reuse it.
If it's not, it will generate and store it in the
/etc/openvswitch/system-id.conf file so it can be set to same value
after openvswitch will be e.g. restarted.

In case when OVN_UUID is set by user, it will be also saved in
/etc/openvswitch/system-id.conf file to make it persistent when e.g
openvswitch will be restarted.

Closes-Bug: #1918656
Change-Id: I8e3b05f3ab83e204bc1ce895baec0e1ba515895b

commit_message:
Remove unnecessary test

As noted, we're simply testing the default behavior of Python 3 in this
test. Remove it, now that this is the only version(s) of Python 3 we
have to worry about.

Change-Id: I5f07343df8334457d907086033d5685f59c0bf0e
Signed-off-by: Stephen Finucane <sfinucan@redhat.com>

commit_message:
bug fix: tox wrongly install client from repo path.

This will cause version conflict:

Obtaining file:///opt/stack/python-cyborgclient
ERROR: Could not satisfy constraints for 'python-cyborgclient': installation from path or url cannot be constrained to a version

or

ERROR: Could not find a version that satisfies the requirement python-cyborgclient 1.3.1.dev1
ERROR: No matching distribution found for python-cyborgclient 1.3.1.dev1

Change-Id: I521f880606fa1aab25cd85875153275c5dd2e125

commit_message:
Correct group:reset_group_snapshot_status policy

The default value for the group:reset_group_snapshot_status policy, which governs the Block Storage API call "Reset group snapshot status"[0], was changed to admin-or-owner during refactoring for the
policy-in-code initiative in Queens [1].  Consensus at the Wallaby
R-18 mid-cycle was that this change was a mistake that should be
corrected [2].

[0] https://docs.openstack.org/api-ref/block-storage/v3/#reset-group-snapshot-status
[1] https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/cinder/+/507812
[2] https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/CinderWallabyMidCycleSummary#consistent_and_secure_policies

Change-Id: I7875d365bb73dd80ecbe30c4801599b6f781cc39
Closes-bug: #1908315
(cherry picked from commit 1631742f43a2d1f60cf5ccee26dced1d542f2bf6)
(cherry picked from commit 1941ecc6d4013ecfdf7e2d37fd87ffaa04d8a38d)
(cherry picked from commit 6c399a8b0d8e945911cf4408b0d6cb2d3d15bd3a)

I agree with Jay that this is OK to backport.  This only affects one driver, and if we don't backport it, that driver is subject to the timeout issue when there are targets in the array that aren't connected to OpenStack, which I imagine will be the case for a really large array that's being used for multiple applications.  Further, the new option defaults to what we have now, so it won't affect current users who aren't seeing any issues. commit_message:
Add ports filtering support to Dell EMC XtremIO driver

If there are some iSCSI or FC targets (ESXi for example) that
are not connected to the OpenStack host,
attach volume operation waits until timeout.
The XtremIO Cinder driver needs a new option to support ports
filtering.

Change-Id: I2a521118598de336148a56c1d5352107ece80721
Closes-Bug: #1915800
(cherry picked from commit e175d64cac735e8845165d0e8b48c4a8f2402ea1)

commit_message:
Add passwords_env parameter to generate_passwords

Add a new parameter, passwords_env to the generate_passwords function
that can be used to pass in a Heat environment dict of existing password
values. If the value is not None, it will be used instead of attempting
to query Heat for the stack environment.

The paramter will allow for re-using a set of existing passwords without
having to have an existing Heat stack.

Signed-off-by: James Slagle <jslagle@redhat.com>
Change-Id: I99b488842261775dbbb0308c070e440f71b5be41

commit_message:
Don't allow rotation of HeatAuthEncryptionKey

Heat does not support rotation of auth_encryption_key
for existing deployments with heat stacks. Once this
key has been rotated exisiting stacks can't be updated
or even deleted. Let's not allow them to be changed.

Change-Id: I19c1d166ca72465fd4ae3dad46de77bb095f73d4

commit_message:
Add the Unbound DNS resolver service

This patch addes TripleO support for the Unbound DNS resolver service.
This service will initially be used by the Designate service.

Change-Id: I8135ce4f344aeb7c0cf7521e0ba42335c4c7bbc8

commit_message:
Add option to include labels in dockerfiles

When building containers, add labels to the
dockerfiles using the --label argument if
dockerfile_labels is defined.

Change-Id: Ib797bde92a0328e0c1baf3779c8a047729979e5a

Lots of things can call log.info or log.warning,
ensure the tests around logging are looking for
specific calls.

Change-Id: Ife0a7144d90acae91ecf9f55b1b66d8edc6d8838
'}, {'created': '2021-02-09 13:40:24.000000000', 'message': 'Tests: Improve RBD v2 clone API unit tests

Lots of things can call log.info or log.warning,
ensure the tests around logging are looking for

runs.

commit_message:
Tests: Improve RBD v2 clone API unit tests

Lots of things can call log.info or log.warning,
ensure the tests around logging are looking for
specific calls.

Change-Id: Ife0a7144d90acae91ecf9f55b1b66d8edc6d8838

commit_message:
[stable-only] Set IPv6 params to fix tempest-slow-py3

The job has been fixed in tempest [1] but stein is pinned to tempest
26.0.0 so any user of tempest-slow-py3 needs to apply the change
as neutron did [2].

[1] https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/tempest/+/774764
[2] https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/neutron/+/777389

Related-Bug: #1914037
Change-Id: I068cf1e9618d305b5a9383c283bfa0f120bfe905

revisions:
[{'created': '2021-03-19 19:29:42.000000000', 'message': 'Ensure Content-Type header is set when required

This used to be set to application/json when there was request data,
but this was removed in change
I6bd9a0719acfb839fcf137c58bcf03254b1af5ad without any particular
explanation.

There have been reports of some redfish implementations returning
error responses (400 or 415) when this header is not set, specifically
HPE Gen9. It is good practice to always set Content-Type on requests
with data anyway. This change adds that header back.

Change-Id: I13107bbea4d422fdfe620ade735a2e150cb51bf2
(cherry picked from commit f52aac46cd0a77f9282591f4d888a241b6eb0a39)
'}]
commit_message:
Ensure Content-Type header is set when required

This used to be set to application/json when there was request data,
but this was removed in change
I6bd9a0719acfb839fcf137c58bcf03254b1af5ad without any particular
explanation.

There have been reports of some redfish implementations returning
error responses (400 or 415) when this header is not set, specifically
HPE Gen9. It is good practice to always set Content-Type on requests
with data anyway. This change adds that header back.

Change-Id: I13107bbea4d422fdfe620ade735a2e150cb51bf2
(cherry picked from commit f52aac46cd0a77f9282591f4d888a241b6eb0a39)

commit_message:
Remove /extra/vif_port_id usage

A long time ago, in a galaxy far far away, the use of
/extra/vif_port_id was deprecated in favor of vif attachment and
detachment. This change updates a test which was using the
/extra/vif_port_id field value to bind a vif, and then list/detach
it using the vif attach/detach/list API interfaces.

Since the action is to add/list/detach, this seems appropriate and
should be widely supported going back 4+ years.

Change-Id: I0b0cd0aaf9a87803386e096ab768638476f9ca52

commit_message:
Update TOX_CONSTRAINTS_FILE for stable/wallaby

Update the URL to the upper-constraints file to point to the redirect
rule on releases.openstack.org so that anyone working on this branch
will switch to the correct upper-constraints list automatically when
the requirements repository branches.

Until the requirements repository has as stable/wallaby branch, tests will
continue to use the upper-constraints list on master.

Change-Id: Ia7c1d3c9b75f303142c59ac79236da79c01f9efe

Change rotate-fernet-keys playbook to not use plan

As we removed plan, we would need to generate the rotated
fernet_keys environment to be used in subsequent stack updates.

commit_message:
Do not log ssh keys by default

This patch adds a no_log clause to tasks that might dump ssh key
information to the ansible logs on deployment. Logging can be re-enabled
by setting hide_sensitive_logs to false.

Related-bug: #1918138
Change-Id: I89dccbac7c450b16956edf6a136aed6f4a21214d

commit_message:
Drop inject_facts_as_vars

This setting stops ansible from converting ansible_fact items into top
level ansible_* vars. This has a huge impact on performance as this is
performed at the end of every task execution.

Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/tripleo-heat-templates/+/777003
Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/tripleo-ansible/+/777226
Change-Id: I1a3c0d31cdb4a644cb950ca59c83bfcb051dc39d
(cherry picked from commit 16bc02326be62e9df328f290a1e06f3045c54957)

commit_message:
Use the UBI8 image for testing

This change converts our use of CentOS7/88 to UBI8, which should
provide a better test environment which will match that of
production for future releases of TripleO. While this image change
will better match production clouds thanks in large part to TCIB,
it will also remove our use of docker.io (dockerhub) which fraught
with peril due to the ongoing API rate limits saga.

Change-Id: I69f3400568d865c1f3505913077ecd7fe36d7d43
Signed-off-by: Gael Chamoulaud (Strider) <gchamoul@redhat.com>
(cherry picked from commit 5bf1427b43132259cd8e37d4b9c4479af9ece958)
(cherry picked from commit ca884424f4b6b25f8d46ecd192f7555007884f56)
(cherry picked from commit 989406134ce9b9df8620ae8e3d05b2055e4b7349)

subject: Check Ceph cluster healthy state before starting FS to BS playbook
revisions:
[{'created': '2021-03-17 08:13:30.000000000', 'message': 'Check Ceph cluster healthy state before starting FS to BS playbook

The Ceph OSDs migration from filestore to bluestore should only be
attempted if the cluster is in HEALTH_OK state because during the
process OSDs will be destroyed and recreated.

This change adds a check to poll for the cluster status before the
playbook is triggered.

Change-Id: Ib9c90c4c2e838bed461ac63139b161ab689d28cf
Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/777562
Closes-Bug: 1915700
(cherry picked from commit 5250e6d595c7ad97059930809fbeda9b17c1b364)
(cherry picked from commit 1b57684556ae9e61a3088c1cd63db3f0adfb895c)
'}]
commit_message:
Check Ceph cluster healthy state before starting FS to BS playbook

The Ceph OSDs migration from filestore to bluestore should only be
attempted if the cluster is in HEALTH_OK state because during the
process OSDs will be destroyed and recreated.

This change adds a check to poll for the cluster status before the
playbook is triggered.

Change-Id: Ib9c90c4c2e838bed461ac63139b161ab689d28cf
Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/777562
Closes-Bug: 1915700
(cherry picked from commit 5250e6d595c7ad97059930809fbeda9b17c1b364)
(cherry picked from commit 1b57684556ae9e61a3088c1cd63db3f0adfb895c)

commit_message:
Add non-tls listener to Memcached

This step is required in order to migrate services to use TLS one by
one. This config should go away once all services support TLS.

NOTE(moguimar): Squashing two extra fixes here that were merged after
the first patch in master.

Squashes:
- Fix memcached firewall condition
  (cherry picked from commit 2ee68bf9a713d5f4b5b6b73c40633627fb905d6c)
- Fix parameters for puppet-memcached-6.0.0
  (cherry picked from commit 9be84a2fc268b2a8838f10d740d181e54ede6572)

Change-Id: I7a38a01f498d350d065a7c312a6654832fe24e6a
Co-authored-By: Grzegorz Grasza <xek@redhat.com>
Signed-off-by: Mois√©s Guimar√£es de Medeiros <moguimar@redhat.com>
(cherry picked from commit 125ebd64f4cbd0685ae45f985ef29835edcf9e50)

commit_message:
API validation: Use cinder_host for services checks

Apply the new cinder_host validation spec to the
host field in the enable_and_disable, failover_host,
and freeze_and_thaw API calls.

Related-Bug: #1904892
Change-Id: I593ff70172de0d5b42d483d0c4bd2a463001155f

commit_message:
Dropping explicit unicode literal

In python 3, all strings are considered as unicode string.

This patch drops the explicit unicode literal (u'...')
or (u"..") appearances from the unicode strings.

Change-Id: I5c4b0eb24ecade37c22e7777640466116a893a89

commit_message:
Replace the remaning usage of gem --no-ri and --no-rdoc

This change replaces the remaining usage of --no-iro and --no-rdoc
with --no-document, because these two options are no longer valid
in the later version especially available in Ubuntu Focal.

[1] ddb24d6a06d5f03d3de99c764a6bbff76859455a

Change-Id: I42d7e2b5f3ab8ae9e020fa9f1ec6e355431e4814

commit_message:
Switch all CentOS 8 jobs to CentOS 8 Stream

... because RDO Wallay won't support CentOS 8 but only CentOS 8 Stream.

Change-Id: Id76ef3fe2db8888b7d409d7014e775b4c780083f

[{'account_id': 29191, 'date': '2019-06-24 21:39:59.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 20635, 'date': '2019-08-17 03:32:07.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Thank you for your work on this.  In order to triage and set higher review priority, we need context via a LP bug.  Please also amend the commit message utilizing the bug syntax documented in the reference below.  This sets into motion the automatic bug management tied to this proposal and its commit.

I've rebased this and started the full func test so that we can see a rebuild run its tests.

Ref: https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/GitCommitMessages#Including_external_references"}, {'account_id': 20635, 'date': '2019-08-17 03:32:11.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Patch Set 1 was rebased'}, {'account_id': 20635, 'date': '2019-08-17 03:32:18.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

charm-recheck-full'}, {'account_id': 20870, 'date': '2019-08-19 11:02:12.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

This looks good, but please could you include the LP bug in the commit message as:

Closes-Bug: #xxxx

or

Related-Bug: #xxxx

Thanks.'}, {'account_id': 20805, 'date': '2019-08-19 17:21:57.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review-1

(1 comment)

The totally-unsecure-auto-unlock is deprecated and known not to work. We should not be adding code that relies on it.

We should go into a blocked state stating we are unsealed. Actions can then do the unsealing.

Please also add a bug or an issue reference for context.'}, {'account_id': 29191, 'date': '2019-08-19 17:47:24.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 20635, 'date': '2019-08-19 21:45:49.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Workflow-1

commit_message:
Report missing CA if cert requests are pending

This sets the charm status to blocked to make it obvious when the CA
cert is missing and there are pending cert requests being blocked.

This also moves the optional interfaces checks down to ensure that they
don't mask the more important status messages.  (E.g., if Vault is
providing certs for Etcd, it's more important to know that Vault is
sealed or missing the CA than to know that Etcd doesn't have its cert
yet.)

This also adds some error checking to gracefully handle the case where
Vault becomes sealed after it was successfully started rather than
having it go into a hook error.

Change-Id: I18a5dbeabc562e14d164f82c041fed207032f52b
Closes-Bug: 1840696

one from charm helpers.

[{'created': '2021-03-09 15:51:38.000000000', 'message': "api-ref: Don't list HTTP 500 for backup create

HTTP 500 just means that something broke in
the service.  We don't need to list this as part
of our API because we don't intend to deliver
it as a response for this API.

Change-Id: I7a08926fbbc5d2753f7d9d0c6c496ad3f967ec10
"}]
commit_message:
api-ref: Don't list HTTP 500 for backup create

HTTP 500 just means that something broke in
the service.  We don't need to list this as part
of our API because we don't intend to deliver
it as a response for this API.

Change-Id: I7a08926fbbc5d2753f7d9d0c6c496ad3f967ec10

Pure's "pure_host_personality" configuration option currently defaults
to a non valid value according to its choices.

This affects tools leveraging the "get_driver_options" mechanism, since
the default value for the option was not considered a valid option.

This patch sets the default explicitly and adds it as a valid choice.

Change-Id: I381b80920d812a3f3b5f75b6dae66aa932f6baa4
(cherry picked from commit 69f4f5ffe44dfa219ecde975180bd26ed5f62377)

(cherry picked from commit 1aa9073008083c35fa5ac6e44cfcafbce27a60db)
'}]
commit_message:
Pure: Add default value to pure_host_personality

Pure's "pure_host_personality" configuration option currently defaults
to a non valid value according to its choices.

This affects tools leveraging the "get_driver_options" mechanism, since
the default value for the option was not considered a valid option.

This patch sets the default explicitly and adds it as a valid choice.

Change-Id: I381b80920d812a3f3b5f75b6dae66aa932f6baa4
(cherry picked from commit 69f4f5ffe44dfa219ecde975180bd26ed5f62377)
(cherry picked from commit e20c7d34e449c3594fd01cc9790c888ff2b755d3)
(cherry picked from commit 1aa9073008083c35fa5ac6e44cfcafbce27a60db)

revisions:
[{'created': '2021-03-19 19:29:19.000000000', 'message': 'Ensure Content-Type header is set when required

This used to be set to application/json when there was request data,
but this was removed in change
I6bd9a0719acfb839fcf137c58bcf03254b1af5ad without any particular
explanation.

There have been reports of some redfish implementations returning
error responses (400 or 415) when this header is not set, specifically
HPE Gen9. It is good practice to always set Content-Type on requests
with data anyway. This change adds that header back.

Change-Id: I13107bbea4d422fdfe620ade735a2e150cb51bf2
(cherry picked from commit f52aac46cd0a77f9282591f4d888a241b6eb0a39)
'}]
commit_message:
Ensure Content-Type header is set when required

This used to be set to application/json when there was request data,
but this was removed in change
I6bd9a0719acfb839fcf137c58bcf03254b1af5ad without any particular
explanation.

There have been reports of some redfish implementations returning
error responses (400 or 415) when this header is not set, specifically
HPE Gen9. It is good practice to always set Content-Type on requests
with data anyway. This change adds that header back.

Change-Id: I13107bbea4d422fdfe620ade735a2e150cb51bf2
(cherry picked from commit f52aac46cd0a77f9282591f4d888a241b6eb0a39)

commit_message:
Define the default policy file

This change ensures that the default policy file for Manila API access
is defined by default, so that operators can deploy their own policy
more easily.

Change-Id: Ie890766ea2a274791393304cdfe532e024171195

commit_message:
Fix in api-ref

Add a separate var for snapshot and use in:
https://github.com/openstack/cinder/blob/master/api-ref/source/v3/volumes-v3-snapshots.inc

Change-Id: Ib6a153562aec1c73ceb7ad9d4f6c4ee104d768e2

messages: [{'account_id': 28619, 'date': '2021-03-16 14:44:50.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 25023, 'date': '2021-03-16 19:39:43.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:\n\nrecheck'}, {'account_id': 25023, 'date': '2021-03-17 18:17:01.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 13095, 'date': '2021-03-19 18:57:30.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}]

[{'created': '2021-03-16 14:44:50.000000000', 'message': 'Allow to override blazar policy files

We implement `blazar_policy_overrides` variable in order to allow
management of balazar policy files when needed.

Change-Id: I581a9c9659d3d023eb40cf2c6dfc2d01fa0a7464
'}]
commit_message:
Allow to override blazar policy files

We implement `blazar_policy_overrides` variable in order to allow
management of balazar policy files when needed.

Change-Id: I581a9c9659d3d023eb40cf2c6dfc2d01fa0a7464

subject: Update TOX_CONSTRAINTS_FILE for stable/wallaby
messages: [{'account_id': 15519, 'date': '2021-03-19 20:23:39.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2021-03-19 18:07:43.000000000', 'message': 'Update TOX_CONSTRAINTS_FILE for stable/wallaby

Update the URL to the upper-constraints file to point to the redirect
rule on releases.openstack.org so that anyone working on this branch
will switch to the correct upper-constraints list automatically when
the requirements repository branches.

Until the requirements repository has as stable/wallaby branch, tests will

commit_message:
Update TOX_CONSTRAINTS_FILE for stable/wallaby

Update the URL to the upper-constraints file to point to the redirect
rule on releases.openstack.org so that anyone working on this branch
will switch to the correct upper-constraints list automatically when
the requirements repository branches.

Until the requirements repository has as stable/wallaby branch, tests will
continue to use the upper-constraints list on master.

Change-Id: Id76f048c071beddf0d427e4c9eccb566c569dd4b

revisions:
[{'created': '2021-03-18 12:49:51.000000000', 'message': 'Ensure Content-Type header is set when required

This used to be set to application/json when there was request data,
but this was removed in change
I6bd9a0719acfb839fcf137c58bcf03254b1af5ad without any particular
explanation.

There have been reports of some redfish implementations returning
error responses (400 or 415) when this header is not set, specifically
HPE Gen9. It is good practice to always set Content-Type on requests
with data anyway. This change adds that header back.

Change-Id: I13107bbea4d422fdfe620ade735a2e150cb51bf2
(cherry picked from commit f52aac46cd0a77f9282591f4d888a241b6eb0a39)
'}]
commit_message:
Ensure Content-Type header is set when required

This used to be set to application/json when there was request data,
but this was removed in change
I6bd9a0719acfb839fcf137c58bcf03254b1af5ad without any particular
explanation.

There have been reports of some redfish implementations returning
error responses (400 or 415) when this header is not set, specifically
HPE Gen9. It is good practice to always set Content-Type on requests
with data anyway. This change adds that header back.

Change-Id: I13107bbea4d422fdfe620ade735a2e150cb51bf2
(cherry picked from commit f52aac46cd0a77f9282591f4d888a241b6eb0a39)

commit_message:
Update pool when pools.yaml is changed

Move designate-mange pool update command to handlers
since we need to run it only when pools.yaml is changed.
We also don't need to restart designate service, when pools.yaml is
updated.

Change-Id: I7f3d6bd777ce5a6e0f3372f0f6e29cb5499d5419

commit_message:
Fix pacemaker-remote-relation-changed hook error

This was happening because
trigger_corosync_update_from_leader() was being called
not only in `ha` relation hooks but also in
`pacemaker-remote` relation hooks after the implementation
for the related bug landed.

Closes-Bug: #1920124
Related-Bug: #1400481
Change-Id: I4952ef694589de6b72f04b387e30ca2333bc4cbc

commit_message:
[nova] Create for all client and non-client lib wallaby branch

This creates the stable/wallaby branch for all client and non-client libraries
now that we are past the lib freeze on March 11.

If a team wants to wait for a specific patch to make it to the library,
someone from the team can -1 the patch to have it held,or update that
patch with a different commit SHA.

Patches with no response will be merged by Friday, March 19.

Change-Id: I13ce499587559978fc22423ab31b75c4fc935f63

commit_message:
[heat] Create for all client and non-client lib wallaby branch

This creates the stable/wallaby branch for all client and non-client libraries
now that we are past the lib freeze on March 11.

If a team wants to wait for a specific patch to make it to the library,
someone from the team can -1 the patch to have it held,or update that
patch with a different commit SHA.

Patches with no response will be merged by Friday, March 19.

Change-Id: I4d56f050250443491dff47c17cf2fa638aeeb98c

revisions:
[{'created': '2021-03-18 12:49:27.000000000', 'message': 'Ensure Content-Type header is set when required

This used to be set to application/json when there was request data,
but this was removed in change
I6bd9a0719acfb839fcf137c58bcf03254b1af5ad without any particular
explanation.

There have been reports of some redfish implementations returning
error responses (400 or 415) when this header is not set, specifically
HPE Gen9. It is good practice to always set Content-Type on requests
with data anyway. This change adds that header back.

Change-Id: I13107bbea4d422fdfe620ade735a2e150cb51bf2
(cherry picked from commit f52aac46cd0a77f9282591f4d888a241b6eb0a39)
'}]
commit_message:
Ensure Content-Type header is set when required

This used to be set to application/json when there was request data,
but this was removed in change
I6bd9a0719acfb839fcf137c58bcf03254b1af5ad without any particular
explanation.

There have been reports of some redfish implementations returning
error responses (400 or 415) when this header is not set, specifically
HPE Gen9. It is good practice to always set Content-Type on requests
with data anyway. This change adds that header back.

Change-Id: I13107bbea4d422fdfe620ade735a2e150cb51bf2
(cherry picked from commit f52aac46cd0a77f9282591f4d888a241b6eb0a39)

commit_message:
Enable TLS for glance scripts

The bootstrap and storage-init scripts need to reference
a ca certificate when the object store has tls enabled.

Change-Id: I89c03eb2172290e998e73aaf3eb6614b4f3bc7e1

commit_message:
Don't try to create default SG when security groups are disabled

If security group API is disabled, there is no point to create default
security group for tenant when e.g. network is created.

Closes-Bug: #1913297
Change-Id: Ib73babdd563e3e8c21ce6f63456cc87af414c5aa
(cherry picked from commit 013c183d7c1a16d07f5acae9e29b157b0ffd8fae)

commit_message:
volume: Add 'volume qos set --no-property' option

Supporting "--no-property" option will apply user a convenient
way to clean all properties of volume qos in a short command,
and this kind of behavior is the recommended way to devref.
The patch adds "--no-property" option in "volume qos set" command,
and update related test cases and devref document.

Change-Id: I1fb5b4f0a923bbf557a3af3f63809bde9e84ffd4

Make release of tripleo-ipsec master/victoria/ussuri - fix bad tags

As described in the related bug we need to tag a new version for
master victoria and ussuri to fix multiple tags pointing to the same
commit.

commit_message:
Add "volume snapshot manage & unmanage" commands in volume v2

Add "volume snapshot manage" and "snapshot unmanage" commands
in volume v2 (v2 only), also add the doc, unit tests
and release note.

Change-Id: I128ddc820ba62c36f3a355ae98b293d427202692
Implements: bp cinder-command-support
Closes-Bug: #1618676

commit_message:
Use Node 10 to release monasca-grafana-datasource

In order to be able to publish to NPM from ubuntu-focal nodes,
switch to the nodejs10-publish-to-npm project template for
openstack/monasca-grafana-datasource.

Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/781825
Change-Id: I98e225a192cfed178df4dafd8f42df885c89a894

subject: Update TOX_CONSTRAINTS_FILE for stable/wallaby
revisions:
[{'created': '2021-03-19 18:08:28.000000000', 'message': 'Update TOX_CONSTRAINTS_FILE for stable/wallaby

Update the URL to the upper-constraints file to point to the redirect
rule on releases.openstack.org so that anyone working on this branch
will switch to the correct upper-constraints list automatically when
the requirements repository branches.

Until the requirements repository has as stable/wallaby branch, tests will
continue to use the upper-constraints list on master.

Change-Id: I1bf49912816829a47e6250d9f9d8a6ce88cb68ad
'}]
commit_message:
Update TOX_CONSTRAINTS_FILE for stable/wallaby

Update the URL to the upper-constraints file to point to the redirect
rule on releases.openstack.org so that anyone working on this branch
will switch to the correct upper-constraints list automatically when
the requirements repository branches.

Until the requirements repository has as stable/wallaby branch, tests will
continue to use the upper-constraints list on master.

Change-Id: I1bf49912816829a47e6250d9f9d8a6ce88cb68ad

PBR will pull in pkg_resources to determine the package version at
runtime. This incurs the cost of doing package listing and sorting that

commit_message:
Hack out pbr versioninfo to test entrypoints cost

PBR will pull in pkg_resources to determine the package version at
runtime. This incurs the cost of doing package listing and sorting that
we are trying to avoid when using entrypoints. This change shouldn't be
merged but gives us somethign to compare against.

Change-Id: Icc81e122b414d43cac31249dc85c892dd1fa0300

commit_message:
Use entrypoints lib instead of pkg_resources

Some quick local trivial testing shows that this lib is significantly
quicker at listing entrypoints than pkg_resources is. This change will
test how this does in a more "real" world situation.

Change-Id: I933ccd613c1002bceb89255d5db90523b814a50f

messages:
[{'account_id': 29923, 'date': '2019-02-19 01:50:43.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 10068, 'date': '2019-02-19 01:50:55.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Thank you for your first contribution to OpenStack.

Your patch will now be tested automatically by OpenStack testing frameworks
and once the automatic tests pass, it will be reviewed by other friendly
developers. They will give you feedback and may require you to refine it.

People seldom get their patch approved on the first try, so don't be
concerned if requested to make corrections. Feel free to modify your patch
and resubmit a new change-set.

Patches usually take 3 to 7 days to be reviewed so be patient and be
available on IRC to ask and answer questions about your work. Also it
takes generally at least a couple of weeks for cores to get around to
reviewing code. The more you participate in the community the more
rewarding it is for you. You may also notice that the more you get to know
people and get to be known, the faster your patches will be reviewed and
eventually approved. Get to know others and become known by doing code
reviews: anybody can do it, and it's a great way to learn the code base.

Thanks again for supporting OpenStack, we look forward to working with you.

IRC: https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/IRC
Workflow: https://docs.openstack.org/infra/manual/developers.html
Commit Messages: https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/GitCommitMessages"}, {'account_id': 1131, 'date': '2019-02-19 04:10:29.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

Can you point me at the corresponding neutron change?

commit_message:
add optional argument metric to set metric for routes

A routing metric is a quantitative value used to evaluate
the path cost. A new optional argument metric can be added
to set the metric for the routes. This value can be set by
the user or have a default value.

DocImpact
Closes-Bug: #1759790
Implements: [RFE] metric for the route

Change-Id: Idd9bfd740a91003bb362e35d988576c8c52803ee

commit_message:
Corrected 'openstack subnet show‚Äô output for field allocation pool.

change 'openstack subnet show‚Äô output same as 'neutron subnet-show‚Äô  as existing
output is complex if more than one allocation pool allocated to 1 subnet.

Change-Id: Ia69b72e57a7328612846115f11b862aa8517abcb
Closes-Bug:  #1651733

> This didn't solve the problem completely, is this problem caused by
 > find_resource(), or something wrong in API server? We should solve
 > the problem not only cover up the problem and just show a right
 > result

Thanks for review it. But utils.find_resource(), which would use server cases to check the resource with name or ID, and use the name query for others like projects, services. For endpoint, find_resource() would return "More than one ...", it is caused by get /endpoints?name=123, the query "name" is not a supported filters. Do you think we should change the utils.find_resource() methods if the resource just donnot support query with 'name'?'}, {'account_id': 21514, 'date': '2017-04-06 00:32:04.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

Hi, yangweiwei. find_resource() is a common method but not the only way to find resource, if one resource cannot be found properly by it, we can choose to use other way to find it, for example we can write a new find method for this resource, you can see the example in flavor commands.'}, {'account_id': 17430, 'date': '2017-04-06 01:36:17.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

> Hi, yangweiwei. find_resource() is a common method but not the only
 > way to find resource, if one resource cannot be found properly by
 > it, we can choose to use other way to find it, for example we can
 > write a new find method for this resource, you can see the example
 > in flavor commands.

Ok, thank you. In my opinion, find_resource() is a common method to many resource, but we could update the passing parameters, if the resource not care 'name' query.

 > Hi, yangweiwei. find_resource() is a common method but not the only
 > way to find resource, if one resource cannot be found properly by
 > it, we can choose to use other way to find it, for example we can
 > write a new find method for this resource, you can see the example
 > in flavor commands.

Thank you . I think find_resource() is a common method, 

 > Hi, yangweiwei. find_resource() is a common method but not the only
 > way to find resource, if one resource cannot be found properly by
 > it, we can choose to use other way to find it, for example we can
 > write a new find method for this resource, you can see the example
 > in flavor commands.

Thank you for your opinion. But, I have to say, find_resource() is a common method which would find resource step by step, first try to find resourse with id, if not, then with int(id), and so on. The process has no problem. To the special resource, endpoint, it just has 'id'. We may calling the interface, and the right exception is 'passed' in the first or second step. So, as the common method goes, we has known the results like 'more than ...' which is the same as "not found" for inactual 'name' query . And for other exception, we should catch directly.

Here, we just catch the exceptions.CommandError for we know 'name' query is actual prameter for endpoint.'}, {'account_id': 17430, 'date': '2017-04-06 01:38:23.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

I apologize for not catching this earlier, but removing the ability to specify an endpoint by everything except UUID is a breaking change that we can not do until a major release (4.0 is expected this summer).

There are cases where specifying an endpoint by service name or type works today with Identity v3, we can not break those.

* for the show command, format the output like the v2 output and include all of the URLs that match
* for delete we need to be careful, the consequences of getting this wrong is high.'}, {'account_id': 17430, 'date': '2017-04-24 08:57:23.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 14:

> I apologize for not catching this earlier, but removing the ability
 > to specify an endpoint by everything except UUID is a breaking
 > change that we can not do until a major release (4.0 is expected
 > this summer).
 > 
 > There are cases where specifying an endpoint by service name or
 > type works today with Identity v3, we can not break those.
 > 
 > * for the show command, format the output like the v2 output and
 > include all of the URLs that match
 > * for delete we need to be careful, the consequences of getting
 > this wrong is high.

Thanks for your opinion. I agree with you we cannot specifying an endpoint only by UUID, and the show\set\delete commond errors here for  not getting the right endpoint. If so as you said, an endpoint by service name or type works today with Identity v3. We really need to change the show commond. 

*For delete commond, I think we could do as V2, for we delete endpoint only by endpoint-id.
*For set commond, before we update the endpoint, we only get by uuid. So here, we use 'identity_client.endpoints.get()' and I think it is ok.

Hope your review again."}, {'account_id': 8276, 'date': '2017-04-26 06:54:46.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 14:

recheck'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2017-04-26 11:45:29.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 14: Verified+1

Build succeeded (check pipeline).

revisions:
[{'created': '2017-04-05 01:49:49.000000000', 'message': "Update endpoint-delete and endpoint-show method exception.

When we delete an endpoint which is not exists, the results should
be 'not found'. But now, the openstackclient of the endpoint-delete
just return 'More than one endpoint with the name XXX'. For the Endpoint
class with name query like /endpoints?name=XXX, the result ignores
the query which is not the same as others like Project. So, I think
we should catch the Exception but not return directly.

Also, when we show an endpint which is not extis like endpoint-delete.
We should catch the errors and show the reason.

Change-Id: I94da0a7fe0f6e2fdf9af4171c20bac266ad51af3
"}, {'created': '2017-04-05 02:32:33.000000000', 'message': "Update endpoint-delete and endpoint-show method exception.

When we delete an endpoint which is not exists, the results should
be 'not found'. But now, the openstackclient of the endpoint-delete
just return 'More than one endpoint with the name XXX'. For the Endpoint
class with name query like /endpoints?name=XXX, the result ignores
the query which is not the same as others like Project. So, I think
we should not use find_source() method. We may get from the client
directly.

Also, when we show and set an endpint which is not extis like endpoint-delete.
We should get from the client and catch or raise the exception.

just return 'More than one endpoint with the name XXX'. For the Endpoint
class with name query like /endpoints?name=XXX, the result ignores
the query which is not the same as others like Project. So, I think
we should not use find_source() method. We may get from the client
directly.

Also, when we show and set an endpint which is not extis like endpoint-delete.
We should get from the client and catch or raise the exception.

Closes-Bug: #1683231
Change-Id: I94da0a7fe0f6e2fdf9af4171c20bac266ad51af3

commit_message:
Update endpoint-delete, endpoint-show, endpoint-set method

When we delete an endpoint which is not exists, the results should
be 'not found'. But now, the openstackclient of the endpoint-delete
just return 'More than one endpoint with the name XXX'. For the Endpoint
class with name query like /endpoints?name=XXX, the result ignores
the query which is not the same as others like Project. So, I think
we should not use find_source() method. We may get from the client
directly.

Also, when we show and set an endpint which is not extis like endpoint-delete.
We should get from the client and catch or raise the exception.

Closes-Bug: #1683231
Change-Id: I94da0a7fe0f6e2fdf9af4171c20bac266ad51af3

commit_message:
Add a nodejs10-publish-to-npm project template

Like the nodejs{4,6,8}-publish-to-npm templates, 10 seems to be the
first version which can run on ubuntu-focal nodes so add it as an
option.

Change-Id: Ic3f806e701b334985632d0969863cd902a653a1d

It seems a bit overkill to create a new common file and function to add a single parser argument.'}, {'account_id': 21514, 'date': '2017-03-21 02:06:08.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

> It seems a bit overkill to create a new common file and function to
 > add a single parser argument.

Yea, a bit overkill. I am thinking about other ways, what about:

Add this option to identity/common.py since some identity commands will also use it, and we can see there have been some common options in there.

Or just leave it as-if, we maybe have some more common functions for volume and we may beef up this in the future'}, {'account_id': 970, 'date': '2017-03-23 15:45:14.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Or just follow the established pattern in the rest of OSC and put the declaration inline as required by the commands.

I believe strongly that it is better documenting for future developers to have those in one place rather than scattered all over.

There are exceptions, and I think the Identity domain args is a good example, that appears all over, but I've seen a lot of this happening that does not reach that high bar."}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2017-06-23 20:36:43.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Verified-1

commit_message:
Add "--sort" option to "volume backup list" in a common way

Add a commom method "add_sort_option_to_parser()"
to support adding "--sort" option for list commands.
this review use it for "volume backup list" command first.

Change-Id: I9bbe6922f5b5476be186dfa30fb79c548ecc5df9
Implements: bp add-sort-option

 > show flavor access? The example of showing flavor access is here:
 > https://review.openstack.org/#/c/338999/

I think the commands should be appeared with context, like add/remove/update/list.

There are existing cli like image add / remove project (Refacotred in https://review.openstack.org/#/c/365910) for the image project operation.

If we use the image show for the project info, we also need move the add / remove to the 'image set' part to sync with.

Also we need the cli like image set --project-status to update the project status on the targe image.
This will make the image set func much more complex.

So in my opinion, following the current cli style maybe better and clear.
We can have image project add/remove/update/list for the image project related operations.'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2016-09-09 15:54:08.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Verified-1

I'm a bit against this approach and I've communicated to Qiang offline.

Basically, project CRUD is not a glance feature (it used to be when image-sharing was a relatively simple feature). Now the sharing construct will need "visibility" change along with project changes.

So, having a project list/add/update doesn't help all by itself.

We need to start thinking of a solution around image sharing.


My thought-seed (food for thought) is:

  $ openstack image "share" visibility=<public, private, community, shared> (optional arguments for project/member updates).

Also, I think this needs to read as member and not "project". Although the most common way to run glance is by using user-as-tenant, it may not be the only way -- say when we add HMT. So, I would prefer to think of this feature from 'member' (and not project) perspective.

http://specs.openstack.org/openstack/glance-specs/specs/newton/approved/glance/community_visibility.html'}, {'account_id': 2537, 'date': '2016-09-21 23:24:37.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5:

https://bugs.launchpad.net/python-openstackclient/+bug/1626366'}, {'account_id': 5314, 'date': '2016-09-22 19:35:46.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5: Code-Review-1

As Nikhil indicated, there are changes to image sharing happening in the Ocata release, so we'll want to make sure that any changes are forward compatible.  The direction is fairly clearly stated on the "community images" spec:

http://specs.openstack.org/openstack/glance-specs/specs/newton/approved/glance/community_visibility.html

See especially the "REST API Impact" section.  In order to accommodate community images, we're introducing a minor backward incompatibility in the sharing workflow (it was discussed with the API WG and they were OK with it).

If it would be helpful, we can have a meeting to discuss any questions you have after you've looked over the spec.

This looks like the kind of change that's a bit bigger than a bug.  Maybe it needs a spec or blueprint, whatever OSC uses?'}, {'account_id': 22754, 'date': '2016-09-23 06:19:39.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5:

From the https://blueprints.launchpad.net/glance/+spec/community-level-v2-image-sharing
Seems this feature is still in progress on both glance and python-glanceclient site for the lib part.
So what's the whole progress status for this visibility feature now?'}, {'account_id': 22754, 'date': '2016-09-23 08:12:40.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5:

As the visibility spec, the command in OSC will be:
openstack image set --visibility community <IMAGE>

So do we still need the CRUD for the image member functions?
I have update the refactor image add/remove project bug to use
member instead of project. Since the tenant user is also allowed 
to be added as the image member besides the project.'}, {'account_id': 5314, 'date': '2016-09-26 12:28:55.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 5:

@qtang: if you haven't already, please take a look at the sharing section of the Images v2 API ref:

You are correct, the community images spec is currently being implemented, but we plan to deliver early in Ocata to enable testing and early usage by various interested parties."}, {'account_id': 22754, 'date': '2016-09-28 05:10:33.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5:

(1 comment)

I agree with Fei Long, the description is misleading.

Just for some background, the member_status is completely independent of permission to access the image.  (A member has unconditional access to an image.)  The member_status is an anti-spam provision to prevent someone from spamming a user's default image-list response.  Only a member can change the member_status (the image owner can't), and if member_status is 'accepted', then the image will show up in the caller's default image-list response.  But the member has access to the image regardless of whether the member_status is 'accepted' or not."}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2017-06-23 20:36:55.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6: Verified-1

commit_message:
Add support for setting and removing tags from server instance

Enable adding and removing server tags with `server set` and `server
unset` commands (--os-compute-api-version >= 2.26).
This is done using SDK connection. As a followup complete SetServer and
UnsetServer can be switched to SDK.

Change-Id: I06d726273c62bce790cd1ae1119dbae98c9e1f74

commit_message:
Query args for get-only

The docstring for find_resource says that kwargs are passed to
.find(), but these were also being passed to .get(). .get()
is called using the resource by ID so it doesn't always make
sense to pass query args to it. Callers need to be able to
pass query params that don't get passed to get().

Change-Id: Ibf33aa155263d7eeaf4981259dfeed6cdee1e90a
Closes-Bug: #1546663

commit_message:
json-rpc: surround IPv6 address with [] in conductor URL

If the conductor's host option is configured to be an IPv6 address, we
need to surround it with [] when incorporating it in a URL to contact
the conductor over json-rpc.

Change-Id: Ib3bc4c570ec0f2e5c73e3ce15b05684b8e4c1ff9
Story: 2008288
Task: 41166
(cherry picked from commit 85b489288669af342bbbd4b0a875580a346c2441)

revisions:
[{'created': '2021-03-19 15:54:14.000000000', 'message': 'Proposing ironic-prometheus-exporter for wallaby

Proposing release for cycle-with-intermediary deliverables that have not released yet.

If you wants to wait for a specific patch to make it to the release, someone from your team can -1 the patch to have it held, or update that patch with a different commit SHA.

commit_message:
Proposing ironic-prometheus-exporter for wallaby

Proposing release for cycle-with-intermediary deliverables that have not released yet.

If you wants to wait for a specific patch to make it to the release, someone from your team can -1 the patch to have it held, or update that patch with a different commit SHA.

Patches with no response will be merged by Friday March 26.

$ git log --oneline --no-merges 2.1.1..1ec7859
1ec7859 Add bifrost job and update docs
198f07d Reconfigure tox.ini
36f2ccb Remove lower-constraints job
c5d4ea9 Set safe version of hacking
e33f2e7 Add Python3 wallaby unit tests
0f9da06 Migrate IPE job to focal
8d25757 Update master for stable/victoria

Signed-off-by: Armstrong Foundjem <foundjem@ieee.org>
Change-Id: Ib12dbbb007c93497776623a4c4b6d79249376a2a

commit_message:
Update TOX_CONSTRAINTS_FILE for stable/wallaby

Update the URL to the upper-constraints file to point to the redirect
rule on releases.openstack.org so that anyone working on this branch
will switch to the correct upper-constraints list automatically when
the requirements repository branches.

Until the requirements repository has as stable/wallaby branch, tests will
continue to use the upper-constraints list on master.

Change-Id: I5300d1576fb87881ead185ae71aafea36f4cb74b

commit_message:
Check for existence instead of fetching the whole net object

There is no need to fetch the whole net object
(which leads to several heavy DB requests according
to OSProfiler stats) when only need to check net existence

This speeds up port creation up to 15%

Closes-Bug: #1917866
Change-Id: I75db7c713a17a0f1b1b5aecc6eec93e636a71827

revisions:
[{'created': '2021-02-01 16:00:41.000000000', 'message': "libvirt: Use specific user when probing encrypted rbd disks during extend

I0c3f14100a18107f7e416293f3d4fcc641ce5e55 introduced new logic when
extending LUKSv1 encrypted rbd volumes. As part of this qemu-img is used
to probe the rbd volume to determine the size of the LUKSv1 header.

The URI used to point to the rbd volume did not provide a user and
assumed that n-cpu/privsep would have access to the admin keyring. This
isn't always the case in most environments and would result in a failure
to probe the disk when the admin keyring wasn't available.

This change resolves this by appending the `id:$username` option to the
end of the URI provided to qemu-img using the `auth_username` found in
the connection_info from Cinder.

Closes-Bug: #1913575
Change-Id: Ia6d6dcdd7042f2aef6b3abeb5cd0f7525678a3b7
(cherry picked from commit b62a1abd616cea7fdfcad18e1cf548767d67b6dd)
"}]
commit_message:
libvirt: Use specific user when probing encrypted rbd disks during extend

I0c3f14100a18107f7e416293f3d4fcc641ce5e55 introduced new logic when
extending LUKSv1 encrypted rbd volumes. As part of this qemu-img is used
to probe the rbd volume to determine the size of the LUKSv1 header.

The URI used to point to the rbd volume did not provide a user and
assumed that n-cpu/privsep would have access to the admin keyring. This
isn't always the case in most environments and would result in a failure
to probe the disk when the admin keyring wasn't available.

This change resolves this by appending the `id:$username` option to the
end of the URI provided to qemu-img using the `auth_username` found in
the connection_info from Cinder.

Closes-Bug: #1913575
Change-Id: Ia6d6dcdd7042f2aef6b3abeb5cd0f7525678a3b7
(cherry picked from commit b62a1abd616cea7fdfcad18e1cf548767d67b6dd)

Patches with no response will be merged by Friday, March 19.

commit_message:
[mistral] Create for all client and non-client lib wallaby branch

This creates the stable/wallaby branch for all client and non-client libraries
now that we are past the lib freeze on March 11.

If a team wants to wait for a specific patch to make it to the library,
someone from the team can -1 the patch to have it held,or update that
patch with a different commit SHA.

Patches with no response will be merged by Friday, March 19.

Change-Id: Ibff60e6a94654e76befd9fa4fdaebe39389c0903

commit_message:
Fix miss formatting array to print in ShowServer

Currently, When the formatter is not table and result
of content contains list, the items of list were printed as a
concatenate with comma.

In this patch, if the output format is not table, the output
of list will follow the output format.
(e.g. json output = [ ])
This will put right output format for not only table
but also both json and yaml.

Change-Id: Ibf88593b1935c7ff42a5512136e0eca9f8466343
Story: 2007755

commit_message:
Proposing ovn-octavia-provider for wallaby

Proposing release for cycle-with-intermediary deliverables that have not released yet.

If you wants to wait for a specific patch to make it to the release, someone from your team can -1 the patch to have it held, or update that patch with a different commit SHA.

Patches with no response will be merged by Friday March 26.

$ git log --oneline --no-merges 0.3.0..915e561
516e5c3 Start running the tempest API tests
7bd6936 Switch to new rolevar for run-temepst role
b796f4e Add SCTP support
bdb7ca6 Remove devstack-gate reference
c7969b6 Update sample local.conf to mention OVN_BRANCH
6e30b85 Check if no members in pool better in batch update
a641c2c Don't try to store protocol=None in OVSDB
ffc3160 Update to pylint 2.6.0+
13331aa Collect OVN logs
15b3ca3 Enable the IPv6 tempest tests
2399b69 Correctly set member operating status
ba4c94e Change to build OVN from source
2225062 Delay string interpolations at logging calls
23f0bed Remove work around change for test_port_forwarding
b882a7f Fix gate failure
a238faf Return UnsupportedOptionError() on loadbalancer failover
037d3d0 Use get_ovn_ovsdb_retry_max_interval()
723ca5a Retry status updates to Octavia
5b0715d Fix leaked file descriptors by cleaning up objects
aa4ffe5 Change devstack script to correctly configure driver
350a26b Include python36-devel in bindep
7a8e45b Add master and release tempest jobs
b68d2a7 Fix and enable test_port_forwarding
884d5e1 Switch from unittest2 compat methods to Python 3.x methods
a278e59 Add Python3 wallaby unit tests
76b2088 Fix the check for allowed_cidrs in listeners
c2c87e6 Update master for stable/victoria
481f0b3 Mark test_port_forwarding unstable to fix gate
2476204 Set OPERATING_STATUS to ONLINE when pool created with listener

Signed-off-by: Armstrong Foundjem <foundjem@ieee.org>
Change-Id: I605db3a6b71093fb3f72444354ac7b2a83155c24
