Moved back to WIP until I understand why c-bak tests are failing, any help would be appreciated here as I've never touched the service before."}, {'account_id': 4690, 'date': '2021-01-13 01:26:09.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 23:

> Patch Set 23:
> 
> (2 comments)
> 
> Moved back to WIP until I understand why c-bak tests are failing, any help would be appreciated here as I've never touched the service before.

From what I can tell, this is the 'rbd export-diff | rbd import-diff' command hanging during the restore [1]. I'm not sure how to get more debug info about it.

The last thing we see is this [2]:

Jan 12 20:22:42.424200 ubuntu-focal-rax-iad-0022498534 cinder-backup[99862]: DEBUG cinder.backup.drivers.ceph [None req-00d60793-a79a-42ca-b321-aa3f756cae4f tempest-VolumesBackupsTest-611904254 None] cmd2='rbd import-diff --id cinder --conf /tmp/brickrbd_pcyp_i21 --pool volumes - volumes/volume-de5b19be-fcd9-40c6-9ac3-2ca7b2d990ad' {{(pid=99862) _piped_execute /opt/stack/cinder/cinder/backup/drivers/ceph.py:573}}

which is here [3][4] in the code. The only thing I can think of to try is to put up a DNM cinder patch that adds --debug-rbd=20 to the 'rbd export-diff' and 'rbd import-diff' commands and see if we can get any additional info by printing stdout in _piped_execute. Note that I have not used --debug-rbd=20 myself before, but I found it mentioned on the ceph-users ML threads that came up when I googled about 'rbd' commands hanging.

I'm not sure how else we can find out more about why the rbd commands don't seem to complete. Maybe there is a better way.

[1] https://zuul.opendev.org/t/openstack/build/64f7cb57d8e74f01877a618972e4fb50/log/controller/logs/screen-c-bak.txt?severity=0#822
[2] http://paste.openstack.org/show/801574
[3] https://github.com/openstack/cinder/blob/f19a92064ac8acd5e7d141d83fe90cbef4402f46/cinder/backup/drivers/ceph.py#L611-L636
[4] https://github.com/openstack/cinder/blob/f19a92064ac8acd5e7d141d83fe90cbef4402f46/cinder/backup/drivers/ceph.py#L570"}, {'account_id': 10135, 'date': '2021-01-13 16:28:26.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 23:

>

Note that I have not used --debug-rbd=20 myself before, but I found it mentioned on the ceph-users ML threads that came up when I googled about 'rbd' commands hanging.

Thanks for looking into this, yeah I can't think of another way of tracing it tbh I'll wire up a DNM patch for this now."}, {'account_id': 10135, 'date': '2021-01-13 16:32:33.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 24: Commit message was updated.'}, {'account_id': 4690, 'date': '2021-01-13 20:18:49.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 24:

commit_message:
zuul: Introduce a multinode ceph job

This change introduces a multinode ceph job based on
tempest-multinode-full-py3 to be used to provide live migration and
other multinode coverage initially in the openstack/nova project.

As this job uses ceph for both Nova ephemeral
([libvirt]/imagebackend=rbd) and Cinder volume storage the live block
migration tests are skipped.

Change-Id: I9ffdff44a3ad42ebdf26ab72e24dfe3b12b1ef8b

commit_message:
Add new options to PKCS#11 backend

This patch adds support for a couple of new new options in the
PCKS#11 backends.  Namely 'token_labels' and 'os_locking_ok'.

Change-Id: Iba7013dd6e1b1e4650b25cd4dd8dc1f355ceb538
(cherry picked from commit 8685ed4a4cd3c886a00889bb150fbb3ba2620c8d)

commit_message:
cinder backend: password should be secret

This change ensures that password information for cinder backend is
properly hidden.

commit_message:
Use the UBI8 image for testing

This change converts our use of CentOS7/88 to UBI8, which should
provide a better test environment which will match that of
production for future releases of TripleO. While this image change
will better match production clouds thanks in large part to TCIB,
it will also remove our use of docker.io (dockerhub) which fraught
with peril due to the ongoing API rate limits saga.

This change updates all uses of docker to podman and removes our docker
installation process from zuul and our local test process.

Change-Id: I69f3400568d865c1f3505913077ecd7fe36d7d43
Signed-off-by: Gael Chamoulaud (Strider) <gchamoul@redhat.com>
(cherry picked from commit 5bf1427b43132259cd8e37d4b9c4479af9ece958)
(cherry picked from commit ca884424f4b6b25f8d46ecd192f7555007884f56)

i'm OK with this, but since it's a new option let's see what dtroyer says"}, {'account_id': 970, 'date': '2016-12-15 13:40:37.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Code-Review-1

(1 comment)

It would be nice if we can detect if --remote-source was used to create the volume and do this automatically.  Is there a difference in this kind of volume between using --remote and not?'}, {'account_id': 170, 'date': '2016-12-20 18:35:10.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Code-Review-1

I agree, "remote" doesn't make sense to me. Dean, we have actions with resources to manage/unmanage them. (e.g. a volume that already exists may not be known to cinder for some reason, so an admin can have cinder start managing (basically registering) that volume). Should we have os volume manage/unmanage, along with snapshots?'}, {'account_id': 21514, 'date': '2016-12-21 02:35:57.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

Hi, Mike Perez, we have talked about manage commands before and we have implemented "manage snapshot" in "volume snapshot create --remote-source" in the review:
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/363574/
So we plan to implement unmanage in delete command with one option, does this make sense for you?'}, {'account_id': 170, 'date': '2016-12-21 17:32:01.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

No it doesn't make sense to me still, because I'm not even aware of the Cinder API itself documenting this in the API as "remote". I looked in the docs anyways and couldn't find it mentioned. Maybe I'm missing something, but I think these should be manage/unmanage. I read the review you linked that sets the precedent, but I don't understand how we got to this bad interface.'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2017-06-23 20:36:55.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Verified-1

Merge Failed.

This change or one of its cross-repo dependencies was unable to be automatically merged with the current state of its repository. Please rebase the change and upload a new patchset.'}, {'account_id': 5263, 'date': '2017-12-18 03:11:24.000000000', 'content': 'Removed reviewer Jenkins with the following votes:

* Verified-1 by Jenkins (3)
'}, {'account_id': 15334, 'date': '2021-03-19 16:34:14.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned'}]

commit_message:
Add "--remote" option to "volume snapshot delete"

Add "--remote" option to "volume snapshot delete" command
to support deleting the volume snapshot created by remote
source in volume v2.

Change-Id: I1472b0c58fffe3affdad1d8cc3bed9a85a27c601
Implements: bp cinder-command-support
Partial-Bug: #1618676

When specific roles are deployed with custom images, for example CephStorage with
overcloud-minimal, then the LeappCommandOptions and/or the list of packages to
be removed/installed is not the same across all roles.

This change makes four parameters to be customized on a per-role basis:
UpgradeInitCommand
UpgradeLeappToRemove
UpgradeLeappToInstall
UpgradeLeappCommandOptions

Related-Bug: 1915067
Closes-Bug: rhbz#1936419
Change-Id: Ifd373f7aba6d98baa843b141de8a2266eaa71a0b
(cherry picked from commit 155fe9454b907553a351e724da3b5ef3ce8dcb48)
(cherry picked from commit dbad3a079b7c04066008b6ef9cd38cdaa0b80056)
'}]
commit_message:
Make UpgradeInitCommand and UpgradeLeapp{ToRemove,ToInstall,CommandOptions} per-role

When specific roles are deployed with custom images, for example CephStorage with
overcloud-minimal, then the LeappCommandOptions and/or the list of packages to
be removed/installed is not the same across all roles.

This change makes four parameters to be customized on a per-role basis:
UpgradeInitCommand
UpgradeLeappToRemove
UpgradeLeappToInstall
UpgradeLeappCommandOptions

Related-Bug: 1915067
Closes-Bug: rhbz#1936419
Change-Id: Ifd373f7aba6d98baa843b141de8a2266eaa71a0b
(cherry picked from commit 155fe9454b907553a351e724da3b5ef3ce8dcb48)
(cherry picked from commit dbad3a079b7c04066008b6ef9cd38cdaa0b80056)

Sounds like molecule isn't happy due to the following [1]

commit_message:
Optionally fail ceph-health if HEALTH_WARN

Helps controlling the behavior of the ceph-health check for it to
fail, optionally, not only when cluster is in _ERR state but also
in _WARN state.

Change-Id: I4eb7508c24cce0db3179d4f3ef26cabceb164716
Related-Bug: 1915700
(cherry picked from commit 67560d36c06860dc827ef8356f1023f42facdbec)
(cherry picked from commit 2896ce06d7aad365bc6f02d5ab60acbe45315eb5)

subject: Add legacy fact setting
revisions:
[{'created': '2021-03-17 14:11:43.000000000', 'message': 'Add legacy fact setting

When we disable inject facts by default, there were some additional
roles that we missed (ipaclient).  We can just set the legacy facts to
prevent issues with missing distribution var updates.

Change-Id: Ib488a6573c035fc8288a4b24461af56d40416c5d
Related-Bug: #1919064
(cherry picked from commit d8408ebb86efdda0055ae41c6db350c14772dc6a)

commit_message:
Add legacy fact setting

When we disable inject facts by default, there were some additional
roles that we missed (ipaclient).  We can just set the legacy facts to
prevent issues with missing distribution var updates.

Change-Id: Ib488a6573c035fc8288a4b24461af56d40416c5d
Related-Bug: #1919064
(cherry picked from commit d8408ebb86efdda0055ae41c6db350c14772dc6a)

commit_message:
network: Add '--project' to some list commands

Include '--project' and '--project-domain' filtering options to the
'security group rule list' and 'network rbac list' commands.

Change-Id: I19e423906846073cfa1e45b4a295b3a8f5d11970
Closes-Bug: #1648317

revisions:
[{'created': '2021-03-19 15:19:55.000000000', 'message': "Stop linting zuul-jobs from here

When we run ansible-lint on project-config the tool is finding and
reporting errors in zuul-jobs. Zuul-jobs appears to be included to
ensure that all the roles we use are defined, but we don't want to lint
the content of those roles.

To address this we add ../../zuul to the ansible lint exclude path which
includes zuul-jobs.

Change-Id: Ie9aeca81ba4fb95df0e7e1ee275230378e49b741
"}]
commit_message:
Stop linting zuul-jobs from here

When we run ansible-lint on project-config the tool is finding and
reporting errors in zuul-jobs. Zuul-jobs appears to be included to
ensure that all the roles we use are defined, but we don't want to lint
the content of those roles.

To address this we add ../../zuul to the ansible lint exclude path which
includes zuul-jobs.

Change-Id: Ie9aeca81ba4fb95df0e7e1ee275230378e49b741

[{'created': '2021-03-15 13:02:55.000000000', 'message': '[cyborg] Create for all client and non-client lib wallaby branch

This creates the stable/wallaby branch for all client and non-client
libraries
now that we are past the lib freeze on March 11.

If a team wants to wait for a specific patch to make it to the library,
someone from the team can -1 the patch to have it held,or update that
patch with a different commit SHA.

Patches with no response will be merged by Friday, March 19.

Change-Id: I58a9c1e8e2117931f44f56a377b4e2267a6ee459
'}]
commit_message:
[cyborg] Create for all client and non-client lib wallaby branch

This creates the stable/wallaby branch for all client and non-client
libraries
now that we are past the lib freeze on March 11.

If a team wants to wait for a specific patch to make it to the library,
someone from the team can -1 the patch to have it held,or update that
patch with a different commit SHA.

Patches with no response will be merged by Friday, March 19.

Change-Id: I58a9c1e8e2117931f44f56a377b4e2267a6ee459

commit_message:
move flake8 as a pre-commit local target

The goal here is to avoid conflicts between flake8 and hacking version each
2 days.

Inspired from nova's approach [1].

The flake8 version to install will be determined by hacking and
requirements will stay aligned instead of relying on different versions.

[1] https://opendev.org/openstack/nova/src/branch/master/.pre-commit-config.yaml#L26-L35
[2] https://opendev.org/openstack/hacking/src/branch/master/requirements.txt#L1

Change-Id: Iae20f13ba6293b94b5bd131941263e097eba0518

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-11-27 09:15:14.000000000', 'message': 'WIP: Support granular allocation candidate list

This will support something like this:

openstack allocation candidate list \
   --group 1 --resource VCPU=3 \
   --group 2 --resource VCPU=4 \
   --group_policy isolate

WIP: More tests and release note

Change-Id: Ib32181abd12db0c2983065ea9846e911033d53f1
'}, {'created': '2019-11-28 07:50:36.000000000', 'message': 'Support granular allocation candidate list

The ``openstack allocation candidate list`` command now supports
``--group`` and ``--group-policy`` option. The ``--group`` option is
accepts integer to group granular requests. If specified, following
given options of resources, required/forbidden traits, and aggregates
are associated to that group and will be satisfied by the same resource
provider in the response. Can be repeated to get candidates from
multiple resource providers in the same resource provider tree.

If multiple groups are supplied, the separate groups may or may not
be satisfied by the same provider. If you want the groups to be
satisfied by different providers, set ``--group_policy`` to
``isolate``.

For example:
    ``openstack allocation candidate list \
        --group 1 --resource VCPU=3 --required HW_CPU_X86_SSE \
        --group 2 --resource VCPU=4 \
        --group_policy isolate``

The granular request is supported in 1.25, but this is tested via
microversion 1.29 since the API is unaware of nested provider
before that version. Note that 1.26-1.29 has no impact to client:
  1.25 - Adds support for granular resource requests via numbered
         querystring groups in GET /allocation_candidates.
  1.26 - Add ability to specify inventory with reserved value equal
         to total.
  1.27 - Include all resource class inventories in `provider_summaries`
         field in response of `GET /allocation_candidates` API even if
         the resource class is not in the requested resources.
  1.28 - Add support for consumer generation
  1.29 - Support nested providers in `GET /allocation_candidates` API.

Change-Id: Ib32181abd12db0c2983065ea9846e911033d53f1

commit_message:
Support granular allocation candidate list

The ``openstack allocation candidate list`` command now supports
``--group`` and ``--group-policy`` option. The ``--group`` option is
accepts integer to group granular requests. If specified, following
given options of resources, required/forbidden traits, and aggregates
are associated to that group and will be satisfied by the same resource
provider in the response. Can be repeated to get candidates from
multiple resource providers in the same resource provider tree.

If multiple groups are supplied, the separate groups may or may not
be satisfied by the same provider. If you want the groups to be
satisfied by different providers, set ``--group_policy`` to
``isolate``.

For example:
    ``openstack allocation candidate list \
        --group 1 --resource VCPU=3 --required HW_CPU_X86_SSE \
        --group 2 --resource VCPU=4 \
        --group_policy isolate``

The granular request is supported in 1.25, but this is tested via
microversion 1.29 since the API is unaware of nested provider
before that version. Note that 1.26-1.29 has no impact to client:
  1.25 - Adds support for granular resource requests via numbered
         querystring groups in GET /allocation_candidates.
  1.26 - Add ability to specify inventory with reserved value equal
         to total.
  1.27 - Include all resource class inventories in `provider_summaries`
         field in response of `GET /allocation_candidates` API even if
         the resource class is not in the requested resources.
  1.28 - Add support for consumer generation
  1.29 - Support nested providers in `GET /allocation_candidates` API.

Change-Id: Ib32181abd12db0c2983065ea9846e911033d53f1

subject: Change downgrade log message to debug.
messages:
[{'account_id': 3031, 'date': '2020-12-14 05:46:15.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 3031, 'date': '2021-01-13 23:54:44.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Patch Set 1 was rebased'}, {'account_id': 7198, 'date': '2021-03-10 16:48:12.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2: Code-Review-1

I am concerned about this change.  Making it log.DEBUG will mean that we will, likely, be silently changing things in the background on users.  If users don't like the error they can avoid it by setting the os-volume-api-version to the max spported by that server as reported in the message."}, {'account_id': 3031, 'date': '2021-03-15 03:58:33.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

> Patch Set 2: Code-Review-1
> 
> I am concerned about this change.  Making it log.DEBUG will mean that we will, likely, be silently changing things in the background on users.  If users don't like the error they can avoid it by setting the os-volume-api-version to the max spported by that server as reported in the message.

Yeah ok, our helpdesk have had a few support issues where our users thought this warning was causing them some issues and was hoping to avoid the confusion. If you look at this from a user of the CLI tool it doesn't seem to serve any useful purpose but that is just our opinion."}, {'account_id': 5314, 'date': '2021-03-19 15:44:08.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

(3 comments)

This could use some more looking into.  I think we're not distinguishing two use cases in the code that would call for different messages.  See what you think.

I agree with Jay that we don't want to be completely silent about switching versions on the user, though."}]

[{'created': '2020-12-14 05:46:15.000000000', 'message': 'Change downgrade log message to debug.

This message that is printed to the user is confusing and is a
warning they cannot do anything about.

My guess is that it is more common to have a client that is newer
than the server and so this message is printed everytime to the user.

Change-Id: Ic97bd74ebd61b0ad65730ab8752a88d4ae283115

commit_message:
Change downgrade log message to debug.

This message that is printed to the user is confusing and is a
warning they cannot do anything about.

My guess is that it is more common to have a client that is newer
than the server and so this message is printed everytime to the user.

Change-Id: Ic97bd74ebd61b0ad65730ab8752a88d4ae283115

subject: Multipath tempest scenarios
messages:
[{'account_id': 11904, 'date': '2019-02-25 22:15:10.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 10459, 'date': '2020-03-31 10:07:55.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

recheck'}, {'account_id': 10459, 'date': '2020-03-31 13:07:52.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

devstack-plugin-ceph-tempest-py3 fails with "ModuleNotFoundError: No module named 'ddt'", even though the tests won't be executed.

Apart from the dependency, we would need a new job to setup multipath (on LVM?) and serially run just those (and other future) disruptive tests.

Is there some documentation to setup LVM multipath?'}, {'account_id': 11904, 'date': '2020-03-31 13:36:09.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

> devstack-plugin-ceph-tempest-py3 fails with "ModuleNotFoundError:
 > No module named 'ddt'", even though the tests won't be executed.
 > 
 > Apart from the dependency, we would need a new job to setup
 > multipath (on LVM?) and serially run just those (and other future)
 > disruptive tests.
 > 
 > Is there some documentation to setup LVM multipath?

We have this:

https://docs.openstack.org/cinder/latest/admin/blockstorage-multi-backend.html

It would be good to know if anything is missing from there.

I think this was the migration of a patch from the in-tree cinder repo tempest plugin to the separate plugin repo. We may need to update test-requirements.txt to include ddt.'}, {'account_id': 10459, 'date': '2020-04-08 09:07:23.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

> > devstack-plugin-ceph-tempest-py3 fails with "ModuleNotFoundError:
 > > No module named 'ddt'", even though the tests won't be executed.
 > >
 > > Apart from the dependency, we would need a new job to setup
 > > multipath (on LVM?) and serially run just those (and other
 > future)
 > > disruptive tests.
 > >
 > > Is there some documentation to setup LVM multipath?
 > 
 > We have this:
 > 
 > https://docs.openstack.org/cinder/latest/admin/blockstorage-multi-backend.html
 > 
 > It would be good to know if anything is missing from there.

I have heard (but I may have misunderstood) that it is possible to configure somehow LVM with multipath in (of course) testing-only configuration. The page above explain how to enable multipath when the driver supports it.

If I didn't get how it works, is there a way to test multipath in our CI environment without 3rd-party hardware?

 > I think this was the migration of a patch from the in-tree cinder
 > repo tempest plugin to the separate plugin repo. We may need to
 > update test-requirements.txt to include ddt.

I see, thanks; that's the easy part.'}, {'account_id': 11904, 'date': '2020-04-15 14:49:12.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-02-25 22:15:10.000000000', 'message': 'Multipath tempest scenarios

In order to validate the robustness of the iSCSI multipath code in
OpenStack we require harsher tests than those we have, since they only
test the "happy code path".

This patch adds error injecting tests with validation to confirm there
are no leftovers after an attach or detach failure and an appropriate
explanation in the devref documentation.

We are testing create volume from image and attaching a volume to an
instance under the following networking error scenarios:

 - No errors
 - All paths have 10% incoming packets dropped
 - All paths have 20% incoming packets dropped
 - All paths have 100% incoming packets dropped
 - Half the paths have 20% incoming packets dropped
 - The other half of the paths have 20% incoming packets dropped
 - Half the paths have 100% incoming packets dropped
 - The other half of the paths have 100% incoming packets dropped

There are single execution versions as well as 10 consecutive operations
variants.

Proposed tests are not in line with the tempest mission since they are
not meant to be run in a production environment due to their disruptive
nature while injecting errors.  They need to be run sequentially and
without any other operations running on the deployment.  They also run
sudo commands via local bash or SSH for the verification and error
generation bits.

Recommended configuration in local.conf for single node devstack is:

  [[post-config|$CINDER_CONF]]
  [multipath-backend]
  use_multipath_for_image_xfer=true

  [[post-config|$NOVA_CONF]]
  [libvirt]
  volume_use_multipath = True

  [[post-config|$KEYSTONE_CONF]]
  [token]
  expiration = 14400

  [[test-config|$TEMPEST_CONFIG]]
  [volume-feature-enabled]
  multipath = True
  [volume]
  build_interval = 10
  multipath_type = $MULTIPATH_VOLUME_TYPE
  backend_protocol_tcp_port = 3260
  multipath_backend_addresses = $STORAGE_BACKEND_IP1,$STORAGE_BACKEND_IP2

And the interesting tests can be run from /opt/stack/tempest with:
  $ OS_TEST_TIMEOUT=7200 stestr 'cinder.tests.tempest.scenario.test_multipath.TestMultipath.test_(create_volumes|attach_detach_many)_with_errors_*' --serial -- -f

Change-Id: Id5188e26a6b52f5d00a6dc8ff52a7e1b0c188345

commit_message:
Multipath tempest scenarios

In order to validate the robustness of the iSCSI multipath code in
OpenStack we require harsher tests than those we have, since they only
test the "happy code path".

This patch adds error injecting tests with validation to confirm there
are no leftovers after an attach or detach failure and an appropriate
explanation in the devref documentation.

We are testing create volume from image and attaching a volume to an
instance under the following networking error scenarios:

 - No errors
 - All paths have 10% incoming packets dropped
 - All paths have 20% incoming packets dropped
 - All paths have 100% incoming packets dropped
 - Half the paths have 20% incoming packets dropped
 - The other half of the paths have 20% incoming packets dropped
 - Half the paths have 100% incoming packets dropped
 - The other half of the paths have 100% incoming packets dropped

There are single execution versions as well as 10 consecutive operations
variants.

Proposed tests are not in line with the tempest mission since they are
not meant to be run in a production environment due to their disruptive
nature while injecting errors.  They need to be run sequentially and
without any other operations running on the deployment.  They also run
sudo commands via local bash or SSH for the verification and error
generation bits.

Recommended configuration in local.conf for single node devstack is:

  [[post-config|$CINDER_CONF]]
  [multipath-backend]
  use_multipath_for_image_xfer=true

  [[post-config|$NOVA_CONF]]
  [libvirt]
  volume_use_multipath = True

  [[post-config|$KEYSTONE_CONF]]
  [token]
  expiration = 14400

  [[test-config|$TEMPEST_CONFIG]]
  [volume-feature-enabled]
  multipath = True
  [volume]
  build_interval = 10
  multipath_type = $MULTIPATH_VOLUME_TYPE
  backend_protocol_tcp_port = 3260
  multipath_backend_addresses = $STORAGE_BACKEND_IP1,$STORAGE_BACKEND_IP2

And the interesting tests can be run from /opt/stack/tempest with:
  $ OS_TEST_TIMEOUT=7200 stestr run --serial \
     'cinder_tempest_plugin.scenario.test_multipath.TestMultipath.test_(create_volumes|attach_detach_many)_with_errors_*' -- -f

Change-Id: Id5188e26a6b52f5d00a6dc8ff52a7e1b0c188345

commit_message:
Drop monotonic package from global reqs

Monotonic was only needed for py2 compatibility. Now that projects have
been moved over to time.monotonic, we can drop this req.

Change-Id: I4efb25bc500fa153004609acebfbf55c3b2363a7
Signed-off-by: Sean McGinnis <sean.mcginnis@gmail.com>

commit_message:
Have pylint job only run on master branch

This is a non-voting job that most people ignore. It is useful as we add
new code to help watch for coding issues, but on stable branches it is
ignored even more. And presumably anything that gets merged to a stable
branch has already been merged to master and had this job run against
it.

To help reduce wasted gate resources, this updates the job to only run
on the master branch. Then when victoria is branched, it will
automatically stop running on stable/victoria.

Ultimately we will want to clean this job out of stable branches. Likely
along with other jobs that we don't need to be running there. But until
we get around to doing that cleanup, this at least makes sure a job is
isn't running if its value is very low.

Change-Id: I8b98cecaef03bbf39dbfd45b1db1e02ec98dc8b8
Signed-off-by: Sean McGinnis <sean.mcginnis@gmail.com>

commit_message:
Updating time for functional tests

Currenlty, some gates is being failed with logs like this

"""
b'Response: {"description": "Provided object does not match schema
\'Secret\': \'expiration\' is before current time.
Invalid property: \'expiration\'", "title": "Bad Request", "code": 400}'
"""

So it is necessary to update the time to create secrets successfully.

Change-Id: I59707cdf21f6843dbd7db30978e21cff72756e67
(cherry picked from commit af4637bcf2c0cb807fc8392c9e0e5d7d4404d92e)

[{'account_id': 30143, 'date': '2019-06-20 11:27:41.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 30143, 'date': '2019-06-20 11:30:21.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 8313, 'date': '2019-06-20 14:10:13.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review-1

(3 comments)'}, {'account_id': 11564, 'date': '2019-06-20 15:17:28.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2: Code-Review-1

(5 comments)

I think the meaning of the 1.24 microversion has been misunderstood, so this implementation is not quite right. I've tried to provide some links in comments within to additional sources of information which may help explain how it is supposed to work."}, {'account_id': 30143, 'date': '2019-06-21 13:17:08.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

Thank you for every comment. I can assure that I understand the idea of usage multiple member_of query parameters, it's just the descriptions that need to be improved, and the code of course, but for now let's please discuss if you like the idea of asking user to use 'in:' keyword when they would like to use it the way that was introduced in 1.24.

The code that I have written so far, works only when multiple --aggregate-uuid options are used, so:

stack@baclbpaw-devstack:~/osc-placement$ openstack --os-placement-api-version 1.24 resource provider list --aggregate-uuid in:35819442-6414-46d5-a0d8-d81c6c995938

URL: /resource_providers?member_of=in%3A35819442-6414-46d5-a0d8-d81c6c995938
+--------------------------------------+------+------------+--------------------------------------+----------------------+
| uuid                                 | name | generation | root_provider_uuid                   | parent_provider_uuid |
+--------------------------------------+------+------------+--------------------------------------+----------------------+
| 434e9771-d2bb-4b02-a862-268f88923d98 | rp1  |          5 | 434e9771-d2bb-4b02-a862-268f88923d98 | None                 |
| 6a2a1d33-c5c6-4563-9159-6071ce109660 | rp2  |          2 | 6a2a1d33-c5c6-4563-9159-6071ce109660 | None                 |
+--------------------------------------+------+------------+--------------------------------------+----------------------+

stack@baclbpaw-devstack:~/osc-placement$ openstack --os-placement-api-version 1.24 resource provider list --aggregate-uuid in:7bc7318f-ffb3-4e7e-8e20-9965d2292849

URL: /resource_providers?member_of=in%3A7bc7318f-ffb3-4e7e-8e20-9965d2292849
+--------------------------------------+------+------------+--------------------------------------+----------------------+
| uuid                                 | name | generation | root_provider_uuid                   | parent_provider_uuid |
+--------------------------------------+------+------------+--------------------------------------+----------------------+
| 6a2a1d33-c5c6-4563-9159-6071ce109660 | rp2  |          2 | 6a2a1d33-c5c6-4563-9159-6071ce109660 | None                 |
| e094a039-372b-44f4-b3e5-2e6a1858e4f0 | rp3  |          0 | e094a039-372b-44f4-b3e5-2e6a1858e4f0 | None                 |
+--------------------------------------+------+------------+--------------------------------------+----------------------+

and when used multiple --aggregate-uuid options:

stack@baclbpaw-devstack:~/osc-placement$ openstack --os-placement-api-version 1.24 resource provider list --aggregate-uuid in:35819442-6414-46d5-a0d8-d81c6c995938 --aggregate-uuid in:7bc7318f-ffb3-4e7e-8e20-9965d2292849

URL: /resource_providers?member_of=in%3A35819442-6414-46d5-a0d8-d81c6c995938&member_of=in%3A7bc7318f-ffb3-4e7e-8e20-9965d2292849
+--------------------------------------+------+------------+--------------------------------------+----------------------+
| uuid                                 | name | generation | root_provider_uuid                   | parent_provider_uuid |
+--------------------------------------+------+------------+--------------------------------------+----------------------+
| 6a2a1d33-c5c6-4563-9159-6071ce109660 | rp2  |          2 | 6a2a1d33-c5c6-4563-9159-6071ce109660 | None                 |
+--------------------------------------+------+------------+--------------------------------------+----------------------+

stack@baclbpaw-devstack:~/osc-placement$ openstack --os-placement-api-version 1.24 resource provider list --aggregate-uuid in:35819442-6414-46d5-a0d8-d81c6c995938,7bc7318f-ffb3-4e7e-8e20-9965d2292849 --aggregate-uuid in:7bc7318f-ffb3-4e7e-8e20-9965d2292849

URL: /resource_providers?member_of=in%3A35819442-6414-46d5-a0d8-d81c6c995938%2C7bc7318f-ffb3-4e7e-8e20-9965d2292849&member_of=in%3A7bc7318f-ffb3-4e7e-8e20-9965d2292849
+--------------------------------------+------+------------+--------------------------------------+----------------------+
| uuid                                 | name | generation | root_provider_uuid                   | parent_provider_uuid |
+--------------------------------------+------+------------+--------------------------------------+----------------------+
| 6a2a1d33-c5c6-4563-9159-6071ce109660 | rp2  |          2 | 6a2a1d33-c5c6-4563-9159-6071ce109660 | None                 |
| e094a039-372b-44f4-b3e5-2e6a1858e4f0 | rp3  |          0 | e094a039-372b-44f4-b3e5-2e6a1858e4f0 | None                 |
+--------------------------------------+------+------------+--------------------------------------+----------------------+


and backward compatibility (no 'in:' keyword results with single member_of query parameter):

stack@baclbpaw-devstack:~/osc-placement$ openstack --os-placement-api-version 1.24 resource provider list --aggregate-uuid 35819442-6414-46d5-a0d8-d81c6c995938 --aggregate-uuid 7bc7318f-ffb3-4e7e-8e20-9965d2292849

URL: /resource_providers?member_of=in%3A35819442-6414-46d5-a0d8-d81c6c995938%2C7bc7318f-ffb3-4e7e-8e20-9965d2292849
+--------------------------------------+------+------------+--------------------------------------+----------------------+
| uuid                                 | name | generation | root_provider_uuid                   | parent_provider_uuid |
+--------------------------------------+------+------------+--------------------------------------+----------------------+
| 434e9771-d2bb-4b02-a862-268f88923d98 | rp1  |          5 | 434e9771-d2bb-4b02-a862-268f88923d98 | None                 |
| 6a2a1d33-c5c6-4563-9159-6071ce109660 | rp2  |          2 | 6a2a1d33-c5c6-4563-9159-6071ce109660 | None                 |
| e094a039-372b-44f4-b3e5-2e6a1858e4f0 | rp3  |          0 | e094a039-372b-44f4-b3e5-2e6a1858e4f0 | None                 |
+--------------------------------------+------+------------+--------------------------------------+----------------------+

With the code I have writter, we cannot use 'in:' multiple times at once, so --aggregate-uuid in:35819442-6414-46d5-a0d8-d81c6c995938,in:7bc7318f-ffb3-4e7e-8e20-9965d2292849 won't work, but it can be easily improved.

For now, I just want to know your opinion on that, so I know if I should proceed with this idea."}, {'account_id': 8313, 'date': '2019-06-25 07:42:08.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

@Pawel: I think the best is the release notes sent by Chris: https://review.opendev.org/#/c/561315/16/releasenotes/notes/multi-member-of-4f9518a96652c0c6.yaml, and do the testing based on that, hope that placement folks agree with me :-)'}, {'account_id': 30143, 'date': '2019-06-26 08:03:20.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 30143, 'date': '2019-06-26 08:09:22.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

(8 comments)'}, {'account_id': 30143, 'date': '2019-06-26 10:09:59.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 4.'}, {'account_id': 30143, 'date': '2019-06-26 11:50:55.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 5.'}, {'account_id': 11564, 'date': '2019-07-01 13:29:56.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5:

(2 comments)

I think there may still be some confusion on what microversion 1.24 really means, there are too many instances of "in:" in some of the examples.

I think one way to address that would be to add a unit or otherwise test that confirms how input parameters on the command line are translated into multiple member_of query parameters.

Perhaps I'm misunderstanding, though, so I'll refrain from voting at this point until I'm able to look into this more closely.'}, {'account_id': 30143, 'date': '2019-07-02 05:50:13.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5:

(2 comments)

I understand that it might seem confusing, but in my opinion it is actually pretty simple.

But, if anyone has any better concept, how to introduce the 1.24 option, I am open to your suggestions.'}, {'account_id': 11564, 'date': '2019-07-03 12:03:42.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5: Code-Review-1

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 30143, 'date': '2019-07-03 12:46:19.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 9708, 'date': '2019-07-03 13:26:11.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 5:

The basic problem is that that the CLI modeled the member_of query param with aggregate-uuid CLI param in a non future proof way. 

Before 1.24 the --aggregate-uuid <uuid1> --aggregate-uuid <uuid2> was translated to member_of=in:uuid1,uuid2 on the REST API.

After 1.24 the REST API uses _repeated_ member_of params to express AND relationship BUT repeating --aggregate-uuid already used up on the CLI to express OR relationship. So the CLI is not easy to extend to the direction that the REST API was extended.

One option, Pawel proposes, is to introduce the 'in:' prefix to the CLI param. This means that what was worked without 'in:' in the CLI before 1.24 will only work with 'in:' prefix with 1.24. This step synchronizes the way how the REST API and the CLI express OR (with 'in:') and AND (with repeated key) relationship. However it could be confusing for the CLI user how used repeated --aggregate-uuid key before 1.24.  :/

Another option, I can imagine, is to introduce a totally new CLI param key to get the REST API and the CLI in sync. E.g. we can introduce --member-of key in the CLI where --member-of in:<uuid1>,<uuid2> is translated to member_of='in:uuid1,uuid2' on the REST API. And --member-of uuid1 --member-of=uuid2 translated to member_of=uuid1&member_of=uuid2 on the REST API. --member-of CLI param would only be supported with 1.24 or higher microversion of course.
This option bad in a sense that there will be now two ways to express aggregate membership, the old and limited --aggregate-uuid CLI param, and the new more flexible --member-of CLI param. We could decide to deprecate and later remove the --aggregate-uuid key to clean up the confusion.

@Chris: do you have a preference?"}, {'account_id': 11564, 'date': '2019-07-03 13:31:12.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5:

> The basic problem is that that the CLI modeled the member_of query
 > param with aggregate-uuid CLI param in a non future proof way.

Ah, okay, I get it now. Thanks for expressing it in a different way, very helpful.

 > Another option, I can imagine, is to introduce a totally new CLI
 > param key to get the REST API and the CLI in sync. E.g. we can
 > introduce --member-of key in the CLI where --member-of
 > in:<uuid1>,<uuid2> is translated to member_of='in:uuid1,uuid2' on
 > the REST API. And --member-of uuid1 --member-of=uuid2 translated to
 > member_of=uuid1&member_of=uuid2 on the REST API. --member-of CLI
 > param would only be supported with 1.24 or higher microversion of
 > course.
 > This option bad in a sense that there will be now two ways to
 > express aggregate membership, the old and limited --aggregate-uuid
 > CLI param, and the new more flexible --member-of CLI param. We
 > could decide to deprecate and later remove the --aggregate-uuid key
 > to clean up the confusion.

I prefer this option, but that's because I prefer there be close parity between the arguments used in URLs and arguments used on the command line. That tends to not be aligned with the ethos of OSC, though, so I'm going to add Dean to the review to get his input on any alternate ideas.

To be clear, since we talk about member_of if the API documents and the "how to use placement" documents, it, to me, is the better argument name.'}, {'account_id': 2, 'date': '2019-07-03 14:21:04.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5:

CLI arguments like "--member-of in:<uuid1>:<uuid>" give me hives.

Passing complex need-to-be-parsed data structures is hard to deal with on the CLI (although makes sense in the REST API itself) - and invariably gets really brittle (see anything related to block_device_mapping).

I'd rather see multiple options - like --member-of <uuid1> --member-of       to make the && case like mentioned, but then maybe like --member-in <uuid> --member-in <uuid2> to construct member_of="in:uuid1:uuid2" ... but that's just off the top of my head, and I'm not sure how weird that would be to actually use. Or, heck - a --member-in <uuid1>,<uuid2> would bother me less than the in: prefix.'}, {'account_id': 11564, 'date': '2019-07-03 14:38:09.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5:

There's some useful discussion in IRC starting near: http://eavesdrop.openstack.org/irclogs/%23openstack-sdks/%23openstack-sdks.2019-07-03.log.html#t2019-07-03T13:41:59

Some of it replicates what has been written here.

I'm leaning towards "people who want advanced filtering functionality should perhaps be able to pass a raw filter query, exactly as it would be formed in the URL" but as I've said before I don't think I should decide: I'm not a representative user.

Thanks for sticking with this Pawel. Sorry it is dragging.'}, {'account_id': 970, 'date': '2019-07-03 15:59:37.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 5:

Chris is right in that I consider the UX of the CLI way ahead of modeling the REST API directly.  The CLI serves the user not the API.

The implied AND/OR operators are the major point of confusion that I see here, especially since they are apparently inconsistent between the existing CLI and new REST API functions.

One example OSC does have is the --property filter in image list, it is a simple AND when multiple options are present.  There is no OR operator.  In other places where multiple occurrences of an option are used they are also AND-ed, e.g. --property in create & set commands.

If compound logical expressions are really required for list command filtering at the CLI consider defining a small DSL that looks to the user like a compound logical expression and passing that in a single --filter option:

  --filter 'arg1 and (arg2 or arg3)'"}, {'account_id': 9708, 'date': '2019-07-18 09:50:43.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 5:

So OSC uses repeated params to express AND relationship. Therefore we have an inconsistency in osc-placement as repeated --aggregate-uuid param today is used to express an OR relationship.


Can we agree that the way forward is to replace (with deprecation) the --aggregate-uuid param with something better?

I can agree with Monty suggestion of the following

  --member-of <uuid1> --member-of <uuid2> --member-in <uuid3>, <uuid4>

to mean that each returned candidate RP needs to be member of the aggregate: uuid1 AND uuid2 AND (uuid3 OR uuid4)

Or we can design the following based on Dean's suggestion

  --member-of-filter '<uuid1> and <uuid2> and (<uuid3> or <uuid4>)'

to mean the same as above. However we might need to limit this filter expression because:

  --member-of-filter '(<uuid1> and <uuid2>) or (<uuid3> and <uuid4>)'

cannot be expressed with the current REST API directly but first needs to be translated to:

  (<uuid1> or <uuid3>) and (<uuid2> or <uuid3>) and (<uuid1> or <uuid4>) and (<uuid2> and <uuid4>)

I personally would go with Monty's suggestion."}, {'account_id': 30143, 'date': '2019-07-19 09:06:09.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 5:

Thank you Gibi for the clearer explanation and thank you all for the discussion. I have read the IRC discussion as well.

I would also go with Monty's idea as it seems to be easier to understand for final user that is 'not very experienced' and the 'advanced user' who is able to create some advanced filter expressions, should be also fine with it."}, {'account_id': 11564, 'date': '2019-07-22 09:32:29.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5:

> Can we agree that the way forward is to replace (with deprecation)
 > the --aggregate-uuid param with something better?
 > 
 > I can agree with Monty suggestion of the following
 > 
 > --member-of <uuid1> --member-of <uuid2> --member-in <uuid3>,
 > <uuid4>

This seems like a good way forward.'}, {'account_id': 30143, 'date': '2019-07-30 13:32:51.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 6.'}, {'account_id': 30143, 'date': '2019-07-30 13:42:28.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6:

(2 comments)

During work on this feature, I realized that single --member-of option would be enough and less confusing and it would work exactly as in API, so:

--member-of agg1

would return resource provider that is associated with agg1,

--member-of agg1,agg2

would return resource provider that are associated with agg1 OR agg2,

--member-of agg1 --member-of agg2

would return resource provider that are associated with agg1 AND agg2

--member-of agg1,agg2 --member-of agg3

would return resource provider that are associated with (agg1 OR agg2) AND with agg3

What is your opinion on this?'}, {'account_id': 25625, 'date': '2019-11-27 12:05:53.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6:

(2 comments)

oops, I have missed this patch and started work in another place [1]...

@Pawel
 
> What is your opinion on this?

Yeah, that is exactly what I did in [1].


[1] https://review.opendev.org/#/c/695865/'}, {'account_id': 25625, 'date': '2019-12-09 04:59:52.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 7.'}, {'account_id': 25625, 'date': '2019-12-09 05:36:22.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 7:

Squashed [1] to this according to the idea, "single --member-of option would be enough and less confusing" that Pawel suggested in the comment on PS6.


[1] https://review.opendev.org/#/c/695865/'}, {'account_id': 30143, 'date': '2019-12-11 09:22:15.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 7: Code-Review+1

It is exactly what I meant in my previous comment. Thanks for taking care of it.'}, {'account_id': 9708, 'date': '2020-01-13 12:48:41.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 7: Code-Review+2

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 25625, 'date': '2020-01-14 05:10:33.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 8.'}, {'account_id': 25625, 'date': '2020-01-14 06:12:55.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 7:

commit_message:
Support multiple member_of query parameter

The ``openstack allocation candidate list`` and the ``openstack
allocation candidate list`` command now supports ``--member-of``
option, which accepts a list of comma-separated UUIDs of the
resource provider aggregates. If this is specified, the returned
resource providers must be associated with at least one of the
aggregates identified by uuid. This option can be repeated to
add(restrict) the condition with ``--os-placement-api-version 1.24``
or greater.

This deprecates the ``--aggregate-uuid`` option because it is
difficult to keep using this option to support multiple ``member_of``
feature added in microversion 1.24.

Change-Id: I0f3068c411c504380918f27f994734528fe55c77
Co-Autored-By: Tetsuro Nakamura <tetsuro.nakamura.bc@hco.ntt.co.jp>
Story: #2006940
Task: #37613

I ran into a problem with this patch in testing.

1. There is not help text for the TLS version field. I noticed this when I could not enter "TLSv1.2,TLSv1.3" in the field.
2. The required formatting on the field seems odd. My natural instinct was to put a comma separated list in this field, but it won't accept it. Can we make this field more flexible or at least document the required formatting? I had to put one version per line for it to take the change.'}, {'account_id': 29244, 'date': '2021-03-19 15:27:22.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6:

> Patch Set 6: Code-Review-1
> 
> I ran into a problem with this patch in testing.
> 
> 1. There is not help text for the TLS version field. I noticed this when I could not enter "TLSv1.2,TLSv1.3" in the field.

Ack, I will add the help text for this new field.


> 2. The required formatting on the field seems odd. My natural instinct was to put a comma separated list in this field, but it won't accept it. Can we make this field more flexible or at least document the required formatting? I had to put one version per line for it to take the change.

The next textarea uses the ng-list="
" attribute, it allows to automatically convert a string with comma-separated items into a multiline textarea (one item per line), and it does the reverse conversion when the form is submitted.
I agree that without neither help nor placeholder value, it can be confusing for someone who knowns the API.
I can reverted it to a simple comma-separated string'}, {'account_id': 29244, 'date': '2021-03-19 15:27:55.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6: Workflow-1'}]

If you want, you can go to 1.20 and cleanup the config file to use the new default. I would +1 such a change that updates all conf.py files as well.

Just changing the requirements is no problem, the current code works fine with either the current version or a new one. While I recommend using the new version, there's no reason to stop using the old ones, and thus this change is not recommended.

See also discussion in https://review.opendev.org/#/c/668081"}, {'account_id': 28935, 'date': '2019-06-30 02:27:13.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1'}, {'account_id': 27822, 'date': '2019-07-01 02:54:24.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 6547, 'date': '2019-07-01 07:17:02.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review-1

commit_message:
Bump the openstackdocstheme extension to 1.20

Some options are now automatically configured by the version 1.20:
- project
- html_last_updated_fmt
- latex_engine
- latex_elements
- version
- release.

This will show other versions of the doc, too.

Change-Id: Id8315bc45c8dedce4d7cf76a4078a380f67b8bb0

commit_message:
Delete encryption key after upload-to-image failure

Now upload the encrypted volume to image, if uploading the encrypted volume
to image fails, there is no process to delete the encryption key, the key will
remain. This patch adds process of deleting the key after uploading the encrypted
volume to the image fails.

Closes-bug: #1882019

Change-Id: I4a0b30126e8ffbdd9f27bbe6ea6e66efd1909483

[{'created': '2021-03-04 13:38:51.000000000', 'message': 'Reduce number of the workers in fullstack gate job

Fullstack job is using different tox env in the gate
(dsvm-fullstack-gate). To reduce memory usage in that job, some
time ago, in patch [1] we reduced number of test workers from 4
to 3. But it was done for "dsvm-fullstack" tox env, not for

Now it is changed also in the CI job's tox env.

Change-Id: Iec949922be0779a00bf405c2f1d5646c588d323c

(cherry picked from commit d9542b6a0164cbe0c0fd32b15d0d5db652d47a2f)

commit_message:
Reduce number of the workers in fullstack gate job

Fullstack job is using different tox env in the gate
(dsvm-fullstack-gate). To reduce memory usage in that job, some
time ago, in patch [1] we reduced number of test workers from 4
to 3. But it was done for "dsvm-fullstack" tox env, not for
"dsvm-fullstack-gate" thus it had no effect on our CI runs.
Now it is changed also in the CI job's tox env.

[1] https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/neutron/+/764907

Change-Id: Iec949922be0779a00bf405c2f1d5646c588d323c
Related-Bug: #1906366
(cherry picked from commit d9542b6a0164cbe0c0fd32b15d0d5db652d47a2f)

revisions:
[{'created': '2021-03-18 20:39:03.000000000', 'message': '[WIP] Fix root UUID for streamed partition images

The root UUID changes after a streamed partition image is written to
the block device, causing later deployment failure when assuming the
old UUID. There is already a _fix_up_partition_uuids method for fixing
the root UUID but it excludes partition images.

This change includes partition images which are streamed in
_fix_up_partition_uuids. This issue may have been missed in local
testing because deploying the same image repeatedly will result in
stable root UUID across runs.

Change-Id: Ice4630c16fc216980488d1427f3b02e1b8a417fa

commit_message:
Fix root UUID for streamed partition images

The root UUID changes after a streamed partition image is written to
the block device, causing later deployment failure when assuming the
old UUID.

This change updates the root UUID after streaming the partition image
is complete.

This issue may have been missed in local testing because deploying the
same image repeatedly will result in stable root UUID across runs.

Change-Id: Ice4630c16fc216980488d1427f3b02e1b8a417fa

commit_message:
Reduce number of the workers in fullstack gate job

Fullstack job is using different tox env in the gate
(dsvm-fullstack-gate). To reduce memory usage in that job, some
time ago, in patch [1] we reduced number of test workers from 4
to 3. But it was done for "dsvm-fullstack" tox env, not for
"dsvm-fullstack-gate" thus it had no effect on our CI runs.
Now it is changed also in the CI job's tox env.

[1] https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/neutron/+/764907

Change-Id: Iec949922be0779a00bf405c2f1d5646c588d323c
Related-Bug: #1906366
(cherry picked from commit d9542b6a0164cbe0c0fd32b15d0d5db652d47a2f)

[{'created': '2021-03-19 14:49:07.000000000', 'message': 'Add support for allocation candidates in trees

Microversion 1.29 of Placement available since the rocky release changed
what allocation candidates the server might return: it is able to return
allocation candidates organized in trees. Versions before that, remove
any allocation candidates from the response that contain multiple
providers from the same tree.

Change-Id: I88970d70e78e36b5355ff82a4379460869a68929
'}]
commit_message:
Add support for allocation candidates in trees

Microversion 1.29 of Placement available since the rocky release changed
what allocation candidates the server might return: it is able to return
allocation candidates organized in trees. Versions before that, remove
any allocation candidates from the response that contain multiple
providers from the same tree.

Change-Id: I88970d70e78e36b5355ff82a4379460869a68929

commit_message:
remove py37

Remove python3.7 from setup.cfg, since Wallaby's python
supported runtimes are python 3.6 and python 3.8[1]:

[1]: https://governance.openstack.org/tc/reference/runtimes/wallaby.htm

Change-Id: I4552bea3d42c504da326e990535f798ede028f1f

commit_message:
Upgrade pip version to fix pep-517 enforcing

This upgrade fixes an issue in some disitributions when the build environment
enforces pep-517 and breaks compiling some versions of python libraries.
For example see [1]

[1] https://github.com/sqlalchemy/alembic/issues/707

Story: 2008676
Task: 41973

Change-Id: If3e5d37a42de2fb25c8034d9fdebb16d8bd21e9f
(cherry picked from commit 381aa41d8fe81a11b2276c535bee1f9cfb482780)

commit_message:
[SR-IOV] Do not fail if ip-link vf "min_tx_rate" is not supported

Some NICs do not support ip-link vf "min_tx_rate" parameter. This is
not an API issue (ip-link or Pyroute2); the parameter is already
supported. The error is returned by the specific NIC driver.

A sanity check is implemented, reading the SR-IOV configured devices
("physical_device_mappings") and the excluded VFs ("exclude_devices").

Change-Id: If70de0a7112777ac4011ad42af0ac98969765011
Closes-Bug: #1918464
(cherry picked from commit 3a9e81bbb8e5a56bd69a1edf1d2922276841157b)

commit_message:
[SR-IOV] Do not fail if ip-link vf "min_tx_rate" is not supported

Some NICs do not support ip-link vf "min_tx_rate" parameter. This is
not an API issue (ip-link or Pyroute2); the parameter is already
supported. The error is returned by the specific NIC driver.

A sanity check is implemented, reading the SR-IOV configured devices
("physical_device_mappings") and the excluded VFs ("exclude_devices").

Change-Id: If70de0a7112777ac4011ad42af0ac98969765011
Closes-Bug: #1918464
(cherry picked from commit 3a9e81bbb8e5a56bd69a1edf1d2922276841157b)

commit_message:
Remove linters dependency from content-provider in gate

As part of [1] lets remove the dependency on linters from the
content-provider in the gate, in line with all the other repos.
We don't want to delay the gate for linting since any issues should
be resolved before a change hits the gate. Also removes unused
yaml anchors.

[1] https://review.opendev.org/q/topic:tripleo-ci-reduce

Change-Id: I9d440504c938c57a287282d94108c55f29c443f9

commit_message:
Set ovn_chassis_mac_map in ovn::controller

For distributed vlan in ovn we need to add support of
creating mac addresses per compute and seting them in
external_ids:ovn-chassis-mac-mappings.

Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/776210
Related-Bug: #1881593
Change-Id: I785400969efba0062aabdca9af2726a7603ef840

commit_message:
Add dependency between content provider and linters in check layout

As part of [1] and in line with the other repos let's make the
content provider job depend on openstack-tox-linters passing but
only in the check layout.

[1] https://review.opendev.org/q/topic:tripleo-ci-reduce

Change-Id: I796b8c8e11320308d9d81320d4ec188b13b73cc3

commit_message:
Remove linters dependency from content-provider in gate

As part of [1] lets remove the dependency on linters from the
content-provider in the gate, in line with all the other repos.
We don't want to delay the gate for linting since any issues should
be resolved before a change hits the gate.

[1] https://review.opendev.org/q/topic:tripleo-ci-reduce

Change-Id: I7a4164742aafd0f11fafb7af9c244cb22400992f

[{'created': '2021-03-17 09:47:04.000000000', 'message': "Remove layout overrides + wire up standalone-scenarios-pipeline

As part of [1] lets tidy up the layout here. Removes scenario4 from
the zuul layout and instead wires up standalone-scenarios-pipeline.
The depends-on adds the files: match into scenario4 so we can keep
the existing behaviour - i.e. only scenario4 will match and run.

Also removes the dependency on linters from the content-provider
in the gate, in line with all the other repos. We don't want to
delay the gate for linting since any issues should be resolved
before a change hits the gate.

Finally removes unused yaml anchors.

[1] https://review.opendev.org/q/topic:tripleo-ci-reduce
Depends-On: I2acdae47a57d1c2e051bd18c3dd5b14bfa2e76b5 # tripleo-ci

commit_message:
Remove linters dependency from content-provider in gate

As part of [1] lets remove the dependency on linters from the
content-provider in the gate, in line with all the other repos.
We don't want to delay the gate for linting since any issues should
be resolved before a change hits the gate.

[1] https://review.opendev.org/q/topic:tripleo-ci-reduce

Change-Id: I31ad623cae3db284b4f6b694033fab5bb9dc4360

subject: Check Ceph cluster healthy state before starting FS to BS playbook
revisions:
[{'created': '2021-03-17 08:14:17.000000000', 'message': 'Check Ceph cluster healthy state before starting FS to BS playbook

The Ceph OSDs migration from filestore to bluestore should only be
attempted if the cluster is in HEALTH_OK state because during the
process OSDs will be destroyed and recreated.

This change adds a check to poll for the cluster status before the
playbook is triggered.

Change-Id: Ib9c90c4c2e838bed461ac63139b161ab689d28cf
Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/777563
Closes-Bug: 1915700
(cherry picked from commit 5250e6d595c7ad97059930809fbeda9b17c1b364)
(cherry picked from commit 1b57684556ae9e61a3088c1cd63db3f0adfb895c)
(cherry picked from commit 36e28d2d364c3215357fd14b2dbc0c53f85b7944)
'}]
commit_message:
Check Ceph cluster healthy state before starting FS to BS playbook

The Ceph OSDs migration from filestore to bluestore should only be
attempted if the cluster is in HEALTH_OK state because during the
process OSDs will be destroyed and recreated.

This change adds a check to poll for the cluster status before the
playbook is triggered.

Change-Id: Ib9c90c4c2e838bed461ac63139b161ab689d28cf
Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/777563
Closes-Bug: 1915700
(cherry picked from commit 5250e6d595c7ad97059930809fbeda9b17c1b364)
(cherry picked from commit 1b57684556ae9e61a3088c1cd63db3f0adfb895c)
(cherry picked from commit 36e28d2d364c3215357fd14b2dbc0c53f85b7944)

subject: Add designate::db::postgresql class.
messages:
[{'account_id': 32755, 'date': '2021-03-17 19:16:53.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 32755, 'date': '2021-03-17 19:22:41.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

I just noticed that puppet-designate, contrary to the other modules like
puppet-nova (https://opendev.org/openstack/puppet-nova/src/branch/master/manifests/db/postgresql.pp), puppet-keystone (https://opendev.org/openstack/puppet-keystone/src/branch/master/manifests/db/postgresql.pp), ... does not implement a designate::db::postgresql class
to create a postgresql db and corresponding credentials.

This change intends to align this.'}, {'account_id': 14985, 'date': '2021-03-18 14:34:55.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 32755, 'date': '2021-03-19 08:54:16.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Thanks @Alex.

I'd love to propose a backport to stable/victoria and stable/ussuri.
For victoria I could simply cherry-pick this change (once it's merged) and certainly this would be the right approach.

Unfortunately ussuri still uses the removed password_hash function for databases (https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/puppet-openstacklib/+/728595) - should I propose an individual change then?"}, {'account_id': 9816, 'date': '2021-03-19 12:05:58.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1

> Patch Set 1:
> 
> Thanks @Alex.
> 
> I'd love to propose a backport to stable/victoria and stable/ussuri.
> For victoria I could simply cherry-pick this change (once it's merged) and certainly this would be the right approach.
> 
> Unfortunately ussuri still uses the removed password_hash function for databases (https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/puppet-openstacklib/+/728595) - should I propose an individual change then?

I'd recommend you backport the change but modify the backport so that it can work with old version of puppet-openstacklib (Use password_hash). Please document that is commit message."}]

This allows Designate to be used with PostgreSQL.

commit_message:
Add TLS options to oslo.cache

This patch specifies a set of options required to build a TLS context.
The context built from those options can later on be passed to any of
the oslo.cache backends that supports TLS connections.

Train note: Test modifications are not ported to Train, since the
specific test that was modified doesn't exist in Train.

Depends-on: https://review.opendev.org/774120
Change-Id: I835641d402e6cbd6650efd0d7a1fb16fb361350e
(cherry picked from commit 7ae8aa377e393c28af1d8d6b0ba059b984da0725)

revisions:
[{'created': '2021-03-11 18:28:54.000000000', 'message': "Stable-CI: Disable ansible testing on ussuri

There is a chicken/egg problem in CI.

1) Ironic-python-agent-builder is branchless and we can only
   checkout v2.2.0.
2) We might be able to fix that, if we get a branch and tag
   and blah, but release team has basically said no to stuff
   like that in the past.
3) Newer ubuntu kernels don't play well with chroot being
   used with tinyipa. This has been addressed elsewhere,
   but this is functionally a pure chicken/egg sort of
   issue here.
4) Ansible deploy interface requires injection of an ssh key
   so even if we're using pre-built ramdisk images, we can't
   chroot into them nor to fix the branch, also because
   standalone job would still fail as it uses the v2.2.0
   version.

The only clear path I can see is to disable the ansible
deploy interface on this branch.

I view this as low risk because:
1) The underlying CI infrastucture kernel version is what broke the
   build, and we're stuck.
2) We're not actively adding features that would impact the ansible
   deploy interface. Essentially the branch is just in maintenance
   and is a target for backports of fixes.
3) We have no other real option, and in the mean time all
   ironic-tempest-plugin patches are blocked and anything
   destined to stable/ussuri is also blocked due to this
   issue. In other words, this is the least evil, most impactful
   path as far as I can see.

Change-Id: I36199bbf9b8b003c8c94187e790f39c3bc44f45e

   ironic-tempest-plugin patches are blocked and anything
   destined to stable/ussuri is also blocked due to this
   issue. In other words, this is the least evil, most impactful
   path as far as I can see.

This patch disables voting on the multinode job on limestone.
The same has been performed on master branch as the CI job seems

commit_message:
Stable-CI: Disable ansible testing on ussuri

There is a chicken/egg problem in CI.

1) Ironic-python-agent-builder is branchless and we can only
   checkout v2.2.0.
2) We might be able to fix that, if we get a branch and tag
   and blah, but release team has basically said no to stuff
   like that in the past.
3) Newer ubuntu kernels don't play well with chroot being
   used with tinyipa. This has been addressed elsewhere,
   but this is functionally a pure chicken/egg sort of
   issue here.
4) Ansible deploy interface requires injection of an ssh key
   so even if we're using pre-built ramdisk images, we can't
   chroot into them nor to fix the branch, also because
   standalone job would still fail as it uses the v2.2.0
   version.

The only clear path I can see is to disable the ansible
deploy interface on this branch.

I view this as low risk because:
1) The underlying CI infrastucture kernel version is what broke the
   build, and we're stuck.
2) We're not actively adding features that would impact the ansible
   deploy interface. Essentially the branch is just in maintenance
   and is a target for backports of fixes.
3) We have no other real option, and in the mean time all
   ironic-tempest-plugin patches are blocked and anything
   destined to stable/ussuri is also blocked due to this
   issue. In other words, this is the least evil, most impactful
   path as far as I can see.

Also:

This patch disables voting on the multinode job on limestone.
The same has been performed on master branch as the CI job seems
to fail on limestone for cross-node connectivity reasons with the
vxlan tunnel.

Change-Id: I36199bbf9b8b003c8c94187e790f39c3bc44f45e

The ussuri standalone job has been broken for some time
as it attempts to use the ansible deployment interface and

patch to ironic-python-agent-builder, and an incorrect build
somewhere along the way, this job has become horribly broken
and fails on attempting to inject an ssh key into tinyipa for
the ansible deployment interface to be exercised.

Since this is not critical, the job can be marked non-voting
for now to unblock the tempest plugin's CI.

commit_message:
Mark ussuri standalone job non-voting

The ussuri standalone job has been broken for some time
as it attempts to use the ansible deployment interface and
due to a convergence of unluckiness (ci changing, last minute
patch to ironic-python-agent-builder, and an incorrect build
somewhere along the way, this job has become horribly broken
and fails on attempting to inject an ssh key into tinyipa for
the ansible deployment interface to be exercised.

Since this is not critical, the job can be marked non-voting
for now to unblock the tempest plugin's CI.

Change-Id: I5f61d34db7bfb6e3efaccd159310c7c793180bca

commit_message:
[OpenstackSDK] Create for all client and non-client lib wallaby branch

This creates the stable/wallaby branch for all client and non-client libraries
now that we are past the lib freeze on March 11.

If a team wants to wait for a specific patch to make it to the library,
someone from the team can -1 the patch to have it held,or update that
patch with a different commit SHA.

Patches with no response will be merged by Friday, March 19.

Change-Id: I0d9e2637dc5d3dbbb7fd3fd9649de1d7806832be

commit_message:
Increment API version for Secure RBAC

This patch increments the API version for the Secure RBAC
as was covered in the specification in order to signify to
API consumers that may need to be aware if the API surface
can support Secure RBAC policy configuration.

Change-Id: Ia659708bb89ff416b65367505d3e068c6d4a198f

commit_message:
[cloudkitty] Create for all client and non-client lib wallaby branch

This creates the stable/wallaby branch for all client and non-client
libraries
now that we are past the lib freeze on March 11.

If a team wants to wait for a specific patch to make it to the library,
someone from the team can -1 the patch to have it held,or update that
patch with a different commit SHA.

Patches with no response will be merged by Friday, March 19.

Change-Id: I1db88bff404997c56a08dae10bd4dcc66a23e9d6

commit_message:
[glance] Create for all client and non-client lib wallaby branch

This creates the stable/wallaby branch for all client and non-client libraries
now that we are past the lib freeze on March 11.

If a team wants to wait for a specific patch to make it to the library,
someone from the team can -1 the patch to have it held,or update that
patch with a different commit SHA.

Patches with no response will be merged by Friday, March 19.

Change-Id: I906c016b142e28d741fd6af14eeef9d870ebf283

Update the URL to the upper-constraints file to point to the redirect
rule on releases.openstack.org so that anyone working on this branch
will switch to the correct upper-constraints list automatically when
the requirements repository branches.

Until the requirements repository has as stable/victoria branch, tests will
continue to use the upper-constraints list on master.

Change-Id: I7958561f7cd1b5b5491d80dbc142d83e0388683d
'}]
commit_message:
Update TOX_CONSTRAINTS_FILE for stable/victoria

Update the URL to the upper-constraints file to point to the redirect
rule on releases.openstack.org so that anyone working on this branch
will switch to the correct upper-constraints list automatically when
the requirements repository branches.

Until the requirements repository has as stable/victoria branch, tests will
continue to use the upper-constraints list on master.

Change-Id: I7958561f7cd1b5b5491d80dbc142d83e0388683d

[{'created': '2021-03-08 03:07:44.000000000', 'message': "Support configuring cinder's RPC and WSGI timeouts

New CinderRpcResponseTimeout and CinderApiWsgiTimeout parameters
support configuring cinder's corresponding RPC response and WSGI
connection timeouts. The default values (60s each) match the existing
defaults.

Change-Id: I66b472d37041f67907691f55c153ff880093e4bc
(cherry picked from commit 3af965d6d26d3e6a8ddf48a158d930d308a3f70d)
"}]
commit_message:
Support configuring cinder's RPC and WSGI timeouts

New CinderRpcResponseTimeout and CinderApiWsgiTimeout parameters
support configuring cinder's corresponding RPC response and WSGI
connection timeouts. The default values (60s each) match the existing
defaults.

Change-Id: I66b472d37041f67907691f55c153ff880093e4bc
(cherry picked from commit 3af965d6d26d3e6a8ddf48a158d930d308a3f70d)

commit_message:
Refactor BM deployment to use '--work-dir' [1/2]

We added '--output-dir' just a few weeks ago, now it seems
we want to use '--work-dir'. See:
https://review.opendev.org/775302.

Let's re-factor to use the common consistent working directory.

commit_message:
Fix molecule jobs after release of cryptography3.4

Molecule jobs[0] fails with below error:-

ModuleNotFoundError: No module named 'setuptools_rust'

This error appeared following the release of cryptography 3.4, which
now includes Rust code. It can be installed without Rust using a
Python wheel, but only with more recent pip than version 9.0.3
available as RPM on CentOS 8.

The cryptography bug report [1] recommends pip>=19.1.1.

[0] https://e99635be2c7386b5beda-3dea60a35fb0d38e41c535f13b48e895.ssl.cf1.rackcdn.com/773531/1/gate/tripleo-ansible-centos-8-molecule-tripleo_network_config/b1284cd/job-output.txt
[1] https://github.com/pyca/cryptography/issues/5753
Related-Bug: #1915101

Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/tripleo-validations/+/774814
Change-Id: Ib5baad39dd7e43dff9046178c00b0f836dc18bae
(cherry picked from commit 0bf795117387177921b86f1e283fc16c204d96bf)
(cherry picked from commit 90b47a4609e480094378e7e06a84a362f05c21e2)
(cherry picked from commit b1ddfda621f7504246119b3560eb01df9664bbc2)

commit_message:
Fix molecule jobs after release of cryptography3.4

Molecule jobs[0] fails with below error:-

ModuleNotFoundError: No module named 'setuptools_rust'

This error appeared following the release of cryptography 3.4, which
now includes Rust code. It can be installed without Rust using a
Python wheel, but only with more recent pip than version 9.0.3
available as RPM on CentOS 8.

The cryptography bug report [1] recommends pip>=19.1.1.

[0] https://e99635be2c7386b5beda-3dea60a35fb0d38e41c535f13b48e895.ssl.cf1.rackcdn.com/773531/1/gate/tripleo-ansible-centos-8-molecule-tripleo_network_config/b1284cd/job-output.txt
[1] https://github.com/pyca/cryptography/issues/5753
Related-Bug: #1915101

Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/tripleo-validations/+/774814
Change-Id: Ib5baad39dd7e43dff9046178c00b0f836dc18bae
(cherry picked from commit 0bf795117387177921b86f1e283fc16c204d96bf)
(cherry picked from commit 90b47a4609e480094378e7e06a84a362f05c21e2)

commit_message:
Remove Deprecated Ceph Environment Files

hyperconverged-ceph.yaml has been deprecated since Nov 2017.
storage-environment.yaml has been deprecated since Jan 2018.
storage-environment-external.yaml has been deprecated since
Jan 2018. tuned-ceph-filestore-hci.yaml is only for Filestore,
though Bluestore has been the default for multiple Ceph releases.
update-from-ceph-newton.yaml is not needed for Wallaby.

Change-Id: Icb0d1fe6c3e67d99a5152b62572d7d2a2798a124

commit_message:
Remove ovn_dbs puppet_config section

There are no config files generated whatsoever. The folder is created
and empty and since it has no manifests there is little point in running it at all.
Let's just remove it.

Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/tripleo-ansible/+/776589
Change-Id: I5e1519c8f441213b264008fda62a1a442cf9d243

When we disable inject facts by default, there were some additional
roles that we missed (ipaclient).  We can just set the legacy facts to
prevent issues with missing distribution var updates.

Change-Id: Ib488a6573c035fc8288a4b24461af56d40416c5d
Related-Bug: #1919064
(cherry picked from commit d8408ebb86efdda0055ae41c6db350c14772dc6a)
'}]
commit_message:
Add legacy fact setting

When we disable inject facts by default, there were some additional
roles that we missed (ipaclient).  We can just set the legacy facts to
prevent issues with missing distribution var updates.

Change-Id: Ib488a6573c035fc8288a4b24461af56d40416c5d
Related-Bug: #1919064
(cherry picked from commit d8408ebb86efdda0055ae41c6db350c14772dc6a)

commit_message:
Add command to list security groups of a server

Adding command "openstack server security group list"
to list security groups of a server. Similar to command
"nova list-secgroup".

Change-Id: I3e727756fdfd26b58796815396b2b7a5a491e39b
Closes-Bug: #1606221

commit_message:
To include 'Project' column for 'port list --long' command

Include a column 'Project' that displays the tenant_id,
when port details are viewed with --long option

Change-Id: I55fad2b71d8a02db6dbf7624b3398e4765a08491
Closes-Bug: #1648001

'}, {'created': '2021-03-15 00:53:42.000000000', 'message': "Release cybrog RC2

This patch we were released Cyborg rc1, the mainly change as below:

root@ubuntu:cyborg# git log --oneline --no-merges 5.0.0..cb448b65
0605fe3 support configuring multiple vgpu types in cyborg
ce88d4e Add tags to .gitignore
e3caf5c Add intel NIC driver
3d53b7a Add newline to enable lists
8fcc050 Trival: Fix the key error in log msg
683c26e Installation document improvement
4f04cfa remove py37
39d51a0 remove unicode from code
cacf914 Use TOX_CONSTRAINTS_FILE
583cc45 Refresh cyborg-api link
3965593 Change the dependency with the testenv:docs
54b4fa5 Dep's should be restricted by upper-constraints
0e5b370 refresh device profile link in API doc
acac833 Import HTTPStatus instead of http_client
a069962 Add project_id description in api_ref
38d395d Remove cyborg-dbsync unsupport argument
eabd6e1 Add microversion instructions
7f28d54 Add intel_qat_driver for enabled_drivers help
332c959 Add packages required for pdf-docs run to bindep.txt
0da7417 Add index page for contributors guide
2b50fd9 Remove tmp bitstream file always
71f790e Correct some small errors
4da09b9 Refactor device_profile retrieve in ARQ post API
f7bc91e Bump py37 to py38 in tox.ini
bdc1aab Add releasenote for policy refresh base and device profile
policies
bb4fd10 improve pep8 check logic
02e573b Remove usage of six
c61e8ef Add fast8 check for cybrog
68c1f06 add document for cyborg new policy
addd88d Add Python3 wallaby unit tests
8966c57 Update master for stable/victoria
1a45115 Signal to conductor service to apply patch accelerator requests.
3fe4c76 Add rc check for POST Device Profile
315e147 Add trait check for POST Device Profile
99fd79e fix cyborg uwsgi doc error
af49d0b Change default policy file from JSON to YAML
a5e6b0e Replace wsme to `convert_with_links` for device profile API

Another change is add some links for the highlights.

Change-Id: Ifca070c3953fc858caa5ce27bed6bc68524657b2

commit_message:
Release cybrog RC1

This patch we were released Cyborg rc1, the mainly change as below:

root@ubuntu:cyborg# git log --oneline --no-merges 5.0.0..f9835cff
453e4ac Remove ARQInvalidState exception
15b1d62 improve drivers with enumerate()
8d56b2b bug-fix: correct the comment for each vendor driver
19b7d14 Add NVMe SSD driver
7b1b9fb Update server operations support in matrix
0605fe3 support configuring multiple vgpu types in cyborg
ce88d4e Add tags to .gitignore
e3caf5c Add intel NIC driver
3d53b7a Add newline to enable lists
ced87f7 Revert "remove py37"
8fcc050 Trival: Fix the key error in log msg
683c26e Installation document improvement

It's similar with my patch https://review.openstack.org/#/c/423081/ (Volume display_name -> name).

I saw the current implementation that change 'project' column to 'project_id' and 'project_name', it break backward compatibility "quota show -c project".

So, in my opinions, I prefer to only use project_id at here, not project_name, and add some logic to keep backward compatibility, like in my volume patch.'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2017-07-25 17:42:11.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Verified-1

commit_message:
Fix the output of quota show

This patch fixes the improper output of "quota show" command,
'project_name' and 'project_id' will show right information.

Change-Id: I33d455c7203659da0ad39da43760d81b32c1c8c0
Closes-Bug: #1663151

Thank you for your first contribution to OpenStack.

    Your patch will now be tested automatically by OpenStack testing frameworks
    and once the automatic tests pass, it will be reviewed by other friendly
    developers. They will give you feedback and may require you to refine it.

    People seldom get their patch approved on the first try, so don't be
    concerned if requested to make corrections. Feel free to modify your patch
    and resubmit a new change-set.

    Patches usually take 3 to 7 days to be reviewed so be patient and be
    available on IRC to ask and answer questions about your work. Also it
    takes generally at least a couple of weeks for cores to get around to
    reviewing code. The more you participate in the community the more
    rewarding it is for you. You may also notice that the more you get to know
    people and get to be known, the faster your patches will be reviewed and
    eventually approved. Get to know others and become known by doing code
    reviews: anybody can do it, and it's a great way to learn the code base.

    Thanks again for supporting OpenStack, we look forward to working with you.
