commit_message:
enable glance client to support client cert

This patch solved problems that fail when glance endpoint is HTTPS.
fail operations are below
 * openstack server create
 * openstack image show

Change-Id: Id111275c012bbdd8c4d7070a05e4a8999e34abd7
Related-Bug: #1712282

subject: List images with --tags for 'openstack image list'

commit_message:
List images with --tags for 'openstack image list'

Now user can list images with --tags options using
command 'openstack image list'.

Change-Id: I96ea9a684ed634ecedfc8f06101bc297d541ec1f
Closes-Bug: #1702066

(1 comment)

This requires better descriptions. `messages` API is supposed to return internal messages that tell the user why volume operation failed. This should be indicated in docs and help texts.

One of key imperatives of OSC is consistency. `messages` API in Cinder is very similar to Nova's instance faults which are simply attached to Nova's response for server query. We should look if "messages" is correct command name here.'}, {'account_id': 22227, 'date': '2017-01-25 15:53:35.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 7:

(1 comment)

> (1 comment)
 > 
 > This requires better descriptions. `messages` API is supposed to
 > return internal messages that tell the user why volume operation
 > failed. This should be indicated in docs and help texts.
 > 
 > One of key imperatives of OSC is consistency. `messages` API in
 > Cinder is very similar to Nova's instance faults which are simply
 > attached to Nova's response for server query. We should look if
 > "messages" is correct command name here.

Can we agree on a proper name for this? The docs refer them as user messages and the API is called messages which is why chose to call it message.'}, {'account_id': 22227, 'date': '2017-01-25 16:10:19.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 8.'}, {'account_id': 22227, 'date': '2017-01-25 16:14:48.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 9.'}, {'account_id': 22227, 'date': '2017-01-25 16:43:13.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 10.'}, {'account_id': 22227, 'date': '2017-01-25 16:47:17.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 11: Published edit on patch set 10'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2017-01-25 19:13:41.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 11: Verified-1

(10 comments)

Justin, thanks for hanging in there with this.

I've finally taken a close look, and am just commenting on the commands/docs themselves.  The version/microversion stuff will need more work, and I think we need to sort out the general pattern for properly handling these across OSC.

If you are not ready to support the list options, leave them out until we get the base commands added.  They will not be a breaking CLI change to add later.  Also, --opts and --sort really need to be implemented as actual filter options and not require an API-style string argument with field names that may/are different from what the user sees."}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2017-03-02 21:42:23.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 23: Verified-1

commit_message:
Add support for Cinder API 3.3/3.5 into OSC

This patch implements the neccessary commands to utilize the
Messages API introduced in Cinder API version 3.3. Version 3.5
only implemented pagination support for these commands which is
present in this patch as well.

volume message get <ID>
volume message list
volume message delete <ID>

Change-Id: I13e69a2ac4d80baf464001c0162939fe7ab4a2b5

commit_message:
Add puppetlabs-apache to dependencies

Because we include some classes from puppetlabs-apache direcly, we
should include it in a list of dependencies.

Change-Id: I96466e9d488834e2fcd9b9a81913baf09e8677de

zosci-recheck'}, {'account_id': 20870, 'date': '2021-03-05 13:53:43.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2: Patch Set 1 was rebased.'}, {'account_id': 31289, 'date': '2021-03-11 10:17:27.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review-1

OSCI failed on an infra issue (Juju machine not coming up). zosci failed on pip-installing the wheelhouse, which is similar to the issue in https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/charm-octavia-diskimage-retrofit/+/776382'}, {'account_id': 20870, 'date': '2021-03-11 10:27:38.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

charm-recheck'}, {'account_id': 20634, 'date': '2021-03-18 06:27:43.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

zosci-recheck'}, {'account_id': 20634, 'date': '2021-03-18 06:27:57.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

In the last Zosci run, one of the OVN units was in an error state'}, {'account_id': 31289, 'date': '2021-03-18 13:53:28.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

neutron-api-plugin-ovn/0 failed on installing the wheelhouse

subprocess.CalledProcessError: Command '['/var/lib/juju/agents/unit-neutron-api-plugin-ovn-0/.venv/bin/pip', 'install', '-U', '--force-reinstall', '--no-index', '--no-cache-dir', '-f', 'wheelhouse', 'pyaml', 'charms.reactive', 'netaddr', 'Jinja2', 'oslo.i18n', 'urllib3', 'requests', 'importlib-metadata', 'wheel', 'pbr', 'charmhelpers', 'chardet', 'psutil', 'certifi', 'dnspython', 'netifaces', 'idna', 'charms.openstack', 'zipp', 'Tempita', 'rfc3986', 'stevedore', 'wrapt', 'six', 'MarkupSafe', 'PyYAML', 'typing-extensions', 'debtcollector', 'oslo.config']' returned non-zero exit status 1."}, {'account_id': 20634, 'date': '2021-03-18 15:37:56.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 31289, 'date': '2021-03-19 11:13:47.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1

Correct zOSCI behavior. Failures on Victoria seem to be infra-related. Landing, thanks!'}]

The issue is that when a port group doesn't have a mac address assigned by
operators, and during provisioning we unbind/bind tenant port with None which
causes the mac address to be regenerated twice and differs from the originally

commit_message:
Fixes the issue that instance bond port can't get IP address

The issue is that when a port group doesn't have a mac address assigned by
operators, and during provisioning we unbind/bind tenant port with None which
causes the mac address to be regenerated twice and differs from the originally
one allocated by nova or users which was packed into config drive. The end result
is that, bond port has different mac address configured and can't the IP address
from neutron.

Story: 2008300
Task: 41185
(cherry picked from commit fe01ddb2bce12dc1693d64a30e5b1b822e7b839e)

Conflicts:
	ironic/common/neutron.py
	ironic/drivers/modules/network/common.py

Change-Id: I92ed5d17239216324d6a69e0ed8771fd6948d6ec

revisions:
[{'created': '2021-03-16 11:48:22.000000000', 'message': 'Fix `_data_table.html` weird conditional.

While troubleshooting a problem with pagination I noticed the
following conditional in `horizon/templates/horizon/common/_data_table.html`:

```
      {% if table.number_of_pages is defined %}
        {% include "horizon/common/_data_table_pagination.html" %}
      {% else %}
        {% include "horizon/common/_data_table_pagination_with_pages.html" %}
      {% endif %}
```

At first sight, it looks wrong. I mean, if there are
number_of_pages, we should use `_data_table_pagination_with_pages.html`.
However, this conditional solves to `True` if
table.number_of_pages is NOT defined, and then it solves to `False`,
if it is defined. It is a very weird (to me) behavior.

Therefore, I am suggesting to use a more readable and understandable
conditional in this patch.

We can simply use `if table.number_of_pages is None`, which will
behave as expected; if there are not number of pages, we use the
traditional paging, and then, if there are number of pages, we use
the paged data table approach.

Change-Id: I933b1f9399f40569c7661c1db5776d468917b966
'}]
commit_message:
Fix `_data_table.html` weird conditional.

While troubleshooting a problem with pagination I noticed the
following conditional in `horizon/templates/horizon/common/_data_table.html`:

```
      {% if table.number_of_pages is defined %}
        {% include "horizon/common/_data_table_pagination.html" %}
      {% else %}
        {% include "horizon/common/_data_table_pagination_with_pages.html" %}
      {% endif %}
```

At first sight, it looks wrong. I mean, if there are
number_of_pages, we should use `_data_table_pagination_with_pages.html`.
However, this conditional solves to `True` if
table.number_of_pages is NOT defined, and then it solves to `False`,
if it is defined. It is a very weird (to me) behavior.

Therefore, I am suggesting to use a more readable and understandable
conditional in this patch.

We can simply use `if table.number_of_pages is None`, which will
behave as expected; if there are not number of pages, we use the
traditional paging, and then, if there are number of pages, we use
the paged data table approach.

Change-Id: I933b1f9399f40569c7661c1db5776d468917b966

commit_message:
Add runtime gpu capabilities to ilo inspection

Add gpu related dynamic capabilities in ilo inspection.
It would add following dynamic capabilities:

gpu_<vendor>_count : Integer
gpu_<gpu_device_name>_count : Integer
gpu_<gpu_device_name> : boolean

story: 2008702
task: 42023

Change-Id: Ic785fbe8a40d8a999e7e319a6505b46f82ba8344

commit_message:
WIP Remove /etc/cni/net.d/87-podman-bridge.conflist when empty

This removes a warning with podman3:
ERRO[0000] Error loading CNI config list file /etc/cni/net.d/87-podman-bridge.conflist: error parsing configuration list: no name

Change-Id: I5a4ce0af6e905daab459f3ced36e9860b04783f3

commit_message:
[SVF]: Volume name is not validated for host

[Spectrum Virtualize Family] During terminate_connection
volume_name is passed as input to ensure that volume
mapping for the host is removed.

Currently get_host_by_connector ignore the volume_name validation
if the host is found in the connector wwpns. This causes issues in
some scenarios where WWPNS from different host entry are passed.

Closes-Bug: #1892034

Change-Id: I55f7dd92a4a1bab4a6b00d1b42707aa98b4b2eae

commit_message:
Use TOX_CONSTRAINTS_FILE

UPPER_CONSTRAINTS_FILE is old name and deprecated
This allows to use upper-constraints file as more
readable way instead of UPPER_CONSTRAINTS_FILE=<lower-constraints file>.

Change-Id: I0c8c2c4a783c4f0ac9f7530d4d18937ce5b17c61

revisions:
[{'created': '2021-03-10 23:27:50.000000000', 'message': 'WIP: Fix invalid JSON generated by quota details

The value fetched by Quotasv2_detail.get_resources() is ultimate
returned by Reservation.get_total_reservations_map. The total_reserved
value is returned by a sqlalchemy sum(), and is of a type defined by
the database driver in use. PyMySQL returns a Decimal() here, which
the api layer serialises to JSON as a string.

Note that if a resource has no reservations then its value will be
defaulted in DbQuotaDriver.get_detailed_tenant_quotas to the integer
value 0. This means that the value is an integer if zero, or a string
otherwise. This causes parsing difficulties for client libraries which
do strict type checking.

TODO:
- File and reference a bug
- Tests

This patch has had manual testing only.

Change-Id: Icda0d63f2f5ea72bde423296c76aa46646fa98a8
'}, {'created': '2021-03-12 12:32:50.000000000', 'message': "Fix invalid JSON generated by quota details

The value fetched by Quotasv2_detail.get_resources() is ultimately
returned by Reservation.get_total_reservations_map. The total_reserved
value is returned by a sqlalchemy sum(), and is of a type defined by
the database driver in use. PyMySQL returns a Decimal here, which
the api layer serialises to JSON as a string.

Note that if a resource has no reservations then its value will be
defaulted in DbQuotaDriver.get_detailed_tenant_quotas to the integer
value 0. This means that the value is an integer if zero, or a string
otherwise. This causes parsing difficulties for client libraries which
do strict type checking.

TODO:
We need to work out how to test this. The issue is that the current
behaviour is define by the DB driver. MySQL returns a Decimal type,
which triggers the problem, whereas SQLite returns int, which does
not. We currently only run SQLite in unit and functional tests,
meaning we would need a new DB test framework to cover this bug there.

We could test the bug in Tempest, but the problem there would be
designing a deterministic test where we can be confident that a
reservation exists when we make the 'test' API call. I'm not currently
aware that this can be done deterministically, which puts us back
looking at writing a whole new db test framework for functional.

Meanwhile, I have manually tested that this resolves the issue in a
running system.

Closes-Bug: #1918565
Change-Id: Icda0d63f2f5ea72bde423296c76aa46646fa98a8
"}, {'created': '2021-03-15 19:26:29.000000000', 'message': "Fix invalid JSON generated by quota details

The value fetched by Quotasv2_detail.get_resources() is ultimately
returned by Reservation.get_total_reservations_map. The total_reserved
value is returned by a sqlalchemy sum(), and is of a type defined by
the database driver in use. PyMySQL returns a Decimal here, which
the api layer serialises to JSON as a string.

Note that if a resource has no reservations then its value will be
defaulted in DbQuotaDriver.get_detailed_tenant_quotas to the integer
value 0. This means that the value is an integer if zero, or a string
otherwise. This causes parsing difficulties for client libraries which
do strict type checking.

Testing note:
This method is already covered by the unit test
TestQuotaDbApi.test_get_reservations_for_resource, which also already
tests the return value and, implicitly, its type. However, it does not
currently fail because the unit tests run with SQLite rather than MySQL.
SQLite returns an int where MySQL returns a Decimal, which does not
trigger the bug.

TestQuotaDbApi.test_get_reservations_for_resource is sufficient to
demonstrate that the patch doesn't regress SQLite. We were not able to
think of a deterministic way to write a Tempest test for this, which
would cover MySQL. Ideally we would have the ability to run the DB test
suites under MySQL and PostreSQL in addition to SQLite using oslo.db's
OpportunisticDbFixture, but the scope of that is larger than this
change.

Closes-Bug: #1918565
Change-Id: Icda0d63f2f5ea72bde423296c76aa46646fa98a8
"}]
commit_message:
Fix invalid JSON generated by quota details

The value fetched by Quotasv2_detail.get_resources() is ultimately
returned by Reservation.get_total_reservations_map. The total_reserved
value is returned by a sqlalchemy sum(), and is of a type defined by
the database driver in use. PyMySQL returns a Decimal here, which
the api layer serialises to JSON as a string.

Note that if a resource has no reservations then its value will be
defaulted in DbQuotaDriver.get_detailed_tenant_quotas to the integer
value 0. This means that the value is an integer if zero, or a string
otherwise. This causes parsing difficulties for client libraries which
do strict type checking.

Testing note:
This method is already covered by the unit test
TestQuotaDbApi.test_get_reservations_for_resource, which also already
tests the return value and, implicitly, its type. However, it does not
currently fail because the unit tests run with SQLite rather than MySQL.
SQLite returns an int where MySQL returns a Decimal, which does not
trigger the bug.

TestQuotaDbApi.test_get_reservations_for_resource is sufficient to
demonstrate that the patch doesn't regress SQLite. We were not able to
think of a deterministic way to write a Tempest test for this, which
would cover MySQL. Ideally we would have the ability to run the DB test
suites under MySQL and PostreSQL in addition to SQLite using oslo.db's
OpportunisticDbFixture, but the scope of that is larger than this
change.

Closes-Bug: #1918565
Change-Id: Icda0d63f2f5ea72bde423296c76aa46646fa98a8

commit_message:
Use nodejs8-publish-to-npm for monasca-grafana-datasource

release-openstack-javascript job failed for monasca-grafana-datasource
(see details in [1]), which seems to be caused by old version of
nodejs. This patch replaces the publish job with nodejs version 4 to
the publish job with nodejs8.

[1] http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2021-March/021002.html

Change-Id: I1f9fb29aa36661ed60d748ae2764b6907aae2541

revisions:
[{'created': '2020-10-19 09:05:55.000000000', 'message': 'compute: Lock by instance.uuid lock during swap_volume

The libvirt driver is currently the only virt driver implementing swap
volume within Nova. While libvirt itself does support moving between
multiple volumes attached to the same instance at the same time the
current logic within the libvirt driver makes a call to
virDomainGetXMLDesc that fails if there are active block jobs against
any disk attached to the domain.

This change simply uses an instance.uuid based lock in the compute layer
to serialise requests to swap_volume to avoid this from being possible.

Closes-Bug: #1896621
Change-Id: Ic5ce2580e7638a47f1ffddb4edbb503bf490504c
(cherry picked from commit 6cf449bdd0d4beb95cf12311e7d2f8669e625fac)

commit_message:
compute: Lock by instance.uuid lock during swap_volume

The libvirt driver is currently the only virt driver implementing swap
volume within Nova. While libvirt itself does support moving between
multiple volumes attached to the same instance at the same time the
current logic within the libvirt driver makes a call to
virDomainGetXMLDesc that fails if there are active block jobs against
any disk attached to the domain.

This change simply uses an instance.uuid based lock in the compute layer
to serialise requests to swap_volume to avoid this from being possible.

Closes-Bug: #1896621
Change-Id: Ic5ce2580e7638a47f1ffddb4edbb503bf490504c
(cherry picked from commit 6cf449bdd0d4beb95cf12311e7d2f8669e625fac)
(cherry picked from commit eebf94b6540fcd16826067fac544b5a3238842a3)
(cherry picked from commit f7ba1aab5f6f76ba88d6cc63cde2ec246ee61ec5)

commit_message:
Disable BGPVPN panels when extension is missing

Auto-disable the project and admin BGP VPN Interconnection pannels
when the 'bgpvpn' Neutron API extension is not available as per
actual extension list api.

commit_message:
Allow configuring cinder mount point for glance cinder store

The new parameter CinderMountPointBase has been added which will be used
for mounting NFS volumes on glance nodes.
When glance uses cinder as store and cinder backend is NFS, the mount
point would be required to be set with this parameter.

Depends-On: I3f9004fd8abffefe8cfeee9011ed0e323652fdd1
Change-Id: Ie84fa812c71ccff8328a0c43e023f98522dd80fb
(cherry picked from commit 365f16e21d25e6ffeed65a65c22df48a857935b0)
(cherry picked from commit ad6eb8ae7ee104ed2595eacddfae43a3781a0425)

revisions:
[{'created': '2021-03-08 17:06:18.000000000', 'message': 'libvirt: Add parsing of firmware metadata files

Recent versions of libvirt provide the ability to auto-configure
firmware, using firmware metadata files provided by QEMU [1] to do so.
Unfortunately this feature is missing knobs to allow us to select e.g.
whether secure boot is enabled or what keys are enrolled [2]. Until
libvirt gains the ability to do this for us, we need to do it ourselves.

Add the ability to parse the firmware metadata files, providing a better
way to identify the location of firmware and NVRAM template files along
with the capabilities of same. This is pretty trivial thanks to the good
documentation that exists for same.

[1] https://github.com/qemu/qemu/blob/v5.2.0/docs/interop/firmware.json
[2] https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=1906500

Change-Id: If08cbe2d5f2b301ac92a183f15fb87a18836bff5
Signed-off-by: Stephen Finucane <stephenfin@redhat.com>
'}, {'created': '2021-03-09 12:38:32.000000000', 'message': 'libvirt: Add parsing of firmware metadata files

Recent versions of libvirt provide the ability to auto-configure

Unfortunately this feature is missing knobs to allow us to select e.g.
whether secure boot is enabled or what keys are enrolled [2]. Until
libvirt gains the ability to do this for us, we need to do it ourselves.

Add the ability to parse the firmware metadata files, providing a better
way to identify the location of firmware and NVRAM template files along
with the capabilities of same. This is pretty trivial thanks to the good
documentation that exists for same.

[1] https://github.com/qemu/qemu/blob/v5.2.0/docs/interop/firmware.json
[2] https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=1906500

Change-Id: If08cbe2d5f2b301ac92a183f15fb87a18836bff5
Signed-off-by: Stephen Finucane <stephenfin@redhat.com>
'}]
commit_message:
libvirt: Add parsing of firmware metadata files

Recent versions of libvirt provide the ability to auto-configure
firmware, using firmware metadata files provided by QEMU [1] to do so.
Unfortunately this feature is missing knobs to allow us to select e.g.
whether secure boot is enabled or what keys are enrolled [2]. Until
libvirt gains the ability to do this for us, we need to do it ourselves.

Add the ability to parse the firmware metadata files, providing a better
way to identify the location of firmware and NVRAM template files along
with the capabilities of same. This is pretty trivial thanks to the good
documentation that exists for same.

[1] https://github.com/qemu/qemu/blob/v5.2.0/docs/interop/firmware.json
[2] https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=1906500

Change-Id: If08cbe2d5f2b301ac92a183f15fb87a18836bff5
Signed-off-by: Stephen Finucane <stephenfin@redhat.com>

commit_message:
Do not use mirror host for Ceph Luminous

Luminous is still used for Debian jobs, but mirror host doesn't provide
the required contents.

Change-Id: I1120e881b0e7844978024ccab03b1f2eab97b098
(cherry picked from commit 8c58e4e304c43ecb66769d3fc34c92c3fd9127ea)

[{'created': '2021-01-28 04:39:49.000000000', 'message': "Run npm nodejs job with Firefox browser

This patch update browser from Chrome to Firefox
in karma.conf.js because nodejs fails with Chrome
browser as not able to access some URL.
So let's switch to Firefox browser now then we can
use Chrome browser in future once this issue is resolved.

Change-Id: I33b911143208fb63548d776cbf3dc4249d4e3394
(cherry picked from commit 934c8e1bbae8794d71cf9fbf0a85c29f2b900e76)
"}]
commit_message:
Run npm nodejs job with Firefox browser

This patch update browser from Chrome to Firefox
in karma.conf.js because nodejs fails with Chrome
browser as not able to access some URL.
So let's switch to Firefox browser now then we can
use Chrome browser in future once this issue is resolved.

Change-Id: I33b911143208fb63548d776cbf3dc4249d4e3394
(cherry picked from commit 934c8e1bbae8794d71cf9fbf0a85c29f2b900e76)

subject: Fix start order for {swift_proxy,glance_api}_tls_proxy
messages: [{'account_id': 6796, 'date': '2021-03-17 08:11:00.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Cherry Picked from branch stable/ussuri.'}, {'account_id': 18002, 'date': '2021-03-18 17:39:50.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2021-03-17 08:11:00.000000000', 'message': 'Fix start order for {swift_proxy,glance_api}_tls_proxy

In stack updates adding TLS to Swift would not work because
swift_proxy_tls_proxy is started when the pre-existing
swift_proxy container is still up and listening on the TCP port
which should instead be used by swift_proxy_tls_proxy

This change ensures swift_proxy_tls_proxy and glance_api_tls_proxy
containers are started after the actual swift_proxy and glance_api
containers are started.

Co-Authored-By: Michele Baldessari <michele@acksyn.org>
Change-Id: I980dfc54b799c6b1d648489a727a590dd26fa502
Closes-Bug: 1918642
(cherry picked from commit c8a828aab297500176d2f9e9e0b05d47d60e4645)
(cherry picked from commit a6c7ba02a969fa82473b2f670b1e8d98baf70b59)
(cherry picked from commit 33b47f47926f504a1799c7de60ae88e489c1f455)
'}]
commit_message:
Fix start order for {swift_proxy,glance_api}_tls_proxy

In stack updates adding TLS to Swift would not work because
swift_proxy_tls_proxy is started when the pre-existing
swift_proxy container is still up and listening on the TCP port
which should instead be used by swift_proxy_tls_proxy

This change ensures swift_proxy_tls_proxy and glance_api_tls_proxy
containers are started after the actual swift_proxy and glance_api
containers are started.

Co-Authored-By: Michele Baldessari <michele@acksyn.org>
Change-Id: I980dfc54b799c6b1d648489a727a590dd26fa502
Closes-Bug: 1918642
(cherry picked from commit c8a828aab297500176d2f9e9e0b05d47d60e4645)
(cherry picked from commit a6c7ba02a969fa82473b2f670b1e8d98baf70b59)
(cherry picked from commit 33b47f47926f504a1799c7de60ae88e489c1f455)

commit_message:
Add legacy fact setting

When we disable inject facts by default, there were some additional
roles that we missed (ipaclient).  We can just set the legacy facts to
prevent issues with missing distribution var updates.

Change-Id: Ib488a6573c035fc8288a4b24461af56d40416c5d
Related-Bug: #1919064
(cherry picked from commit d8408ebb86efdda0055ae41c6db350c14772dc6a)

in tht by OVNDBSPacemakerMonitorInterval (default 30s).
Under load, this can create extra stress and since the
timeout has already been bumped, it makes sense to bump
this interval to a higher value as a trade off
between detecting a failure and stressing the service.

Change-Id: Id836676826f6e7c97ef8e3d665ab3e467ad055ba
(cherry picked from commit 9ece6f97af8837de65f993c56b9ae3041cff6731)
'}]
commit_message:
Add posibilities to set ovndbs monitor interval

Add posibilities to configure ovn dbs monitor interval
in tht by OVNDBSPacemakerMonitorInterval (default 30s).
Under load, this can create extra stress and since the
timeout has already been bumped, it makes sense to bump
this interval to a higher value as a trade off
between detecting a failure and stressing the service.

Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/#/c/779918/
Change-Id: Id836676826f6e7c97ef8e3d665ab3e467ad055ba
(cherry picked from commit 9ece6f97af8837de65f993c56b9ae3041cff6731)

commit_message:
Explicitly use python3 for python scripts

Focal images do not provide 'python' anymore,
and this  means that those scripts are broken
in that environment without this change.

And make sure the scripts are really py3 compatible
(fix a buffering issue)

Change-Id: I652e5d007d5a606f0fe89ac6b3ea76f765be1ae4
(cherry picked from commit 62982b5a4e9eb1bcd56a9bb967744bb3efdb0942)

commit_message:
Make web-download revert all stores on fail

If web-download fails to stage the image, no subsequent import to
store tasks could have run. Thus, we should remove all of them from
"importing" and add them to "failed" so that it is obvious from the
outside that we failed.

This is another good reason for having the $image/tasks API, but we
also should not continue advertising "yes we're importing to $store"
when we are not.

NOTE(lyarwood): This includes a partial squashed revert of the
.zuul.yaml changes in Ifd55c44fef4e2187052d77084dc9c0fa9c9a0d16 that
removed nova-ceph-multistore. This is reintroduced here to ensure this
change resolves the stable/victoria specific bug #1919993 and the
original bug #1914826.

Change-Id: Iebbb2dcb767ecf3c965f34f1ca04af20a2039be1
Closes-Bug: #1914826
Closes-Bug: #1919993
(cherry picked from commit cbb2af6e329c1bf6c1c39cb59f95aaad2c0d7a07)

When mistral starts the Ansible action, a log file is created runtime.
But nothing takes care of its access right, leading to potential data
leaks to unprivileged users (default mode is 0644).

commit_message:
[Victoria and bellow] Ensure rights on the ansible.log file

When mistral starts the Ansible action, a log file is created runtime.
But nothing takes care of its access right, leading to potential data
leaks to unprivileged users (default mode is 0644).

This patch creates the logfile beforehands, and sets the needed rights
on it.

Change-Id: Ica1b5c0a165cc06fac668513114eef2b4ba73f56
Closes-Bug: #1918138
(cherry picked from commit d485407159ea6cb2c7abf6d5788d85147f433996)

revisions:
[{'created': '2021-03-10 15:40:43.000000000', 'message': 'Fix live-migration with libvirt >= 6.8.0

libvirt 6.8.0 introduces virt-ssh-helper which prepends the libvirt
ssh command with a "which virt-ssh-helper". libvirt used to first
check for `nc` (netcat). But these two libvirt commits[1][2] have now
changed it to first look for `virt-ssh-helper`, if it not available,
then fall back to `nc`.

The nova-migration-wrapper doesn't accept this command and denies
the connection.

Until nova-migration-wrapper is changed to allow the usage of
virt-ssh-helper, this change force to use "netcat" (`nc`) by
appending to the migration URI: "&proxy=netcat"

[1] https://libvirt.org/git/?p=libvirt.git;a=commit;h=f8ec7c842d (rpc:
use new virt-ssh-helper binary for remote tunnelling, 2020-07-08)
[2] https://libvirt.org/git/?p=libvirt.git;a=commit;h=7d959c302d (rpc:
Fix virt-ssh-helper detection, 2020-10-27)

Closes-Bug: 1918250

Related: https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=1926602

Change-Id: I3db9cd42aa63379ed6332ee77f67d1dfe4be8504
Co-Authored-By: David Vallee Delisle <dvd@redhat.com>
(cherry picked from commit 04a97f92e4d944ce51492011584e2ec1126042a1)
(cherry picked from commit bf5a4a9849d7cb067d36ca57fd8538faed016715)
(cherry picked from commit 960dbfe986b06a9b390b4adac1fca57c8badb3e7)
'}]
commit_message:
Fix live-migration with libvirt >= 6.8.0

libvirt 6.8.0 introduces virt-ssh-helper which prepends the libvirt
ssh command with a "which virt-ssh-helper". libvirt used to first
check for `nc` (netcat). But these two libvirt commits[1][2] have now
changed it to first look for `virt-ssh-helper`, if it not available,
then fall back to `nc`.

The nova-migration-wrapper doesn't accept this command and denies
the connection.

Until nova-migration-wrapper is changed to allow the usage of
virt-ssh-helper, this change force to use "netcat" (`nc`) by
appending to the migration URI: "&proxy=netcat"

[1] https://libvirt.org/git/?p=libvirt.git;a=commit;h=f8ec7c842d (rpc:
use new virt-ssh-helper binary for remote tunnelling, 2020-07-08)
[2] https://libvirt.org/git/?p=libvirt.git;a=commit;h=7d959c302d (rpc:
Fix virt-ssh-helper detection, 2020-10-27)

Closes-Bug: 1918250

Related: https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=1926602

Change-Id: I3db9cd42aa63379ed6332ee77f67d1dfe4be8504
Co-Authored-By: David Vallee Delisle <dvd@redhat.com>
(cherry picked from commit 04a97f92e4d944ce51492011584e2ec1126042a1)
(cherry picked from commit bf5a4a9849d7cb067d36ca57fd8538faed016715)
(cherry picked from commit 960dbfe986b06a9b390b4adac1fca57c8badb3e7)

commit_message:
Remove copy_ssh_key task from validation workbook

This task is not needed anymore since Validations in train
are run directly from VF and Ansible, so without Mistral
at all

messages: [{'account_id': 25241, 'date': '2021-03-09 20:51:26.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Cherry Picked from branch stable/victoria.'}, {'account_id': 18575, 'date': '2021-03-10 04:13:24.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 14985, 'date': '2021-03-18 14:46:09.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2021-03-09 20:51:26.000000000', 'message': "Updating sriov_config service to run after openibd service

When having sriov configured in mlnx interfaces and we are using MLNX
ofed, it will install openibd and in reboot case we'll have a race between
sriov_config service and that openibd service which loads mlx drivers,
sometimes it causes failures in starting sriov_config service.
So updating sriov_config service to run after openibd service if it's
present, if not as in default case, systemd ignores it.

Closes-Bug: #1918255
Change-Id: I047e3c40815b71de10e6641c1d39b29de563d8d2
(cherry picked from commit 012b58ccc1623945c4428e82eec80b2f3f22d6b7)
"}]
commit_message:
Updating sriov_config service to run after openibd service

When having sriov configured in mlnx interfaces and we are using MLNX
ofed, it will install openibd and in reboot case we'll have a race between
sriov_config service and that openibd service which loads mlx drivers,
sometimes it causes failures in starting sriov_config service.
So updating sriov_config service to run after openibd service if it's
present, if not as in default case, systemd ignores it.

Closes-Bug: #1918255
Change-Id: I047e3c40815b71de10e6641c1d39b29de563d8d2
(cherry picked from commit 012b58ccc1623945c4428e82eec80b2f3f22d6b7)

commit_message:
Fix overcloud status command

We started using a working-dir for overcloud intermediate
files since change I0d803f695c725c58ef2e6b655753b6c8248d1b2f
and this is a regression from it.

Change-Id: I59f9bc2952d82f4173dae92ca25370dd3ca0c47d

commit_message:
Updating sriov_config service to run after openibd service

When having sriov configured in mlnx interfaces and we are using MLNX
ofed, it will install openibd and in reboot case we'll have a race between
sriov_config service and that openibd service which loads mlx drivers,
sometimes it causes failures in starting sriov_config service.
So updating sriov_config service to run after openibd service if it's
present, if not as in default case, systemd ignores it.

Closes-Bug: #1918255
Change-Id: I047e3c40815b71de10e6641c1d39b29de563d8d2
(cherry picked from commit 012b58ccc1623945c4428e82eec80b2f3f22d6b7)

commit_message:
Validation are not run via mistral anymore in Train

Remove _prepare_ssh_environment function because Validation
are call via mistral anymore.
This workbook leads to some issues, in particular context such
as Upgrades

Change-Id: I95fbce2938e5c39fae796f0d4b95d4da266ad5a9

commit_message:
Use static inventory for component CI role and clean component list

* Use static inventory for tripleo-validations role for component CI
* Remove nova-svirt from the component compute list since this validation
is not made for running on Standalone deployment.
* Moving neutron-sanity-check to undercloud-neutron-sanity-check because
this validation is made for being kicked against an Overcloud
* And replace disk-check by process count for Component CI PoC

Signed-off-by: Jiri Podivin <jpodivin@redhat.com>
Change-Id: I2de47f7226c232226712cf45be7d1dfb4b62873a

[{'created': '2020-11-20 14:39:13.000000000', 'message': 'Create post-deploy.conf on update/upgrade for octavia

Containers are restarted with new command lines during upgrade/updates
before the external_deploy_task are run that create a configuration file
that is used on the command line. This results in octavia services
failing to start.

Note: this was originally merged as:
    https://review.opendev.org/#/c/750986/
but the OctaviaBase references in templates was incorrect so the
original patch was reverted through:
    https://review.opendev.org/#/c/763561/
As the original patch had not been backported, it makes more sense to
revert and get a correct fix in place and backport that instead of
requiring backporting a series or backporting a squashed commit.

Change-Id: Ib3476e53f89b50bae72b9c95a5d3dec51ed3de7e

commit_message:
Create post-deploy.conf on update/upgrade for octavia

Containers are restarted with new command lines during upgrade/updates
before the external_deploy_task are run that create a configuration file
that is used on the command line. This results in octavia services
failing to start.

Note: this was originally merged as:
    https://review.opendev.org/#/c/750986/
but the OctaviaBase references in templates was incorrect so the
original patch was reverted through:
    https://review.opendev.org/#/c/763561/
As the original patch had not been backported, it makes more sense to
revert and get a correct fix in place and backport that instead of
requiring backporting a series or backporting a squashed commit.

Change-Id: Ib3476e53f89b50bae72b9c95a5d3dec51ed3de7e
Related-Bug: #1863595

commit_message:
Fix novavnc haproxy network

Since "Use single NovaLibvirtNetwork to configure instance console
components" Icef2481b65b41b524ad44eeecfbee4451006e1d2, we are getting
the following error:

Error while evaluating a Function Call, The service_network for this
service is undefined. Can't configure TLS for the internal network.

Let's first lookup the old network and then the newer one to keep
compatibility.

Tested by triggering fs039 on
https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/tripleo-heat-templates/+/780934
with a dep-on on this review.

Change-Id: Ic9ae8a1a0f69d85b2acd2598644c1cae8c1db78d
Closes-Bug: #1919506

commit_message:
Stop ironic services in unupgraded controllers

This change makes ironic services on unupgrade controller nodes get
stopped, because all services in the unupgraded controllers should be
stopped before we start the upgraded controller[1].

[1] 8529ce60da84d2aa1e1c9e6994303678261b09da

Change-Id: Iedddb02c4a27195d0f89bc4b9dfb12ffba054ae5
(cherry picked from commit 099badda3caa6304416b35c826d972866097a26b)
(cherry picked from commit e3b75f1dbf3cedaab2c07988d7c3249ad9021e4f)
(cherry picked from commit 9db6db69a4d71d7b4dd6ea81e2b29ca90bdbe405)

revisions:
[{'created': '2021-03-18 09:48:27.000000000', 'message': "Pass ImageActionWrapper to internal plugins

The _internal_plugins/* tasks are not getting passed the
ImportActionWrapper, and thus are doing things against the image
that do not respect the task lock, nor apply multiple updates
atomically.

This fixes that and brings them in line with the base tasks, using the
wrapper for things like getting the image_id. The copy_image task
looks at the image for a few other things that are not exposed out
of the wrapper, so I left the image_repo.get() in that task until I
can extend it. They are read-only though, so not a big deal.

The web-download test also was not passing the right options to
that task (confusing task_repo and image_repo), which this cleans
up as well. It was also missing validation of the code that reverts
the state to 'queued' when web-download fails, so that is added here
as well.

Change-Id: I6db86b3e17a6a2f78745b40381b9419fb4404a4e
Related-Bug: #1914826
(cherry picked from commit 68646db35d4a389237b9c1db75c074ba90fa1ec6)
"}, {'created': '2021-03-18 11:43:00.000000000', 'message': "Pass ImageActionWrapper to internal plugins

as well.

Change-Id: I6db86b3e17a6a2f78745b40381b9419fb4404a4e

commit_message:
Pass ImageActionWrapper to internal plugins

The _internal_plugins/* tasks are not getting passed the
ImportActionWrapper, and thus are doing things against the image
that do not respect the task lock, nor apply multiple updates
atomically.

This fixes that and brings them in line with the base tasks, using the
wrapper for things like getting the image_id. The copy_image task
looks at the image for a few other things that are not exposed out
of the wrapper, so I left the image_repo.get() in that task until I
can extend it. They are read-only though, so not a big deal.

The web-download test also was not passing the right options to
that task (confusing task_repo and image_repo), which this cleans
up as well. It was also missing validation of the code that reverts
the state to 'queued' when web-download fails, so that is added here
as well.

Change-Id: I6db86b3e17a6a2f78745b40381b9419fb4404a4e
Related-Bug: #1914826
(cherry picked from commit 68646db35d4a389237b9c1db75c074ba90fa1ec6)

commit_message:
relinker: refactor to share common code

Refactor the relinker to reduce the amount of code that is
duplicated in the relink and cleanup functions.

Change-Id: Icf30f6799e4e5c7bb5c3d468c0e7e8591334ac1e

commit_message:
node provision, Set vars for generating inventory

Adds option output_dir to the node provision command.
Set ansible vars ssh_private_key_file and output_dir
when calling cli-overcloud-node-provision.yaml.

Partial-Implements: blueprint network-data-v2-ports
Change-Id: I97f7bfd16942a8c33367a4fb246a10798344e4a0

revisions:
[{'created': '2020-12-08 02:10:22.000000000', 'message': "Inventory from neutron resources

This refactors the intentory code to pervasively
use 'setdefault' to assign values to all inventory
keys.

It will first set up the undercloud in the inventory,
then add overcloud data based on disovery of data in
neutron and heat stack if available. Overcloud
inventory data from neutron is added first, then data
from the stack is added.

With the pervasive 'setdefault' usage all values in
the inventory will reflect the value first discovered.
For example, a changed IP address in neutron will be
reflected in the inventory even tough the overcloud
heat stack is not yet aware of the change.

Partial-Implements: blueprint network-data-v2-ports
Change-Id: I9e1851aeb92c9e257fd18fdc500ee5c01b1eb53e
"}, {'created': '2020-12-08 23:58:02.000000000', 'message': "Inventory from neutron resources

commit_message:
Inventory from neutron resources

It will first set up the undercloud in the inventory,
then add overcloud data based on disovery of data in
neutron and heat stack if available. Overcloud
inventory data from neutron is added first, then data
from the stack is added.

With the pervasive 'setdefault' usage all values in
the inventory will reflect the value first discovered.
For example, a changed IP address in neutron will be
reflected in the inventory even tough the overcloud
heat stack is not yet aware of the change.

Partial-Implements: blueprint network-data-v2-ports
Change-Id: I9e1851aeb92c9e257fd18fdc500ee5c01b1eb53e

commit_message:
Add 'session' to generate inventory method

Adds session to the method arguments and set it
when instanciating the TripleoInventory class.

The inventory from neutron resources code added in
https://review.opendev.org/765902 relies on the
session to create a network service client.

Partial-Implements: blueprint network-data-v2-ports
Change-Id: Ic4bac7ebee763fb39ff2951807775e464f3ad681

commit_message:
Fix override for nova

The PS allows to get overrides for nova even when OSH_EXTRA_HELM_ARGS_NOVA
variable already defined. Otherwise, the overrides will be skipped.

Change-Id: I4b5e8a4da87872a088bfab3ed419dc2887ea2df6

done most of the items in this list.
I added deprecations for respawn_count and respawn_interval, I don't know if they can be removed without notice'}, {'account_id': 29244, 'date': '2021-03-15 07:22:15.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 6469, 'date': '2021-03-15 08:18:37.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3: Backport-Candidate-2 Code-Review+2

> I added deprecations for respawn_count and respawn_interval, I don't know if they can be removed without notice

IMO they can be removed because they were specific to upstart which support is being ripped out altogether in this change. My understanding of deprecation is to express intent to remove/stop supporting something in a near future while the setting is still applied when set meanwhile. I think that is not the case here, hence the two configuration options could be removed. This is not a blocker from my side though, hence CR+2.

Thank you, Greg!"}, {'account_id': 1131, 'date': '2021-03-18 22:07:50.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Code-Review+1

(1 comment)'}]

commit_message:
Update nodepool zk configs to be a bit less confusing

Our system-config roles for nodepool update the zookeeper configuration
for our nodepool hosts. The content in the files here is merely a
placeholder. Make that more apparent via the addition of comments and
use of dummy data.

Change-Id: I4e35088a04f6393409963f841f2e9ba174c69598

commit_message:
Remove unused nl0X.openstack.org config files

Once the opendev launchers are handling these duties and these servers
have all been removed from the system-config inventory we can go ahead
and land this change to clean up the unused config files.

Change-Id: I9792620eea81a07b6cbbfee37c08807114d2b390

commit_message:
Changed whitelist to allowlist in tox

Replace tox's whitelist_externals by allowlist_externals option:
https://github.com/tox-dev/tox/blob/master/docs/changelog.rst#v3180-2020-07-23

Change-Id: I4e85c700278fbd68ea38b0c5b036db2c2a72ef76

[{'created': '2021-03-09 14:39:19.000000000', 'message': "Lazy-load node details from the DB

In order to reduce the load on the database backend, only lazy-load
a node's ports, portgroups, volume_connectors, and volume_targets.
With the power-sync as the main user, this change should reduce the
number of DB operations by two thirds roughly.

Change-Id: Id9a9a53156f7fd866d93569347a81e27c6f0673c
(cherry picked from commit 82cab603bbb21d81769cdc4f50d4fa445d026e5c)
"}]
commit_message:
Lazy-load node details from the DB

In order to reduce the load on the database backend, only lazy-load
a node's ports, portgroups, volume_connectors, and volume_targets.
With the power-sync as the main user, this change should reduce the
number of DB operations by two thirds roughly.

Change-Id: Id9a9a53156f7fd866d93569347a81e27c6f0673c
(cherry picked from commit 82cab603bbb21d81769cdc4f50d4fa445d026e5c)

commit_message:
[WIP] Add run-local-molecule wrapper script

This patch introduces the run-local-molecule script which aims to run
the molecule tests locally in a python virtual environment.

For the moment, this script is only supporting Red Hat Distribution Family!

TODO(gchamoul):
- Enhance the current documentation
- Add MacOS support
- Add GNU Debian Family Distribution Support

Signed-off-by: Gael Chamoulaud (Strider) <gchamoul@redhat.com>
Change-Id: I5523ad83c698b4064fa4c2ae855ac05447146ce8

commit_message:
Convert docker molecule usage to podman

This change updates all uses of docker to podman and removes our docker
installation process from zuul and our local test process.

Change-Id: Idc4d4b0ab2557814d5aa2c543e4b7c546624b776
Signed-off-by: Gael Chamoulaud (Strider) <gchamoul@redhat.com>
(cherry picked from commit 972b03943f31a5df0a8f02a06cc379c366dfa3bb)
(cherry picked from commit d1403dd3cc99fc107b1e571087690ef7c522427e)

commit_message:
[SVF]:Storwize hyperswap volume is not deleting.

[Spectrum Virtualize Family] During hyperswap volume delete operation
check_vdisk_fc_mappings is trying to delete the remote copy controlled
fcmaps which are created for hyperswap volumes.

This patch fixes the issue by ignoring the remote copy controlled fcmaps.

Closes-Bug: #1912564
Change-Id: I98f1c60810d675a51ce1cae8bcce51c6d88e6cd2

commit_message:
network-data-v2 docs - Create networks

Updates the "Configuring Network Isolation" and the
"Deploying with Custom Networks" sections with the
steps to create networks, segments and subnets prior
to deploying the heat stack.

Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/765218
Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/751876
Change-Id: Iece094be77725bc3aa9bc90c4ffc5c7bf2767b41

Add Python3 xena unit tests

This is an automatically generated patch to ensure unit testing
is in place for all the of the tested runtimes for xena.

See also the PTI in governance [1].

[1]: https://governance.openstack.org/tc/reference/project-testing-interface.html

Change-Id: I6b35118b83af7c18baaefaddfdd6cd51912ee0c7

commit_message:
Update TOX_CONSTRAINTS_FILE for stable/wallaby

Update the URL to the upper-constraints file to point to the redirect
rule on releases.openstack.org so that anyone working on this branch
will switch to the correct upper-constraints list automatically when
the requirements repository branches.

Until the requirements repository has as stable/wallaby branch, tests will
continue to use the upper-constraints list on master.

Change-Id: I350ab2a4a4b621eadfeef23570701d03402681c8

commit_message:
Tests for OSC baremetal node create command with options

Add tests for options:
    --driver-info
    --chassis-uuid
    --property
    --extra
    --network-interface
    --resource-class

Partial-Bug: #1566329

Update master for stable/wallaby

Add file to the reno documentation build to show release notes for
stable/wallaby.

automatically so that master versions are higher than the versions on
stable/wallaby.

revisions:
[{'created': '2021-03-17 07:24:26.000000000', 'message': "Add config parameter 'live_migration_scheme' to live migration with tls guide

This patch adds the config option 'live_migration_scheme = tls' to the
secure live migration guide.

To let the live migration use the qemu native tls, some configuration of the
compute nodes is needed. The guide describes this but misses the
'live_migration_scheme' config option.

It is necessary to set 'live_migration_scheme' to tls to use the connection
uri for encrypted traffic. Without this parameter everything seems to work,
but the unencrypted tcp-connection is still used for the live migration.

Closes-Bug: #1919357
Change-Id: Ia5130d411706bf7e1c983156158011a3bc6d5cd6
"}, {'created': '2021-03-17 10:35:40.000000000', 'message': "Add config parameter 'live_migration_scheme' to live migration with tls guide

This patch adds the config option 'live_migration_scheme = tls' to the
secure live migration guide.

To let the live migration use the qemu native tls, some configuration of
the compute nodes is needed. The guide describes this but misses the
'live_migration_scheme' config option.

It is necessary to set 'live_migration_scheme' to tls to use the
connection uri for encrypted traffic. Without this parameter everything
seems to work, but the unencrypted tcp-connection is still used for the
live migration.

Closes-Bug: #1919357
Change-Id: Ia5130d411706bf7e1c983156158011a3bc6d5cd6
"}]
commit_message:
Add config parameter 'live_migration_scheme' to live migration with tls guide

This patch adds the config option 'live_migration_scheme = tls' to the
secure live migration guide.

To let the live migration use the qemu native tls, some configuration of
the compute nodes is needed. The guide describes this but misses the
'live_migration_scheme' config option.

It is necessary to set 'live_migration_scheme' to tls to use the
connection uri for encrypted traffic. Without this parameter everything
seems to work, but the unencrypted tcp-connection is still used for the
live migration.

Closes-Bug: #1919357
Change-Id: Ia5130d411706bf7e1c983156158011a3bc6d5cd6

revisions:
[{'created': '2021-03-18 14:48:03.000000000', 'message': 'Update TOX_CONSTRAINTS_FILE for stable/wallaby

Update the URL to the upper-constraints file to point to the redirect
rule on releases.openstack.org so that anyone working on this branch
will switch to the correct upper-constraints list automatically when
the requirements repository branches.

Until the requirements repository has as stable/wallaby branch, tests will

Change-Id: I35df9e06ed5a7ec0393b3e1368f13da6fcddb23e

commit_message:
Update TOX_CONSTRAINTS_FILE for stable/wallaby

Update the URL to the upper-constraints file to point to the redirect
rule on releases.openstack.org so that anyone working on this branch
will switch to the correct upper-constraints list automatically when
the requirements repository branches.

Until the requirements repository has as stable/wallaby branch, tests will
continue to use the upper-constraints list on master.

Change-Id: I35df9e06ed5a7ec0393b3e1368f13da6fcddb23e

commit_message:
Add hostname resolution to deploy host

This addresses an issue with delegation to containers noticed
as a result of https://github.com/ansible/ansible/issues/72776
which causes the container host to be accessed by its hostname.

Where a separate deploy host is used, up to now this has not had
its hosts file modified. This patch applies the same /etc/hosts
entries to the deploy host which are used elsewhere.

Change-Id: I82b48ba5cfe6e533426e7098c455b729084b2d51

commit_message:
Remove failed rocky-eol release from tripleo-ipsec

tripleo-ipsec rocky-eol tagging is failed (however the release patch
got merged) due to missing configuration settings, which is now added
to tripleo-ipsec [1].

This patch removes the release from the the yaml and then another
release patch can retry the release again.

[1] https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/tripleo-ipsec/+/780063

Change-Id: I9d0119d07aa7934325393b89cc9aab7d39b39b64

messages: [{'account_id': 25023, 'date': '2021-03-09 16:15:15.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Cherry Picked from branch master.'}, {'account_id': 25023, 'date': '2021-03-18 07:24:57.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:\n\nrecheck'}, {'account_id': 25600, 'date': '2021-03-18 10:58:21.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 29865, 'date': '2021-03-18 15:33:02.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2021-03-09 16:15:15.000000000', 'message': 'Fix race condition in compression of static files

At present, the collection and compression of static file is
carried out asynchronously to speed up execution. If compression
starts before collection has completed it can result in incomplete
results which cause the Horizon front end to produce 500 errors.

This patch switches the collection of static files back to a
synchronous task before triggering the slower compression as an
asynchronous task to maintain most of the speed-up benefit.

Change-Id: If9df63b2ef0031c91303d3fcb56474cbf7d648f9
(cherry picked from commit a26eee05f7b8bafd7aa2985828229b8762701d36)
'}]
commit_message:
Fix race condition in compression of static files

At present, the collection and compression of static file is
carried out asynchronously to speed up execution. If compression
starts before collection has completed it can result in incomplete
results which cause the Horizon front end to produce 500 errors.

This patch switches the collection of static files back to a
synchronous task before triggering the slower compression as an
asynchronous task to maintain most of the speed-up benefit.

Change-Id: If9df63b2ef0031c91303d3fcb56474cbf7d648f9
(cherry picked from commit a26eee05f7b8bafd7aa2985828229b8762701d36)

LGTM, thank you.'}, {'account_id': 970, 'date': '2017-06-22 15:43:50.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 10: Code-Review-1

I don't think I like removing the ability we currently have to sort on arbitrary fields.  If you want to shift the sort to the server, then do that for the server-supported fields, ad do the others locally.

If we do make a backward-incompatible change, it needs to be added to the backwards-incompatible.rst doc and deferred to 4.0 release"}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2017-06-23 20:36:35.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 10: Verified-1

Merge Failed.

This change or one of its cross-repo dependencies was unable to be automatically merged with the current state of its repository. Please rebase the change and upload a new patchset.'}, {'account_id': 8276, 'date': '2017-06-24 03:29:49.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 10: -Code-Review

Sorry, my fault, didn't consider the backward-incompatible, I check the current local supported sort key, and glance supported sort key, it's different too much. 

I think we can keep the local sort, and only fix the --limit option issue in the patch.

current sort key:

'status', 'schema', 'name', 'tags', 'container_format', 'created_at', 'disk_format', 'updated_at', 'visibility', 'id', 'owner', 'protected', 'min_ram', 'file', 'checksum', 'min_disk', 'virtual_size', 'self', 'size',

glance sort key[1]:

'name', 'status', 'container_format', 'disk_format', 'size', 'id', 'created_at', 'updated_at'

[1]: https://github.com/openstack/glance/blob/master/glance/api/v2/images.py#L385-L387"}, {'account_id': 8290, 'date': '2017-06-24 03:45:54.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 10:

yes, but IMO, many other interfaces or commands in OpenStack have the constraint of sort keys, and this "all fields" sort keys support only in OSC   commands, don't support in Client interface, don't support in glance-api server, this may cause inconsistency. and most time we may don't user by OSC CLI. if we need more sort keys support, should we add them support in glance-api firstly ?'}, {'account_id': 8290, 'date': '2017-07-03 07:21:53.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 11.'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2017-07-03 08:48:21.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 11: Verified+1

commit_message:
Make the --limit option work in "image list" command

Currently, the --limit option cannot work in OSC "image list" command,
because the current implementation didn't consider the situation when
--limit specified and --marker didn't specified.

Change-Id: I4bdc79e61788bcabd2094ec0df719b29bb095610
Closes-Bug: #1689549

commit_message:
Implement client commands for node indicators

This change implements the three commands described in the
expose-hardware-indicators spec[1].

[1] https://specs.openstack.org/openstack/ironic-specs/specs/15.0/expose-hardware-indicators.html#openstack-baremetal-cli
Story: 2005342
Task: 41837

Change-Id: Id324fcd7f7d3efd0704414702b06ad119f925b01

commit_message:
Bump lower_constraints and requirements

This is to unblock the stuck gate due to the lower_constraints
job failing.

NOTE(lyarwood): This change also drops the nova-ceph-multistore job
while we work on fixing it via Iebbb2dcb767ecf3c965f34f1ca04af20a2039be1

Change-Id: Ifd55c44fef4e2187052d77084dc9c0fa9c9a0d16
(cherry picked from commit 795dad763315884223b79698f3611e1ac1b50a17)

commit_message:
Add 'User' column to 'keypair list' output

This isn't returned by the nova API, so we simply use the value from the
filter and modify the response accordingly.

Change-Id: I21a33c61118bea10959f71434af99894181efd86
Signed-off-by: Stephen Finucane <sfinucan@redhat.com>

subject: Add --volume-type option for compute boot from volume
messages:
[{'account_id': 32238, 'date': '2020-11-24 04:06:59.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 32238, 'date': '2020-11-24 05:49:53.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 32238, 'date': '2020-11-24 07:51:26.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 32238, 'date': '2020-11-24 09:09:50.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 4.'}, {'account_id': 15334, 'date': '2021-03-18 18:03:42.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4: Code-Review-2

Thanks for this change. We have introduced a new '--block-device' option that allows users to specify this explicitly. Given '--boot-from-volume' is only intended to be a shorter way of specifying that, I don't feel it's wise to build upon that with additional options. If users need more power, they should use '--block-device'.

I'm going to abandon this. If you disagree, please let me know and I can discuss and potentially reopen."}, {'account_id': 15334, 'date': '2021-03-18 18:04:15.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned'}]

commit_message:
Add --volume-type option for compute boot from volume

Add '--volume-type' option to spesify volume type when use
'--boot-from-volume' option and no default volume type.

Story: 2008382
Task: 41305
Change-Id: Ibc86b08480643dd568d3b2065051c13c41d08d23

commit_message:
project cleanup

New implementation of the project cleanup based on the sdk.project_cleanup.
It is implemented as an additional OSC operation and will ideally obsolete the 
`openstack project purge` giving flexibility to extend services support, 
parallelization, filters, etc.

Change-Id: Ie08877f182379f73e5ec5ad4daaf84b3092c829c

subject: Install glean from source-repository
messages:
[{'account_id': 10239, 'date': '2021-03-17 16:44:36.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 10239, 'date': '2021-03-17 16:55:45.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 7118, 'date': '2021-03-18 00:48:20.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review-1

This one made me think!  I was sure I had used the nodepool jobs to test glean changes with

https://opendev.org/zuul/nodepool/src/branch/master/playbooks/nodepool-functional-container-openstack/templates/nodepool.yaml.j2#L79 where we do

  DIB_INSTALLTYPE_simple_init: 'repo'
  DIB_REPOLOCATION_glean: "{{ ansible_user_dir }}/{{ zuul.projects['opendev.org/opendev/glean'].src_
  DIB_REPOREF_glean: "{{ zuul.projects['opendev.org/opendev/glean'].checkout }}"

This is actually two different things -- "DIB_INSTALLTYPE_simple_init=repo" actually instructs the *install-types* element to use the scripts from the -repo-install directory in 

https://opendev.org/openstack/diskimage-builder/src/branch/master/diskimage_builder/elements/simple-init/install.d

for the "simple-init" element.  The DIB_REPO*_glean variables instruct source-repositories where to download the upstream source for "glean" from.

So I believe that the "repo" install is doing what it says -- simple-init is installing glean from an on-disk repository cloned from zuul.

I would agree this is all quite confusing üòê'}, {'account_id': 10239, 'date': '2021-03-18 17:53:47.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned

Oh. Ooooooh. Thanks for explanation, the simple-init vs glean part is actually quite confusing.'}]

'}]
commit_message:
Install glean from source-repository

The simple-init element uses source-repositories but installs glean from
pip, rendering its useless. Remove the non-standard "repo" install,
source-repositories does not recognize it as valid (it expects "source").

Change-Id: I42886a9e4b53a84a577c7ae6ea2eebb0b6043d86

commit_message:
Fix inconsistent ordering caused by low datetime precision.

The low datetime precision of created_at, updated_at,
deleted_at fields on MySQL can lead to inconsistent list
of returned items when used with --limit.

Change-Id: I6e4b3a38defc1d916556c7cdddfaaab854432ea1
Closes-Bug: #1859474

commit_message:
Delete system role assignments from system_assignment table

This patch ensures to delete the system role assignments from
all the assignment tables in keystone after deleting the role
user has over the system.

This also make sure of deleting stale role assignments before
deleting role for the deployments that are already in this state.

Closes-Bug: #1878938

Change-Id: I4df19c45c870ff3fb78578ca1fb7dd0d35da3c82
(cherry picked from commit c1dcbb05b4488f1fa3e7af4d9171d11702d94119)
(cherry picked from commit b83170a386ba8da2195c7494d04d832ce9b6d7b0)

(cherry picked from commit 7ac0891375656d156f1a9601e3520052dddb39d0)

commit_message:
Tox.ini: add py39

This allows us to run unit tests and functional tests using Python3.9.
We also remove all testenv:py3* environments, since tox is able to infer
what version of Python to use from the environment name.

Change-Id: If9ce1475ddfc66c9b37cd3500af982bf3814bf60

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-10-22 09:44:59.000000000', 'message': "Update resources once in update_available_resource

This change ensures that resources are updated only once per
update_available_resource() call.

Compute resources were previously updated during host
object initialization and at the end of
update_available_resource(). It could cause inconsistencies
in resource tracking between compute host and DB for couple
of second when final _update() at the end of
update_available_resource() is being called.

For example: nova-api shows that host uses 10GB of RAM, but
in fact its 12GB because DB doesn't have resources that belongs
to shutdown instance.

Because of that fact nova-scheduler (CachingScheduler) could
choose (based on imcomplete information) host which is already full.

For more informations please see realted bug: #1729621

Change-Id: I120a98cc4c11772f24099081ef3ac44a50daf71d
Closes-Bug: #1729621
(cherry picked from commit c9b74bcfa09d11c2046ce1bfb6dd8463b3a2f3b0)

commit_message:
Update resources once in update_available_resource

This change ensures that resources are updated only once per
update_available_resource() call.

Compute resources were previously updated during host
object initialization and at the end of
update_available_resource(). It could cause inconsistencies
in resource tracking between compute host and DB for couple
of second when final _update() at the end of
update_available_resource() is being called.

For example: nova-api shows that host uses 10GB of RAM, but
in fact its 12GB because DB doesn't have resources that belongs
to shutdown instance.

Because of that fact nova-scheduler (CachingScheduler) could
choose (based on imcomplete information) host which is already full.

For more informations please see realted bug: #1729621

Conflicts:
    nova/tests/unit/compute/test_resource_tracker.py

NOTE: The conflict is due to the backporting order of this patch and
I9fa1d509a3de405d6246fb8670612c65c10cc93b to pike has changed. This
caused the conflict in first place, and also modification needed in
test_compute_node_create_fail_retry_works(), which is now exactly the
same as it was originally implemented in queens by the patch mentioned
above.

Change-Id: I120a98cc4c11772f24099081ef3ac44a50daf71d
Closes-Bug: #1729621
(cherry picked from commit c9b74bcfa09d11c2046ce1bfb6dd8463b3a2f3b0)
(cherry picked from commit 36d93675d9a6bf903ed64c216243c74a639a2087)

[{'created': '2021-03-01 15:42:18.000000000', 'message': "rt: Make resource tracker always invoking get_inventory()

This is a stable/pike only backport from queens. This change originally
was made of part of the feature bp add-support-for-vgpu. Bit it is
actually fixing a bug in the resource tracker and not adding any VGPU
specific code. I amended the commit message and the code comments to
adapt it to pike where  VGPU is not a thing.

The ironic custom resource stat is not saved in the compute_nodes.
Instead it's reported by drivers' get_inventory() interface and the
inventory data is saved via placement. But the resource tracker will
skip invoking get_inventory() if the resource in compute_node is not
changed. It will cause the ironic customer resource is not added to
placement if other compute node resources are not changed.

the function of get_inventory and use scheduler_client interfaces to
update inventory to placement. The scheduler_client will ensure the
update request to placement only happen when inventory is changed
via comparing with the local cached inventory.

commit_message:
rt: Make resource tracker always invoking get_inventory()

This is a stable/pike only backport from queens. This change originally
was made of part of the feature bp add-support-for-vgpu. Bit it is
actually fixing a bug in the resource tracker and not adding any VGPU
specific code. I amended the commit message and the code comments to
adapt it to pike where  VGPU is not a thing.

The ironic custom resource stat is not saved in the compute_nodes.
Instead it's reported by drivers' get_inventory() interface and the
inventory data is saved via placement. But the resource tracker will
skip invoking get_inventory() if the resource in compute_node is not
changed. It will cause the ironic customer resource is not added to
placement if other compute node resources are not changed.

This commit is to change resource tracker to always proceed to invoke
the function of get_inventory and use scheduler_client interfaces to
update inventory to placement. The scheduler_client will ensure the
update request to placement only happen when inventory is changed
via comparing with the local cached inventory.

Change-Id: I6e204fe8e7c003246c9d8bebf484323700737093
(cherry picked from commit e2a18a37190e4c7b7697a8811553d331e208182c)

revisions:
[{'created': '2021-03-16 12:03:54.000000000', 'message': 'Fix VLAN driver tests

Since [1], the physical network VLAN ranges parser populates the
ranges for those entries without a defined range, allowing all
valid VLAN ranges ([1, 4094]).

Some VLAN driver tests, relying on the previous implementation,
considered that the physical network without a defined VLAN
range does not have segments to allocated (those segments
are created on the fly by
"SegmentTypeDriverallocate_fully_specified_segment).

Since [1], all physical network segments are stored in the
"ml2_vlan_allocations" table and set as non allocated.

This patch also reverts [2]. When the physical networks are defined
in "network_vlan_ranges", there is no distinction between tenant
and provided networks; the physical network segments are assigned
by the user. It is possible to create a provider network without
defining the segmentation ID, it will be provided by the Neutron
VLAN driver, if there are free segments for the required physical
network.

[1]https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/neutron-lib/+/779515
[2]1376df7873c2ac77c256ab2fed928de41a2c1d58

Closes-Bug: #1919280
Related-Bug: #1918274
Related-Bug: #1649750

Change-Id: I191e020ddb97dcf8fb41139d35bfd699e125379b

commit_message:
Fix VLAN driver tests

Since [1], the physical network VLAN ranges parser populates the
ranges for those entries without a defined range, allowing all
valid VLAN ranges ([1, 4094]).

Some VLAN driver tests, relying on the previous implementation,
considered that the physical network without a defined VLAN
range does not have segments to allocated (those segments
are created on the fly by
"SegmentTypeDriverallocate_fully_specified_segment).

Since [1], all physical network segments are stored in the
"ml2_vlan_allocations" table and set as non allocated.

This patch also reverts [2]. When the physical networks are defined
in "network_vlan_ranges", there is no distinction between tenant
and provided networks; the physical network segments are assigned
by the user. It is possible to create a provider network without
defining the segmentation ID, it will be provided by the Neutron
VLAN driver, if there are free segments for the required physical
network.

[1]https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/neutron-lib/+/779515
[2]1376df7873c2ac77c256ab2fed928de41a2c1d58

Closes-Bug: #1919280
Related-Bug: #1918274
Related-Bug: #1649750

Change-Id: I191e020ddb97dcf8fb41139d35bfd699e125379b

commit_message:
Add set_readonly_volume to BlockStorageCloudMixin

We are missing some "/action" operations for volumes so this patch
adds the ability to set volumes to readonly through the sdk.

Signed-off-by: Thiago Brito <thiago.brito@windriver.com>
Change-Id: I335b8f11b94810f45f0c45b94fc4984f6bf5e122

commit_message:
Create a container for Unbound DNS resolver

This patch sets up TripleO to create a container for the Unbound
DNS resolver. This will be used with Designate deployments to
provide DNS resolver services to the deployment and neutron.

Change-Id: Ifccee277393cc9ab095d1785216d3dacfbf3c5ce
(cherry picked from commit 96d3c1fa0613af6ce8fdef01d5f9d696da993aec)

commit_message:
Make /healthcheck cache results

The healthcheck endpoint should cache results to reduce the potential load on the backend systems being tested.
This patch adds the caching and a configuration setting for the interval
between cache refreshes.

Change-Id: Ic97a991437144f3a220d9b96839cec5b63565f8c
Story: 2008203
Task: 40987

revisions:
[{'created': '2021-03-16 19:49:15.000000000', 'message': 'Fix test failures for "test_list_shares_by_{filter}"

These tests create some shares and then evaluate list
filters to ensure we're getting back shares per the
filters. The logic is to:

- Create shares during class setup
- Get list of shares
- Get each share and ensure the list response matches
  the share detail, and the filters are applied
  correctly.

When tests are run in parallel, these steps
pick up resources created elsewhere as well, and
we see some failures. Occasionally, the failures
we see are caused by the fact that a share picked
up in the "list" call is migrated (or is getting migrated)
by the time we perform the validation on the "get" call.
We can be a bit more tolerant in these tests.

Change-Id: Ife979fd1c026a4c28caf72c012871761fe039988
Closes-Bug: #1821945
Signed-off-by: Goutham Pacha Ravi <gouthampravi@gmail.com>
'}]
commit_message:
Fix test failures for "test_list_shares_by_{filter}"

These tests create some shares and then evaluate list
filters to ensure we're getting back shares per the
filters. The logic is to:

- Create shares during class setup
- Get list of shares
- Get each share and ensure the list response matches
  the share detail, and the filters are applied
  correctly.

When tests are run in parallel, these steps
pick up resources created elsewhere as well, and
we see some failures. Occasionally, the failures
we see are caused by the fact that a share picked
up in the "list" call is migrated (or is getting migrated)
by the time we perform the validation on the "get" call.
We can be a bit more tolerant in these tests.

Change-Id: Ife979fd1c026a4c28caf72c012871761fe039988
Closes-Bug: #1821945
Signed-off-by: Goutham Pacha Ravi <gouthampravi@gmail.com>

commit_message:
Replace Delete Force Volume Backup with Force Delete Volume Backup

This patch replaces the Delete Force Volume Backup/Backups with
Force Delete Volume Backup/Backups as Delete Force Volume Backup
looks incorrect. It also drops the usage of unicode prefix from
``admin/backups/tables.py`` file.

Closes-bug: #1919120
Change-Id: I02f88b6444d268253a3888e2ba56a33bb2f51e73

a node's ports, portgroups, volume_connectors, and volume_targets.

commit_message:
Lazy-load node details from the DB

In order to reduce the load on the database backend, only lazy-load
a node's ports, portgroups, volume_connectors, and volume_targets.
With the power-sync as the main user, this change should reduce the
number of DB operations by two thirds roughly.

Change-Id: Id9a9a53156f7fd866d93569347a81e27c6f0673c
(cherry picked from commit 82cab603bbb21d81769cdc4f50d4fa445d026e5c)

commit_message:
Do not use mirror host for Ceph Luminous

Luminous is still used for Debian jobs, but mirror host doesn't provide
the required contents.

Change-Id: I1120e881b0e7844978024ccab03b1f2eab97b098
(cherry picked from commit 8c58e4e304c43ecb66769d3fc34c92c3fd9127ea)
(cherry picked from commit 422facdf13e3ce3f106c95cee370daa024b21b90)

messages:
[{'account_id': 32926, 'date': '2021-03-16 15:27:00.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 32926, 'date': '2021-03-17 07:47:36.000000000', 'content': 'Hashtag added: VFTESTING'}, {'account_id': 27427, 'date': '2021-03-18 12:25:43.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Nice.  Please be sure to set the depends-on of the other patches back to this one so we can see them all related in gerrit.'}, {'account_id': 32926, 'date': '2021-03-18 12:32:20.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

> Patch Set 1:
> 
> Nice.  Please be sure to set the depends-on of the other patches back to this one so we can see them all related in gerrit.


The relation chain takes care of that. As detailed in: 
https://gerrit-review.googlesource.com/Documentation/intro-gerrit-walkthrough-github.html#create-change

The followup patches can only be merged when the previous ones are already in the main branch.
The relation chain is also displayed to the right of the commit msg in the web interface, or as previous commits in the `git log` output.'}, {'account_id': 11491, 'date': '2021-03-18 13:01:14.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 27427, 'date': '2021-03-18 13:03:31.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 16515, 'date': '2021-03-18 13:14:13.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}]

Add sample network data files for network-data-v2

A new directory 'network-data-samples' is added with
sample network data in network-data-v2 format.

Change-Id: I85ab942f0103a8fa2345b637956f9fa5a17aa3aa

[{'created': '2021-02-03 14:55:29.000000000', 'message': "Do not use ironic/nova for generate_fencing

This commit cleans up and simplifies the way fencing parameters
are generated.
We don't try to map baremetal nodes to instances anymore and we simply
generate fencing agents definitions for each node.

commit_message:
Do not use ironic/nova for generate_fencing

This commit cleans up and simplifies the way fencing parameters
are generated.
We don't try to map baremetal nodes to instances anymore and we simply
generate fencing agents definitions for each node.

Change-Id: I362870cd1f0a78049268e5910ffef4dc9424f668

commit_message:
Deprecate legacy policies, update project scoped docs

Deprecates legacy policies which will be removed at a later point in
time. Notes these in a release note which covers project scoped access
enablement, and updates the Secure RBAC docs to cover additional details

Special thanks to Rammstein Radio on Pandora, for without this and all
of the amazing artists it brought to my coding jam sessions, this effort
would not have reached any sort of conclusion in the relatively short
time for such a massive amount of work.

Change-Id: I3bf0fa0de07e19d6058f0299e7abbff91b48b360

commit_message:
Enable TLS between Prometheus and Grafana

This patchset enables TLS path between Prometheus and Grafana.
Grafana pull data from Prometheus. As such, Prometheus is the
server and Grafana is the client for TLS handshake.

Change-Id: I50cb6f59472155415cff16a81ebaebd192064d65

and its dashboard.

messages:
[{'account_id': 20634, 'date': '2021-02-18 07:47:43.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 20634, 'date': '2021-02-23 10:24:32.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 20634, 'date': '2021-02-23 11:56:26.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 31289, 'date': '2021-02-24 12:29:01.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3: Code-Review-1

I landed the nova-cell-controller review with that same failure but now I'm wondering if this might be an issue in zosci?"}, {'account_id': 20634, 'date': '2021-02-24 13:10:21.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

zosci-recheck'}, {'account_id': 20634, 'date': '2021-02-24 13:15:56.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3:

Given that this has slightly different semantics on smoke (this does bionic-ussuri in line with the default from project config and OSCI is doing focal-ussuri), I'm going to ask for a recheck-full to compare results between the two systems."}, {'account_id': 20634, 'date': '2021-02-24 13:16:08.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

charm-recheck-full'}, {'account_id': 20870, 'date': '2021-03-05 14:17:04.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 4: Patch Set 3 was rebased.'}, {'account_id': 31289, 'date': '2021-03-05 15:19:20.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Workflow-1

As stated in earlier comments from me and icey, I think there might be something fishy in this one.'}, {'account_id': 20634, 'date': '2021-03-11 13:21:56.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

charm-recheck'}, {'account_id': 20634, 'date': '2021-03-11 15:58:48.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

charm-recheck'}, {'account_id': 20634, 'date': '2021-03-12 07:28:53.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

charm-recheck'}, {'account_id': 20634, 'date': '2021-03-12 07:30:09.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4:

I have a theory that the allocation pools for the subnet that the tests are run in was the problem, as they weren't including theo whole /16, just x.x.0.x-x.x.20.x. I've updated the allocation-pools to cover the whole subnet so maybe it'll handle pings correctly now"}, {'account_id': 20634, 'date': '2021-03-12 13:15:25.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

charm-recheck-full'}, {'account_id': 20634, 'date': '2021-03-12 13:17:06.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

The above full check is to confirm that bionic-ussuri is working in OSCI'}, {'account_id': 20634, 'date': '2021-03-18 06:30:51.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

Running a recheck after a recent change to the Zuul environment'}, {'account_id': 20634, 'date': '2021-03-18 06:30:58.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

zosci-recheck'}, {'account_id': 20634, 'date': '2021-03-18 09:50:18.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

zosci-recheck'}, {'account_id': 20634, 'date': '2021-03-18 11:15:05.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

zosci-recheck'}, {'account_id': 31289, 'date': '2021-03-18 14:56:02.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1

LGTM now, thanks!'}]
