Code change looks good, but the upstream "status" action has details about resources (not only nodes).

See sample [1] and the output of "crm status xml" [2].

Apart from the "history" parameter, I think a "resource" parameter (default: true) should be added to provide similar details about the resources (name and is_active keys), otherwise, we will lose functionality.

1. https://pastebin.ubuntu.com/p/6hvGHvtND7/
2. https://pastebin.ubuntu.com/p/7GWbCHfNgj/'}, {'account_id': 32363, 'date': '2020-12-16 15:35:41.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 6.'}, {'account_id': 32363, 'date': '2020-12-16 15:39:32.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6:

(1 comment)

Minor comment inline. If manual testing passes on an older openstack version, with an older pacemaker and maybe different? "crm status xml" output (trusty, xenial...), then I'm +1

Regarding further examples on using "jq", that's not a blocker for me but it would be very helpful.
eg. resource groups details:
juju run-action --wait hacluster/leader status --format json | jq -c '.[] | {(.UnitId):.results.result | fromjson | .resources.groups}''}, {'account_id': 32363, 'date': '2020-12-17 17:35:33.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6:

I tested it again, because of the "resources". However my output does not contain resources, but I looked at all release and there was no mention about changing the format of xml output. I found only one comment about printing inactive resources by default (pacemaker 2.0.4: 'Print inactive resources by default with crm_mon xml output.')

        <node name="juju-a7a4e4-2" id="1001" online="true" standby="false" standby_onfail="false" maintenance="false" pending="false" unclean="false" shutdown="false" expected_up="true" is_dc="true" resources_running="0" type="member" />

    </nodes>

        <node name="juju-a7a4e4-2">

    </node_history>

    <bans>

</crm_mon>

Found that a newer version of `crm_mon` changed the root tag if you used `--output-as=xml` instead of deprecated `--as-xml`. Here is the difference between these two outputs:
```bash
1c1
< <pacemaker-result api-version="2.0" request="crm_mon --output-as=xml --inactive --one-shot">
---
> <crm_mon version="2.0.3">
5c5
<     <last_update time="Tue Jan  5 09:27:20 2021"/>
---
>     <last_update time="Tue Jan  5 09:27:34 2021"/>
63,64c63
<   <status code="0" message="OK"/>
< </pacemaker-result>
---
> </crm_mon>
```
I decided to use the version from the `crm_mon_version` function and skip this first XML output tag.
I also provided the full XML output in unit_test because there was a bug in the get_tag function (it does not return an empty element if the tag is not found == None).

Provided test: trusty[1] and focal[2]

---
[1]: https://pastebin.canonical.com/p/dszrcB5YxT/
[2]: https://pastebin.canonical.com/p/T8XgV4d8Kn/'}, {'account_id': 24890, 'date': '2021-01-05 11:03:55.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 9:

commit_message:
Improved action to display the cluster status

The `state` action will provide details about the health of the cluster.
This action has one parameter to display the history of the cluster status,
which is false by default.

Closes-Bug: #1717831
Change-Id: Iaf6e4a75a36491eab8e6802a6f437e5f410ed29e

commit_message:
[stable-only] Remove nova-ceph-multistore to avoid blocking fix

As the fix in Iebbb2dcb767ecf3c965f34f1ca04af20a2039be1 also depends on
I6db86b3e17a6a2f78745b40381b9419fb4404a4e we need to disable this job
until both have landed.

Change-Id: Idab7d0dd051b16d820a4bcf8e443d733467ab273

[{'created': '2021-03-16 10:49:40.000000000', 'message': "Do not write /var/log/ceilometer

This patch reverts If7b88bf51046317171f6fa85bb8c01390fa26a37.

ceilometermiddlware is supposed to use the same logger as proxy-server

commit_message:
Do not write /var/log/ceilometer

This patch reverts If7b88bf51046317171f6fa85bb8c01390fa26a37.

ceilometermiddlware is supposed to use the same logger as proxy-server
and doesn't directly touch log files but rely on rsyslog.

Change-Id: I3e2a8ec96cb7b3befa6d840b0944b6f50203dd9e

is in place for all the of the tested runtimes for xena.

See also the PTI in governance [1].

commit_message:
Update volume type creation bootstrap logic

Verification is added to Cinder volume type creation logic
under Values.bootstrap to make sure the volume_backend_name is
configured in Values.conf.backends.

Change-Id: I1b9b1eaac8df861d28d4121477de148dba6a2dbf

[{'created': '2021-02-15 21:27:22.000000000', 'message': 'Add TLS options for oslo.cache

This patch specifies a set of options required to build a TLS context.
The context built from those options can later on be passed to any of
the oslo.cache backends that supports TLS connections.

commit_message:
Add TLS options for oslo.cache

This patch specifies a set of options required to build a TLS context.
The context built from those options can later on be passed to any of
the oslo.cache backends that supports TLS connections.

Depends-on: https://review.opendev.org/774120
Change-Id: I66df247543f28b4343c15f4e151231c0e100d00a
(cherry picked from commit 44fc5d25c1c9418ed4d82a48380fe6ab8362aee5)

commit_message:
Fix parameters for puppet-memcached-6.0.0

Rename listen_addr to listen; drop notls_listen_addr and
notls_listen_port from version 5.0.0, as they never made it
in into puppet-memcached-6.0.0.

Change-Id: I18bda6b9219ab42543f83c46be7763f98e4dfd0e
Signed-off-by: Moiss Guimares de Medeiros <moguimar@redhat.com>
Co-authored-By: Moiss Guimares de Medeiros <moguimar@redhat.com>
(cherry picked from commit 9be84a2fc268b2a8838f10d740d181e54ede6572)

messages: [{'account_id': 14250, 'date': '2021-03-15 08:37:09.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 14250, 'date': '2021-03-18 14:12:50.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned\n\nsquashed into https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/tripleo-heat-templates/+/779611'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2021-03-15 08:37:09.000000000', 'message': 'Fix memcached firewall condition

The conditions should have used map_merge, this simplifies
them a lot, by passing a list to dport key.

Change-Id: I15cb1f3bbc9e1be90265feab5bfed7f28c1cb1f3
Closes-Bug: #1918891
Co-authored-By: yatinkarel <ykarel@redhat.com>

'}]
commit_message:
Fix memcached firewall condition

The conditions should have used map_merge, this simplifies
them a lot, by passing a list to dport key.

Change-Id: I15cb1f3bbc9e1be90265feab5bfed7f28c1cb1f3
Closes-Bug: #1918891
Co-authored-By: yatinkarel <ykarel@redhat.com>
(cherry picked from commit 2ee68bf9a713d5f4b5b6b73c40633627fb905d6c)

revisions:
[{'created': '2021-03-17 09:06:40.000000000', 'message': 'Remove references to unsupported operating systems

All references to Gentoo, SUSE, Debian stretch and Centos-7  are removed.
Conditional tasks, ternary operators and variables are simplified where possible

commit_message:
Remove references to unsupported operating systems

All references to Gentoo, SUSE, Debian stretch and Centos-7  are removed.
Conditional tasks, ternary operators and variables are simplified where possible
OS specific variables files are generalised where possible

Change-Id: Ibde83024d1c3a7fc2a91ebaa14f33ad1976a7b22

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 27822, 'date': '2019-04-04 01:36:22.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 25820, 'date': '2019-04-05 16:29:53.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 841, 'date': '2019-04-08 10:01:03.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Code-Review-1

This patch changes the calculation of timezone offset considering daylight saving time of today, but it will bring another confusion.
There is no information on the standard time or the daylight saving time is used.

"UTC -08:00  United States (Los Angels) Time" is shown when PST is used and 
"UTC -07:00  United States (Los Angels) Time" is shown when PDT is used, but there is no information.

I would like to see some information on daylight saving time at least.

"%Z" might be helpful, but I am not sure this is the right way. I would like to hear opinions from others.

 In [1]: from datetime import datetime
 In [2]: import pytz
 In [3]: today = datetime.today()
 In [4]: ny = datetime(today.year, 1, 1)
 In [5]: d = datetime(today.year, today.month, today.day)
 In [6]: t = pytz.timezone('US/Pacific')
 In [7]: t.localize(ny).strftime('%z %Z')
 Out[7]: '-0800 PST'
 In [8]: t.localize(d).strftime('%z %Z')
 Out[8]: '-0700 PDT''}, {'account_id': 7130, 'date': '2019-04-08 11:42:30.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3: Code-Review+1

The problem here is that it uses DST instead of Standard Time at this time of the year which confuses the user.   For 4 months, that display is fine when it's in DST because of CURRENT_YEAR,Jan,1st and then the time is wrong the remaining of the year.   That's why I'd rather have the pulldown menu show the proper DST time vs Standard Time all the time.   I think this is better than it was better, it's not perfect but it's better."}, {'account_id': 841, 'date': '2019-04-10 15:16:49.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: -Code-Review

I do not live in an area where daylight saving time is used, so I would like to hear more opinions from others. I am resetting my score.'}, {'account_id': 1736, 'date': '2019-05-29 12:04:07.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 841, 'date': '2019-05-29 12:28:14.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

If all other cores agree this change, the release note is required at least.'}, {'account_id': 841, 'date': '2019-05-29 12:29:04.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3: Code-Review-1

When I dump "res.content", I see "New Zealand Time" instead of "New Zealand (Auckland) Time" in the lower-constraints env. This comes from babel.dates.get_timezone_location(). lower-constraints env uses Babel==2.3.4 and the latest Babel is 2.9.0. I think the failure comes from this difference. I don't know the exact version of Babel changes this, but I believe this is the cause.'}, {'account_id': 841, 'date': '2021-03-17 23:28:23.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 18:

daylight saving offset when displaying the timezones list.

(Note by amotoki)
The minimum version of Babel is bumped to 2.6.0
as Babel 2.3.4 returns "New Zealand Time" instead of "New Zealand
(Auckland) Time" returned from the latest Babel (2.9.0).
It is not a good idea to handle such difference in Babel in our UT
and there is no reason to stick to Bump 2.3.4.
2.6.0 was chosen as it is available in Ubuntu Focal and there is
no more reason than this.

Change-Id: I0600086cc51cf5abcf1631565e75146114189667
Closes-bug: #1822849
'}]
commit_message:
Get the timezone offset for the current day instead of January 1st.

This bug only appears to be a cosmetic one where the TZ offset
would be calculated on current_year/01/01 so would remain in
daylight saving offset when displaying the timezones list.

(Note by amotoki)
The minimum version of Babel is bumped to 2.6.0
as Babel 2.3.4 returns "New Zealand Time" instead of "New Zealand
(Auckland) Time" returned from the latest Babel (2.9.0).
It is not a good idea to handle such difference in Babel in our UT
and there is no reason to stick to Bump 2.3.4.
2.6.0 was chosen as it is available in Ubuntu Focal and there is
no more reason than this.

Change-Id: I0600086cc51cf5abcf1631565e75146114189667
Closes-bug: #1822849

commit_message:
Update master for stable/wallaby

Add file to the reno documentation build to show release notes for
stable/wallaby.

Use pbr instruction to increment the minor version number

commit_message:
Remove references to unsupported operating systems

All references to Gentoo, SUSE, Debian stretch and Centos-7  are removed.
Conditional tasks, ternary operators and variables are simplified where possible
OS specific variables files are generalised where possible

commit_message:
Allow to install os-ken from git repo

os-ken is used by neutron ML2/OVS agent.
We need to install os-ken from source to test os-ken changes
against neutron. We already have tempest-integrated-networking job
in os-ken repo but it turns out it consumes os-ken from PyPI :-(

Change-Id: Ibcff212591e9fed25f1316403627269d81455b09

subject: Update TOX_CONSTRAINTS_FILE for stable/wallaby
messages: [{'account_id': 23851, 'date': '2021-03-18 12:13:11.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2021-03-18 10:27:03.000000000', 'message': 'Update TOX_CONSTRAINTS_FILE for stable/wallaby

Update the URL to the upper-constraints file to point to the redirect
rule on releases.openstack.org so that anyone working on this branch
will switch to the correct upper-constraints list automatically when
the requirements repository branches.

Until the requirements repository has as stable/wallaby branch, tests will
continue to use the upper-constraints list on master.

Change-Id: Ieef76c74907986dd8ab3db6f8c71a30720819442
'}]
commit_message:
Update TOX_CONSTRAINTS_FILE for stable/wallaby

Update the URL to the upper-constraints file to point to the redirect
rule on releases.openstack.org so that anyone working on this branch
will switch to the correct upper-constraints list automatically when
the requirements repository branches.

Until the requirements repository has as stable/wallaby branch, tests will
continue to use the upper-constraints list on master.

Change-Id: Ieef76c74907986dd8ab3db6f8c71a30720819442

subject: remove unicode from code
messages: [{'account_id': 32291, 'date': '2021-03-04 03:04:56.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 10239, 'date': '2021-03-04 14:40:13.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 23851, 'date': '2021-03-18 12:12:23.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2021-03-04 03:04:56.000000000', 'message': "remove unicode from code

In Python 3, all strings are represented in Unicode.In Python 2 are
stored internally as 8-bit ASCII, hence it is required to attach 'u'
to make it Unicode. It is no longer necessary now.'

Change-Id: I4d475c4ed3c79539c2bc383462f1ffca1e420520
"}]
commit_message:
remove unicode from code

In Python 3, all strings are represented in Unicode.In Python 2 are
stored internally as 8-bit ASCII, hence it is required to attach 'u'
to make it Unicode. It is no longer necessary now.'

Change-Id: I4d475c4ed3c79539c2bc383462f1ffca1e420520

Since we copy all release notes to the integrated repo there is not need
in publishing release notes for each repository. We should only verify their
validity and linting.

commit_message:
Fix CinderVolumes.create_and_attach_volume

The server is always soft deleted when executed testcase
CinderVolumes.create_and_attach_volume, and it will fail.
This patch fixes it.

Change-Id: I36da9be6321cb096d161bf8816733a2a0c8032a4

[{'created': '2021-03-01 10:03:15.000000000', 'message': "Fix multi-backend configuration

At the moment, the enabled backends' names list is written in the config file
as a space-separated list.

When using multi-backend, the current Manila charm crashes because the config
`enabled_share_backends` needs to a comma-separated list of backend names instead:
https://docs.openstack.org/manila/victoria/admin/shared-file-systems-multi-backend.html

Change-Id: I881d12ad4cea044e232b9f997a4dfc4b2f38e9c8
"}, {'created': '2021-03-15 09:25:09.000000000', 'message': "Fix multi-backend configuration

as a space-separated list.

When using multi-backend, the current Manila charm crashes because the config
`enabled_share_backends` needs to a comma-separated list of backend names instead:
https://docs.openstack.org/manila/victoria/admin/shared-file-systems-multi-backend.html

Change-Id: I881d12ad4cea044e232b9f997a4dfc4b2f38e9c8

When using multi-backend, the current Manila charm crashes because the config
`enabled_share_backends` needs to a comma-separated list of backend names instead:

"}]
commit_message:
Fix multi-backend configuration

At the moment, the enabled backends' names list is written in the config file
as a space-separated list.

When using multi-backend, the current Manila charm crashes because the config
`enabled_share_backends` needs to a comma-separated list of backend names instead:
https://docs.openstack.org/manila/victoria/admin/shared-file-systems-multi-backend.html

Change-Id: I881d12ad4cea044e232b9f997a4dfc4b2f38e9c8

commit_message:
Add ZooKeeper stats to Zuul dashboard

This adds the event queue processing time to the zuul dashboard;
that shows the effect of ZK on event processing.  It also adds
several ZooKeeper server performance metrics.

Change-Id: I56196b781e8f7950c3db40647f84d7e8bc6c499d

commit_message:
Update TOX_CONSTRAINTS_FILE for stable/wallaby

Update the URL to the upper-constraints file to point to the redirect
rule on releases.openstack.org so that anyone working on this branch
will switch to the correct upper-constraints list automatically when
the requirements repository branches.

Until the requirements repository has as stable/wallaby branch, tests will
continue to use the upper-constraints list on master.

Change-Id: I51c8ee6ea85411748bf9cbad6f9d767bf8f261f7

commit_message:
Check if no members in pool better in batch update

member_batch_update() might find a loadbalancer with
a pool that contains no members, but calling split(',')
will result in an existing member list of ['']. Force
it to an empty list if there are no members.

Conflicts:
   ovn_octavia_provider/tests/unit/test_driver.py

Closes-Bug: #1912779
Change-Id: Iec46c3e1ebef822d43964e13962153dc8760ee42
(cherry picked from commit 6e30b8552ca83e0424ec460a4b4728cd70505c7a)
(cherry picked from commit d96296752d15d4b89dbaa2357cb14600b84f544a)

All my concerns about the code have been met.  The CI is passing, which gives confidence of no regressions, but the cinder-tempest-plugin isn't running with consistency_group = True in the [volume-feature-enabled] section of tempest.conf.  Would really like to see that this at least passes the tests before approving.

Also, and this can be addressed later, your CI requires us to download and extract a tarfile to view the logs.  You're supposed to have it set up so we can browse the logs and test results directly in a web browser."}, {'account_id': 16186, 'date': '2021-03-17 02:30:00.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

revisions:
[{'created': '2021-03-18 10:28:21.000000000', 'message': 'Update TOX_CONSTRAINTS_FILE for stable/wallaby

Update the URL to the upper-constraints file to point to the redirect
rule on releases.openstack.org so that anyone working on this branch
will switch to the correct upper-constraints list automatically when
the requirements repository branches.

Until the requirements repository has as stable/wallaby branch, tests will
continue to use the upper-constraints list on master.

Change-Id: Ice368ba205025a97c1adaaa6c6195b861f9a068f
'}]
commit_message:
Update TOX_CONSTRAINTS_FILE for stable/wallaby

Update the URL to the upper-constraints file to point to the redirect
rule on releases.openstack.org so that anyone working on this branch
will switch to the correct upper-constraints list automatically when
the requirements repository branches.

Until the requirements repository has as stable/wallaby branch, tests will
continue to use the upper-constraints list on master.

Change-Id: Ice368ba205025a97c1adaaa6c6195b861f9a068f

commit_message:
Remove references to unsupported operating systems

All references to Gentoo, SUSE, Debian stretch and Centos-7  are removed.
Conditional tasks, ternary operators and variables are simplified where possible
OS specific variables files are generalised where possible

Depends-On: Ic31fd78bb5ad9cd484f44e63ba02db7424a500d5
Change-Id: I7c6258673b7b13c15177873fb42080e452eba2d4

Oda-san, Kitamura-san

I agree with your proposal.

Currently, it is converted in each LCM before send_notification is done.

Therefore, I had taken this action according to the above.

I will fix it to include it in the send_notification.'}, {'account_id': 31821, 'date': '2021-02-10 09:52:08.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

commit_message:
Modify notification request parameter name

This patch fixed notification request parameters name that different
from ETSI definition.

Along with this fix, modified an issue where the initial word of
under-score would be changed SnakeCase to CamelCase in common/utils
function.

Closes-Bug: #1914596
Change-Id: Iac04311aee1db7fb5836c32745d29bf63ac5ce20

commit_message:
Update TOX_CONSTRAINTS_FILE for stable/wallaby

Update the URL to the upper-constraints file to point to the redirect
rule on releases.openstack.org so that anyone working on this branch
will switch to the correct upper-constraints list automatically when
the requirements repository branches.

Until the requirements repository has as stable/wallaby branch, tests will
continue to use the upper-constraints list on master.

Change-Id: I61574de912460b8f255134d37236e6c15dcb6bfb

automatically so that master versions are higher than the versions on
stable/wallaby.

commit_message:
Make force_delete configurable in task CreateAndAttachVolume

It seems like CreateAndAttachVolume.run() can't pass force_delete to func _delete_server(),
while kwargs was deprecated and been replaced by create_vm_params, now make force_delete
configurable in task CreateAndAttachVolume

Related-Bug: #1908701
Change-Id: Ief2962d0042bafeedcb8fea7b6f4e658d8eefcef

revisions:
[{'created': '2021-03-15 13:27:52.000000000', 'message': '[swift] Create for all client and non-client lib wallaby branch

This creates the stable/wallaby branch for all client and non-client
libraries
now that we are past the lib freeze on March 11.

If a team wants to wait for a specific patch to make it to the library,
someone from the team can -1 the patch to have it held,or update that
patch with a different commit SHA.

Patches with no response will be merged by Friday, March 19.

Change-Id: I1c5112a0317ea122609fb487392aa35d51251daf
'}]
commit_message:
[swift] Create for all client and non-client lib wallaby branch

This creates the stable/wallaby branch for all client and non-client
libraries
now that we are past the lib freeze on March 11.

If a team wants to wait for a specific patch to make it to the library,
someone from the team can -1 the patch to have it held,or update that
patch with a different commit SHA.

Patches with no response will be merged by Friday, March 19.

Change-Id: I1c5112a0317ea122609fb487392aa35d51251daf

This is the last step to prepare replacement of CentOS8 with CentOS8
Stream. Once we confirm that all CentOS8 jobs succeed then all CentOS8
job will be removed from master by a next commit, because RDO is
supposed to provide Wallaby release only for CentOS8 Stream.

Change-Id: If6214bd0be483138d565ea693e2ec952d4a02451

(6 comments)

Hi Girish,

Few comments in the test and nits in code, we shouldn't be using direct methods to create resources in tests and rather use fake methods.

One important thing that i noticed is that it isn't being tested with tempest because of the following reasons:
1) the CI isn't running cinder_tempest_plugin which contains revert tests
2) ``volume_revert = True`` needs to be set in tempest conf for this to work

Since the unit test just run the code path and not any actual functionality, this feature should be verified with the revert tests in cinder-tempest-plugin else it's not feasible to approve it."}, {'account_id': 32171, 'date': '2021-03-03 16:27:55.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

subject: release Adjutant and Adjutant-UI for Wallaby
messages:
[{'account_id': 10420, 'date': '2021-03-15 02:51:13.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 10420, 'date': '2021-03-15 02:55:28.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2: Commit message was updated.'}, {'account_id': 10420, 'date': '2021-03-15 04:22:49.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 28522, 'date': '2021-03-15 08:32:15.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 308, 'date': '2021-03-15 10:20:26.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

Cycle-with-rc model generally mandates that we do a major bump between series... Holding W+1 until we get a chance to discuss in release management team.'}, {'account_id': 10420, 'date': '2021-03-16 00:52:10.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3:

> Patch Set 3:
> 
> Cycle-with-rc model generally mandates that we do a major bump between series... Holding W+1 until we get a chance to discuss in release management team.

If that's a requirement, then I can update the patch. But in truth I wouldn't have tagged 1.0 even just yet. :P

I'd ideally have had Adjutant at 0.7.0 right now. So my preference for now is keep it 1.* and go to 2.0 when I actually get the time/chance to finally add my async workers for task processing."}, {'account_id': 28522, 'date': '2021-03-16 10:29:24.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: -Code-Review

Hello,

I agree with Thierry we usually start with a major version [1][2] and I think we should continue with that here.

The cycle-with-rc model is the historic OpenStack release model.
In this model, a single release is produced at the end of the development
cycle for inclusion in the coordinated OpenStack release. The major release
number (the X in X.Y.Z numbers) is incremented for each release series.

I don't know exactly why we choosen this rule but think it be worth to continue to follow it until we have a related official discussion and until this point is socialized enough to give a chance to everybody to raise their hands.



[1] https://docs.openstack.org/project-team-guide/release-management.html#services-horizon-plugins-and-other-deliverables
[2]
```
grep -ri 
deliverables/victoria -e cycle-with-rc | awk -F ":" '{print $1}' | xargs cat | grep rc1 | less 
```'}, {'account_id': 28522, 'date': '2021-03-16 10:35:18.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

Here you can find more details about the time where this rule has been added:

https://github.com/openstack/project-team-guide/commit/647bcbdc1cc6456a09a9580b58e51a32fbe7f567'}, {'account_id': 10420, 'date': '2021-03-16 23:00:18.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 4.'}, {'account_id': 10420, 'date': '2021-03-16 23:47:28.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5: Commit message was updated.'}, {'account_id': 10420, 'date': '2021-03-16 23:56:51.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 5:

I've always been a fan of semver style versioning but I don't really mind too much.

Just feels like with the current openstack versioning, we essentially have two whole version numbers we barely touch, and the version number doesn't particularly convey anything useful in terms of API changes or major improvements/differences.

Plus it feels weird when there aren't many actual changes to the service, but it gets a major version bump."}, {'account_id': 28522, 'date': '2021-03-17 09:54:23.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 5:

> Patch Set 5:
> 
> I've always been a fan of semver style versioning but I don't really mind too much.
> 
> Just feels like with the current openstack versioning, we essentially have two whole version numbers we barely touch, and the version number doesn't particularly convey anything useful in terms of API changes or major improvements/differences.
> 
> Plus it feels weird when there aren't many actual changes to the service, but it gets a major version bump.

Thanks for the update.

I love semver too but it doesn't solve everything either. Semver have pros and cons...

From the developer point of view APIs are all the interface provided by a project, from a user point of view APIs are these ones too + the associated user experience (performances, stability, etc...) associated to these APIs and semver doesn't prevent regression on this experience and can't represent them.

Projects can be semver compatible and stick to X<=0 all along their life and never enter into the backward changes lifecycle and never take the risk to stabilize something for their users.

Projects can propose major releases all the time and inform that the UX can be impacted from one series to another. I think that we should mostly consider our current versionning rules like that.

By example, changes on neutron can have several impacts on nova performances even if there aren't many actual major changes into nova. I think that major versions better translate this point. Besides the libs versioning rules (like on oslo.*) are differents and are more respectful of semver and the boths paradigms can cooexist without to much pain

Semver is just a tool that mostly reflect the way that you use it."}, {'account_id': 28522, 'date': '2021-03-17 09:55:09.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 308, 'date': '2021-03-18 09:59:33.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}]

revisions:
[{'created': '2021-02-15 13:55:32.000000000', 'message': 'Use nodepool epel mirror in CI for systemd-networkd package

This is failing often in CI and we should use the mirror when
possible.

The normal variable centos_epel_mirror is not defined in an
openstack-ansible user variable until after the AIO host prep
has happened, so we must detect the nodepool mirror directly
when doing the initial host preparation.

This patch refactors gathering the nodepool vars completely, to
read them into a new ansible var nodepool_vars where they can be
accessed in the whole bootstrap_host role.

Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/755065
Change-Id: Ida3762ffff2140b3e5b287443004fa1f16addd53
(cherry picked from commit ea9e4883cc373770a3644dc830b05aef170f4f0b)
'}, {'created': '2021-02-15 17:18:11.000000000', 'message': 'Use nodepool epel mirror in CI for systemd-networkd package

commit_message:
Use nodepool epel mirror in CI for systemd-networkd package

This is failing often in CI and we should use the mirror when
possible.

The normal variable centos_epel_mirror is not defined in an
openstack-ansible user variable until after the AIO host prep
has happened, so we must detect the nodepool mirror directly
when doing the initial host preparation.

This patch refactors gathering the nodepool vars completely, to
read them into a new ansible var nodepool_vars where they can be
accessed in the whole bootstrap_host role.

Change-Id: Ida3762ffff2140b3e5b287443004fa1f16addd53
(cherry picked from commit ea9e4883cc373770a3644dc830b05aef170f4f0b)

[{'created': '2021-03-17 15:15:26.000000000', 'message': 'etcd3gw refer to a wrong repository

By running the 2 following commands you can observe that etcd3gw is
missing in one case and replaced by renderspec. This is due to a wrong
repo.

`list-deliverables --team oslo --series independent -r`

Change-Id: I2f722641bd3ea844ce5fe8d9091dd67bef45c678

commit_message:
etcd3gw refer to a wrong repository

By running the 2 following commands you can observe that etcd3gw is
missing in one case and replaced by renderspec. This is due to a wrong
repo.

`list-deliverables --team oslo --series independent -r`
`list-deliverables --team oslo --series independent`

Change-Id: I2f722641bd3ea844ce5fe8d9091dd67bef45c678

commit_message:
[reno] Stop publishing release notes

Since we copy all release notes to the integrated repo there is not need
in publishing release notes for each repository. We should only verify their
validity and linting.


Change-Id: I441126861e4f35e6ae1c96d8acf643bf2c453ed3

commit_message:
Fix conditional for ovs

when deploying ovs on compute the mapping might be equals to : "network_mappings": "".
this prevent the tasks to fail.


Change-Id: I8f1407f895ffef7573e8b3b9c72514e2009da594
(cherry picked from commit 55d6b6d74c93a11fe7e1f6aaa0ab045249efda0d)

[{'created': '2021-03-09 09:36:25.000000000', 'message': 'Modify the configuration file

Fixed the problem that "vnflcm_mgmt_driver = vnflcm_noop" does not exist
in /etc/tacker/tacker.conf after installing the tacker.

In setup.cfg, change vnflcm_drivers to vnflcm_driver.
In etc/config-generator.conf, add "namespace = tacker.vnflcm.vnflcm_driver".

Closes-Bug: #1918232
Change-Id: I50ffb4c96837599dcb0d04dd673e0c4681ffedfa

In setup.cfg, change vnflcm_drivers to vnflcm_driver.

commit_message:
Fix typo and missing configure for mgmtdriver

Fixed the problem that "vnflcm_mgmt_driver = vnflcm_noop" does not exist
in /etc/tacker/tacker.conf after installing the tacker.

In setup.cfg, change vnflcm_drivers to vnflcm_driver.
In etc/config-generator.conf, add "namespace = tacker.vnflcm.vnflcm_driver".

Closes-Bug: #1918232
Change-Id: I50ffb4c96837599dcb0d04dd673e0c4681ffedfa

commit_message:
Modify notification request data

This patch fix notification request data in following parameters.

- _links -> vnfInstance, vnfLcmOpOcc
    : fixed because it was initialized before sending
- changedInfo -> metadata
    : added

Closes-Bug: #1905721
Change-Id: Icc2babb04ba67dd4b4fe20ff14e3e5dd2c65338e

commit_message:
Add integrated tests various Neutron deployment scenarios

This patchset implements an integrated test for various deployment
scenarios, both metal and lxc, where applicable. Some test cleanup
has been performed.

The basic server ops tempest test is also included. Expectations are that
the deployed cirros VM will be reachable behind a floating IP internally
for testing purposes (in most cases).

Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/openstack-ansible/+/780458/
Change-Id: I0bdcdef7938183a82ca249f1c95592aea683cf98
(cherry picked from commit 69845d63a023f58beef172a03e48400ed3671742)

revisions:
[{'created': '2021-03-09 23:53:24.000000000', 'message': '[WIP] Add modules for Tacker to fix nfv Zuul job

Tacker has changed its installation to use master branch of
heat-translator and tosca-parser other than pip install with
its requirements.txt.

This patch adds source files of them and also enables binary install
of those packages in the Dockerfile for Tacker.

Closes-Bug: #1918339
Change-Id: I974e1250c6ff745921f3a4f7acba3bee7efc39e4
'}]
commit_message:
[WIP] Add modules for Tacker to fix nfv Zuul job

Tacker has changed its installation to use master branch of
heat-translator and tosca-parser other than pip install with
its requirements.txt.

This patch adds source files of them and also enables binary install
of those packages in the Dockerfile for Tacker.

Closes-Bug: #1918339
Change-Id: I974e1250c6ff745921f3a4f7acba3bee7efc39e4

commit_message:
Create tree for per-component validations

Doing so ensures we have proper responsibilities separation, and allows
to get per-component sub-packaging.

For now, the tree is empty, things will need to be moved around, and
spec file will need some updates as well.

Change-Id: I4fbd8dda1bb3eae3c54dc99abc5c6278e21e6d68

revisions:
[{'created': '2021-02-12 00:59:22.000000000', 'message': 'Use a consistent working dir for deployment

Adds a new cli arg --working-dir, which defaults to:
$HOME/overcloud-deploy-<stack>

The working directory will be used for all files created by the
overcloud deploy command, instead of using tmp dirs and files directly
in $HOME. The working dir provides a single dir for all state associated
with the deployment, which is needed with the transition to using
ephemeral Heat, and especially when combined with
multi-stack/multi-overcloud.

This patch addresses:
- deployment status
- templates
- config-download
- heat-launcher
- overcloudrc

Further patches will address other uses of files outside of working-dir
and migrate them over.

Change-Id: I0d803f695c725c58ef2e6b655753b6c8248d1b2f
Signed-off-by: James Slagle <jslagle@redhat.com>

commit_message:
Use a consistent working dir for deployment

Adds a new cli arg --working-dir, which defaults to:
$HOME/overcloud-deploy-<stack>

The working directory will be used for all files created by the
overcloud deploy command, instead of using tmp dirs and files directly
in $HOME. The working dir provides a single dir for all state associated
with the deployment, which is needed with the transition to using
ephemeral Heat, and especially when combined with
multi-stack/multi-overcloud.

This patch addresses:
- deployment status
- templates
- config-download
- heat-launcher
- overcloudrc

Further patches will address other uses of files outside of working-dir
and migrate them over.

Change-Id: I0d803f695c725c58ef2e6b655753b6c8248d1b2f
Signed-off-by: James Slagle <jslagle@redhat.com>
